loans.name: Mellap

texts.en:
In 2002, Mellap N. A., an enrolled nurse, retired from the Provincial General Hospital of Rift Valley in Kenya and decided to open a medical clinic. The Rapha Medical Clinic, which serves the Nakuru free-area, provides general outpatient services, family planning, immunizations, and maternity services to children and adults who usually live in the surrounding slums.

The clinic is characterized as medium sized, with 4 rooms, each with 2 beds. Not all of the rooms are entirely complete, so Mellap is working to finish them. She employs 1 clinical officer, 1 nurse, 1 support staff, and 1 lab technician and says that the clinic has a moderate patient flow. Mellap would like to expand the clinic, adding another nurse and more beds.

Mellap is requesting a loan of 90,000 Kenya Schillings (1,200 USD) in order to purchase more beds, mattresses, bed linens, complete construction on current rooms, and purchase a septic tank.

A widow since 2001, Mellap has 5 children, all of whom are working adults. One of her sons used to work with Mellap at the clinic but has since moved to another job. Now Mellap works with one of her daughters, who is a registered nurse. A dream of Mellap’s is to have a big hospital, and with a growing maternity ward, she is beginning to see a start to the realization of her dream.

loans.use: To purchase a septic tank, beds, mattresses, bed linens, and to complete renovations.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
“Aside from business development, I also hope to send all my children to school to earn a college degree someday for them to have better future. All my sacrifices are for them. As early as today I want to start saving in preparation for their studies,” Catherine said.  

Catherine U. is a busines-minded woman who is full of hopes and dreams. Part of her dreams is to improve her canteen and somehow expand into buying and selling hogs, which will give her a higher income. 

Catherine admitted that she needs additional capital for the business, in order to develop and expand it in the coming months, and help her husband in providing for their livelihood. For this reason, she is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase pork and add more menu items to her food business, and to be a retailer of electronic/auto load sim cards.

Catherine is 26 years old, and married to Antonio, who is a creative wood carver. They have two children: Carl Andrei – 6 years old and already in the first grade in the primary level; and the younger one is Chales Anthon – 1 year old. 

“Part of my investment will be the renovation of our house in the future,” she added. Considering that their place is prone to flood, she wanted to have a more comfortable and safe house. 

And to further achieve those hopes and dreams, Catherine said, she must work harder and strive more to succeed.

loans.use: To purchase pork for her canteen and be a retailer of sim card loading

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles K. K. is a nurse in Chebunyo, Kenya (near Nakuru). He is married to a teacher and has four children, all of whom are in school. He started the Chebunyo Medical Clinic in Chebunyo in 1990.

Charles received his nursing certificate in 1982 and began working in a mission hospital in town. Eight years later, he saw a need for a local health facility, as at the time all medical facilities were located very far from his community. The Chebunyo Medical Clinic is a four-room facility that provides curative services, medical counseling, out patient care, pre and post-natal care, and family planning services to children and adults in the rural area.

Charles has recently been trained by the Kisumu Medical and Education Trust to provide post-abortion care to women who are suffering from having received poorly performed, illicit abortions. In order to provide the post abortion care services, Charles will need to purchase the appropriate medical instruments and a sterilizer. Charles is requesting a loan of 90,000 Kenya Schillings (1,200 USD) in order to buy these items, as well as to purchase a patient examination couch and improve his clinic with renovations that will add extra space to the facility.

In the future, Charles would like to add a maternity ward to the clinic and grow into a small hospital.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment, a patient examination couch, and to complete renovations.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes N., 36, got into business three years ago. She sells clothes in Owino market in Kampala town. Besides, she is working on a brick laying project as an additional sources of income. She is a widow with six children. She therefore works tirelessly to ensure her children go through school successfully and also has an ambition to construct rental houses that will generate income to help sustain her family.

She would use this loan to purchase more dresses, suits, trousers and skirts to meet the increasing demand of he customers.

loans.use: To purchase more dresses, suits, trousers, and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mrs. Mina M., a resident of Thecho, Lalitpur, lives in an extended family. She has five members including herself in her family. Her father-in-law is a farmer. She has one daughter who attends pre-primary school.

Both Mrs. and Mr. M. are engaged in brass idol-making. They also employ two workers to help with their job. Their job is to decorate brass religious idols. They have got almost three years of experience in this job.

Now Mrs. M. is requesting a first loan of Rs 10,000 to buy different types of raw materials such as wax, bronze, and tools for their work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for their work

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
“I did not lose hope even when I am getting older. I still strive to have better opportunities,” Alice said with a positive view about the future, despite the difficulties in their life. 

Alice is already 46 years old and her husband Tomas C. is 47 years old. They have four children, and the eldest is Angelica, who is 22 years old and did not finish her nursing course due to financial problems, and thus preferred working as saleslady in a certain department store in the municipality to assist her parents. Their second child is Jesusa, who is 20 years old and is already a graduating Information Technology student. She is followed by Gemmalyn, who is 18 years old and only graduated high school and is now working in a drugstore in the same municipality. Timothy is the youngest at 5 years old and is already in grade one. Alice is happy that she has understanding and responsible children and she always prays for their good health and that they are able to pursue their goals in life. She is thankful for the family that she has because they help each other and always understand each other.

To request a loan is the simplest way for Alice C. to raise additional capital for their furniture shop in Alinguigan 3rd Ilagan, Isabela. She helps her husband in running their small furniture shop, which is their only source of income. The loan will be used to purchase the needed materials and additional woods like narra and gemilina for furniture making.

According to Alice, just enjoy life even in midst of difficulties for she believes in the saying that says “poverty is not a hindrance to success”.

loans.use: To purchase wood and other materials for the furniture shop

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul Kipkemoi K. is a nurse who lives in Roret, Kenya (near Nakuru) with his wife and their four children, who are 12, 10, 8, and 6 years old and in school. He runs a small health clinic, the Roret Medical Clinic, which he opened in 1990. There are no other health facilities in the area. Before he started the clinic, Paul was employed by the local missionary.

The Roret Medical Clinic provides curative services, post-abortion care, family planning services, and pre and post-natal care. Paul is requesting a loan of 90,000 Kenya Schillings (1,200 USD) in order to purchase medical equipment, bed linens, and a sterilizer. At present, the clinic does not have running water, so Paul will also use the loan money to install water pipes. He also would like to modernize the clinic and partition off the large rooms to create more space.

In the future, Paul wishes to expand clinic services to include in-patient care.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment, bed linens, sterilizer, and water pipes

loans.name: Bakilaleb

texts.fr:
Monsieur K. est un jeune homme de 23 ans qui a un petit magasin ou il vend des produits d’alimentation générale.  Actuellement, son stock est baissé et il a besoin de le reconstituer pour les fêtes de la fin d’année.  Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 4 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d’huile, et 9 cartons d’eau Voltic.  Avec ces nouveaux produits il peut mieux servir ses clients et gagner un profit.
Monsieur K. est né à Lomé, la capitale du Togo ou il a commencé ce commerce depuis 2007.  Il est marié avec une revendeuse, et ils ont un enfant.
texts.en:
Mr. K. is a young man, aged 23, who has a small store where he sells general food products. Currently, his stock is low and he needs to reconstitute it for the festivals at the end of the year. He is asking for this first loan to buy 4 bags of rice, 2 cans of oil, and 9 cartons of Voltic water. With these new products, he can better serve his clients and earn a profit. Mr. K. was born in Lomé, the capital of Togo, where he began his business in 2007. He is married to a retailer, and they have one child.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul H. is a 32-year-old married father of one child, who is currently in school. To support his family, Abdul has been selling beef in the busy market of Ashaiman to his loyal customers. Abdul has been in this business for the past six years; it is lucrative and therefore he wants to expand the business and include lamb and goat meat in his wares.  H. Abdul is a member of the community group called Wadala ("Enjoyment") Trust Group. Members of this group have agreed to guarantee each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cows, goats and sheep for their meat

loans.name: Tesmarie

texts.en:
Tesmarie lives in the village of Magsaysay Naguillan, Isabela. She is married to Jaymar who is 28 years old and working as an overseas contract worker.  She takes care of their two children: Jaymarie – 7 years old and in grade one; and Maryjay – 2 years old. 

She is engaged in the business of food vending and direct selling. Aside from selling foods, Tesmarie also sells clothes like shirts, skirts, pants, blankets, bed sheets, etc., to her fellow villagers. Sometimes, she also sells some of the products to her friends in the neighboring village.
 
Tesmarie is currently in need of additional working capital to support her business. The loan will be used to purchase additional stock such as short pants, polo shirts, etc. She also plans to buy her own motorcycle so that she can go to other villages to sell her merchandise in a more convenient and faster way.  She hopes that her business will prosper for the education of her children.

“I have a positive mindset that I can earn more income if I could add other varieties of clothes aside from what I have right now,” Tesmarie she said.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for sale and a motorcycle to be used for her business

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
“In everything I do, I always put God first. My wife and I dream of sending our two children to school to finish their college education, improving our house, and having a better future,” says Victor.

Victor acts as the father and mother to their two children: Vielo, 8 years old, an elementary student; and Arvie, 20 years old, a college student. His wife, Divina, is working as a domestic helper abroad. They live in a progressive community of Barangay Magassi Cabagan, Isabela. 

With the help of his wife, he was able to purchase his own tricycle that he operates in their village. This serves as another source of income to them. His income is just enough to meet the daily expenses of their family and as payment for his tricycle loan.

Victor would like to borrow a loan for the maintenance of his tricycle, like gasoline, oil, rubber wheels, chains and sprocket.

loans.use: Maintenance of the tricycle

loans.name: Nasima

texts.en:
Nasima lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She works together with her son; they have a retail shop and Nasima works part-time in their shop in the morning. She works in their shop because her son is in school and after lunch when her son comes from school, he works in their shop. Nasima wants to enlarge their shop.

She wants to take out an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani with a term of 12 months to complete their stock and start working to enlarge their shop to become stronger in her business and help her family better in future.

She is very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan and she plans to continue her partnership with Kiva and AFSG so as to have another shop in future and be a really good retailer in future.

loans.use: To add to their inventory

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
“I felt sad thinking that I have no chance to bear my own child. But still I am hoping and praying for the blessing and mercy of God to me and to my husband that in God’s time we can have our own baby,” Charita said. Though they have no child to invest in, Charita and her husband are doing their best to succeed and have a better future. They are not losing hope to have their ultimate dream – a child for them to become more inspired in work.

Charita V. is already 40 years old, and is married to Jerry who is 41 years old and works as a farmer. They live in Yeban Norte where they have strong family ties with parents, cousins, extended families and other relatives. 

Before she put up a small store in their village, she first ventured into the buy and sell business of recycled products such as empty cans, bottles, plastic and irons. When she got tired of this kind of business, she then shifted into managing a simple village store. Her store is now ten years old and she still wants to improve it. She is hoping to take out a loan as additional capital.  

She is thankful that she can earn a weekly income of PHP3, 000.00 which is being budgeted as a revolving capital and to support their daily needs and their farm.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Ambaroy

texts.en:
Ambaroy B. lives in Khujand. She is the mother of 12 children. She works in the bazaar, selling warm women's wear. She works in her business with her children. They bring the parcels from China and Uzbekistan, and she also goes to Istaravshan to buy merchandise. She has been in business for 15 years.

Mrs. Ambaroy B. is asking KIVA for financial support for her existing business in the form of a business support loan of 2300 TJS for 6 months to import in quantity as it is the season for warm women's jackets.

loans.use: to expand her inventory of warm jackets for women

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu H. K. is a dressmaker in Kampala town. She sews different types of outfits which she supplies to both the retail and wholesale shops in town. She has three sewing machines and has employed three workers to help her construct clothing. This hardworking lady would use this loan to purchase more fabrics to produce garments in large quantities and meet the rising demands of customers.

She is married with two children and looks forward to educating them to university levels. She hopes that the profit from the business enable her to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric.

loans.name: Kudjukalo

texts.fr:
Née à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, Madame K. est une femme de 31 ans qui a pour l’activité la restauration.  Depuis 2006 elle a exercé ce commerce dans le marché de Lomé, et elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES.  Actuellement, ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permit d’acheter 10 ignames et de la viande.  Ces choses sont très importantes dans la préparation de la cuisine locale.  Les Togolais pilent les ignames pour préparer un repas qui s’appelle « fufu», et ils mangent le fufu avec la sauce de viande.  Donc, ce crédit sera très important pour Madame K. de bien vendre ses repas.
Madame K. est mariée avec un comptable et ils ont 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Born in Lomé, the capital of Togo, Mrs. K. is 31 years old and runs a catering business. Since 2006, she has run this business in the market at Lomé, and so far, she has not obtained any previous loans through the organization WAGES. Currently, this first loan she is asking for will allow her to buy 10 yams and meat. These ingredients are very important in the preparation of local cuisine. The Togolese crush yams to prepare a meal called "fufu," which is eaten with meat sauce. Thus, this loan will be very important for Mrs. K. in helping to sell meals. Mrs. K. is married to an accountant, and they have 2 children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams and meat

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
“I wanted to develop a store business in our village but lack of funds stop me to do so, “says Ester.

Ester is 51 years old and a mother of eight children: Jerry – 30 years old, high school undergraduate; Cristopher – 28 years old, college graduate; Maricel – 24 years old, college undergraduate; Rocky – 18 years old, a college student; Haidee – 16 years old, currently a senior high school student; Rhea – 14 years old, sophomore high school student; Jesrael – 11 years old, a graduating elementary student; and Mikaela – 6 years old, already in grade school. The level of living conditions for her family in Sitio Guingab is poor, and the condition of the place where they live is also poor.

Ester’s weekly income is only PHP1,500, and she needs to cover their daily family needs, allowances for her children, and maintenance of their store. Even their farming needs also depend on the income from her store. Thus, Ester decided to take out a loan that will be use as additional business capital to further purchase more stock and additional merchandise to sell in the village and this will definitely generate an increase in income.

“Love one another so that God will love us too” said Ester. For her, loving is one factor she considers towards the success of every endeavor.

loans.use: Additional Capital

location.town: Sitio Guingab, Masipi East Cabagan, Isabela

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
“I must avoid buying things that are not important and I must learn to smile despite the hardships in life in order for me not to look old,” Juanita said with amusement in her eyes. 

Juanita and her family are living happily despite the difficulties that they are experiencing in their village. Juanita R. is 48 years old and married to Teofisto. They have two children: Archie – 24 years old, a college undergraduate; and Darwin – 22 years old, a high school undergraduate.  Life in their village is very difficult especially when the creek between their village and the San Mariano public market overflows. The level of living conditions in their village is poor and is located along the mountain range of Sierra Madre. 

In this mountainous village, Juanita manages a small store which generates a weekly income of PHP1,400.00. The amount is being used to support the daily needs of their family and as revolving capital for her business. Part of her income is also used to purchase other needed supplies for their farm, which is managed by her husband. 

Juanita is planning to venture into the hog raising business for an alternative source of income. With this in mind, she is asking for a loan to make her plans become reality.

loans.use: Start-up capital for hog raising business

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano Isabela

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah N. is a 40 years old businesswoman. She is married with six children, four of whom are working. This lady has been operating a bar and restaurant in Kyengera for over four years to date. She would use this loan to boost her business by purchasing more beers, wines, and spirits. Her greatest dream is to own rental houses in one of the Kampala suburbs, a dream she hopes to achieve by saving some of the profit from the business.

loans.use: To purchase more beers, wines, and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
“God has mercy to those who work hard.” This quotation motivates Imelda to work harder to have a better future. 

Imelda Lumapac is 43 years old and engaged in the selling of second hand RTW’s (ready to wear clothes) in their village. She is married to Dean Lumapac, a carpenter. They have three children who have already stopped their studies due to lack of financial support. They are: Kerwin – 25 years old, high school graduate; Karen – 22 years old, college undergraduate; and Kristel May – 20 years old, a high school graduate. Their village is located 10 kilometers away from the national highway going to Tuguegarao City. 

Weekly, Imelda is earning an average of PHP600 from simply selling her second hand RTW’s to her co-villagers and nearby villages. She wanted to continue her business and somehow improve it so that she will be able to help her husband earn enough income. Aside from maintaining her personal business in the village, during her free hours, Imelda also helps her husband in cultivating the small farm lot in the upland, where they plant corn and rice crops. 

To improve her business and fully support her husband, Imelda is now requesting a loan as additional capital for her business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

location.town: Sitio Guingab, Masipi East Cabagan, Isabela

loans.name: Bileyo

texts.fr:
Madame K. est une jeune femme âgée de 25 ans.  Elle a pour l’activité le vend des produits cosmétiques dans une boutique dans le marche d’Agoè, un quartier de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Elle veut obtenir un crédit afin de reconstituer son stock avec 4 cartons de crème, 3 cartons de lotion, 5 cartons de parfum, et 6 cartons de déodorants.  Commençant ce commerce Depuis  2004, elle a une fois bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES et elle a bien rembourse.
Madame K. est mariée avec un lieutenant et ils ont un enfant.  Avec le revenu de cette entreprise, elle peut aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. is a young woman aged 25. She runs a business selling cosmetic products in a shop at the market in Agoè, an area of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She would like to obtain a loan in order to reconstitute her stock with 4 boxes of creams, 3 boxes of lotions, 5 boxes of perfumes, and 6 boxes of deodorants. Having started this business in 2004, she has benefited from one previous loan through WAGES, which she repaid without incident. Mrs. K. is married to a lieutenant and they have one child. With the income from this business, she is able to help her husband in meeting the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
“I am proud to be a vendor and I wanted to earn more money to have my own stall in our house so that I no longer have to exert effort to roam around the village just to sell my products,” Ernestina said. 

Ernestina C. is already 50 years old. She has been married to Leonardo C. for more than 30 years now.  Their marriage is blessed with two children who are now both married and they are Ma. Elana – 31 years old, college graduate and now working as a teacher; and Melvin – 29 years old who graduated with a vocational course and is now working abroad. 

Ernestina is thankful that her children were able to finish their studies because of her vending business. She earns a weekly income of PHP600 and to further increase her income and save for the improvement of her business, Ernestina is asking for a loan to add to her present revolving capital. 

She also said that she must work hard, together with her husband who is involved in farming, in order to meet their daily needs.

loans.use: Additional Capital

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano Isabela

loans.name: Khuom

texts.en:
Khuom P., 32 years old, lives in Battambang Province. She has two children who are both attending school. She makes a living by raising pigs, as well as distilling and selling Khmer wine for $1 per litre. She is running both businesses well with a steady clientele. She is married to Lok Saloeun, 32, who is a rice farmer. To earn additional income and expand her business, P. has requested a loan to buy nine piglets to breed. The remainder of her loan will be used to make more wine. 

Mrs. P.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: To buy nine piglets

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en:
Dilrabo G. was born in 1972 in Khujand. She is a single mother of 2 pretty children and she is full of enthusiasm. Dilrabo is engaged in selling children's wear in the local bazaar where she has an outlet. She brings her assortment of goods from Istaravshan and the Kyrgyz Republic 2 times per month.

Mrs. Dilrabo G. is asking KIVA for financial support in the form of a business development loan of 450 TJS for 1 month to purchase new inventory and increase her assortment of goods.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of inventory

loans.name: Selima

texts.fr:
Depuis 1993, Madame OURO a vendu les trousseaux bébé à Agoè, un quartier de la capitale du Togo.  Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 120 trousseaux afin de mieux servir ses clients pendant la période des fêtes de la fin d’année.  Elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES, et elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour reconstituer son stock dans le grand marché de Lomé.
Madame OURO est mariée avec un maçon, et ils ont 5 enfants qu’ils soutiennent.  Avec le revenu de son entreprise, la madame aide son mari dans les dépenses du foyer.
texts.en:
Since 1993, Mrs. OURO has been selling babies' clothing in Agoè, an area in the capital of Togo. She is asking for this first loan to buy 120 outfits in order to better serve her customers during the holiday season at the end of the year. She has not asked for any previous loans through WAGES, and she is asking for her first one to reconstitute her stock in the grand market at Lomé. Mrs. OURO is married to a mason, and they have 5 children to support. With the income from her business, Mrs. OURO helps her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy babies' outfits

loans.name: Fariba

texts.en:
Fariba lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She helps support her family. Her husband works part-time as a security guard and she works in tailoring. She has good experience with lots customers and she always tries to work hard in her business. She loves to see her business succeed. She was very weak in her business and day by day, she works hard to have a good business and after the loan she will do it.

When she found AFSG in Kabul she applied for an individual loan of 30,000 Afghans to buy machines and complete her tailoring stock to continue her business to help her family and her husband and make a better future for all members of their family.

She is happy. She wants to say, "I never saw such a great program here in Afghanistan and I am sure that every woman and man who use this loan will have a good future and make a better income for their families, thanks to Kiva and AFSG, with this successful program of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and complete her tailoring stock

loans.name: Toshmamad

texts.en:
Toshmamad B. is 50 years old. He is married and the father of 6 children. Toshmamad is a hardworking and enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and improve day after day. He works hard in his fields, where he spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing his land and spraying to prevent diseases that might affect his yields. Toshmamad needs tools and fertilizers to continue his difficult work of tending his crops so that they can be taken to the capital city for sale. That's why he's applying for a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1,200) for the term of 12 months. Together we can reach out our hands to help Toshmamad!  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

loans.use: Purchasing of mineral fertilizer, plus fuels and lubricants for tools

loans.name: Nanda Kumari

texts.en:
Nanda Kumari M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Nanda Kumari M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two children. Her husband is a farmer and works his own land. She has one son and one daughter. Her son studies in grade 5 and her daughter is in pre-primary school.

Five years ago, Mrs. M. started goat farming. Now she has 5 goats. She sells her goats at the local market. In that region the demand for goats is constantly increasing. So, to take advantage of the opportunity, she needs funds to invest in this work. She is requesting a first loan of Rs 10,000 to buy a few more goats for her business.

loans.use: To buy goats to raise

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
Zafar G. is originally from the town of Istaravshan. For several years he has dedicated himself to sheep breeding. He has attended to this work with great effort in order to maintain his home. He is married with 3 children and has the duty of supporting his family. For this reason he has decided to once again come to IMON International for help in buying sheep to raise. It is his dream to develop his business with more loans and in this way continue to maintain his humble home. At this time he has taken out 2 loans and has repaid them both in a timely manner. Zafar promises to repay this loan in a timely manner, as well, and thanks all Kiva lenders for trusting and supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing more sheep to expand his business

loans.name: Nanda Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Nanda Kumari M., 25 years old, lives in Thecho, Laltipur, Nepal. Most of the people in this area are engaged in agricultural work. Mrs. M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband, one son, and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 3 and her son is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. M.’s husband's name is Mr. Daya Ram M. and he is a carpenter. He makes different types of furniture such as "almirahs" (chests of drawers), tables, beds, etc. Nowadays in that region, the demand for these sorts of furniture is constantly increasing. So Mrs. M. is requesting for her second loan of Rs 15,000 to help her husband buy more lumber for his furniture work.

loans.use: To buy lumber for his furniture-making

loans.name: Usmonkul

texts.en:
Usmonkul is 27 years old and he is a hard worker. He is single with no children. Usmonkul has been farming since he was a young boy, and now he specializes in the cultivation of wheat. He has 10 years of experience, and he has been able to support himself by learning how to care for and manage his crops in the short growing season. Usmonkul aspires to have more farming equipment and supplies so that he can work his land much more productively. Only due to lack of funds has he not been able to do so. So, he is asking for a loan to purchase more farming supplies, such as herbicides, fertilizers and other necessities, in order to appropriately manage his crops and in the end make a profit. This request is in support of making his dream come true, and Usmonkul appreciates your generous help.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Ram Keshari

texts.en:
Mrs. Ram Keshari M. is a 22-year-old woman who lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district of Kathmandu valley. Thecho is one of the backward areas of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and their daughter.

Her husband's name is Dadu Raj M.. He is a carpenter and opened his furniture shop a year ago. All the requirements of the family are met using the shop's income. Therefore Mrs. M. seeks a loan in the amount of Rs10,000 to buy lumber to meet the demand for her husband's furniture. Her husband makes different sorts of furniture such as beds, tables, and chairs.

loans.use: To buy lumber

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat M. sees herself as a calm, hardworking and responsible person. She began her business due to the need for an income additional to her husband’s to cover the household expenses. They have a child who grows each day, as do their economical needs. She began some time ago selling different products and even had a homemade-food shop, which she had to close because of the increase in the shop’s rent. So, one of her friends convinced her to sell clothes and offered to take her to places where she could buy clothes at good prices. She followed her friend’s advice and began to sell clothes 12 years ago. Her sales went very well. She now has a fair number of clients. Muhabbat asks for 1500 Somoni ($450), which she will pay back in 10 months, to purchase seasonal garments. She wants to take advantage of the dates and have a more diverse variety of garments for her clients, which will allow her to increase her sales. 

More information about Tajikistan and IMON International:

loans.use: Purchasing children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Maheshwori

texts.en:
Mrs. Maheshwori M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is one of the under-developed areas of Lalitpur. She lives in an extended family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and one daughter. Her husband, Mr. Rajendra M., is engaged in making brass religious statues.

Mrs. M. opened her tailoring shop seven years ago. She makes different types of custom-fitted ladies' dresses in her shop. She prefers to make women's clothes such as kurta-salwar, blouses, petticoats, long dresses and dresses for newborn babies. Mrs. M. had six months of training in tailoring from a local tailoring shop. She is now asking for a loan in the amount of Rs 30,000 to buy raw materials like cloth, thread, and a cutting machine for her tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Noriniso

texts.en:
Noriniso has a successful business selling clothing for children at the market in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. She is married with two sons. Difficult living conditions forced her husband to leave for Russia to earn a living.

Therefore, Noriniso has to work hard to help provide for her family. She decided to start her own business about 12 years ago. With the busy winter season approaching, Noriniso has requested a loan to help purchase a new supply of winter clothing for children to sell in her business. Noriniso is counting on your generous heart.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. loans.use: To purcahse children's clothing

loans.name: Cheri Main

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheri Main M. lives in a nuclear family in Thecho with her husband, son, and daughter. Thecho is located in the Lalitpur District. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Cheri's husband, Mr. Hari Gopal M., is a farmer. He works his own land. Both her son and daughter are in grade 12 in school.

Mrs. M. opened her own tailoring shop 2 year ago. She prefers to make custom-fitted lady's clothes like "kurta-salwar", blouses and other varieties of lady's dresses in her shop. She took tailoring training from a local tailoring shop. Now she is asking for her second loan from Kiva of Rs 20,000 to buy raw materials such as cloth, thread, etc. for her tailoring work. She repaid her first Kiva loan in November 08.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Mubashira

texts.en:
Y. Mubashira has had her own business for 12 years. She runs a clothing business at the clothing market of Istaravshan, Tajikistan. She and her husband have three children - a son and two daughters. Her business is an important source of income for her family.

Mubashira's income helps her to build, little by little, a dowry for her two daughters. They are growing up and will soon be eligible to marry. Lending services from IMON International lent key support for Mubashira as she has developed her business. She has proven to be a great client and has maintained a perfect payment record. Mubashira is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) to boost her available capital so she can purchase new inventory. We are grateful for the opportunity to further assist in the success of this dedicated entrepreneur.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. History of note includes: it was once a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki; and the birthplace of the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). loans.use: To purchase clothing for women

loans.name: Munavvarkul

texts.en:
Munavvarkul U. is 50 years old. He is married with 3 children. Munavvarkul lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan and has two hectares of land on which he cultivates cereals and vegetables. His wife and elder son help him on the plantation.

He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy seeds to plant onions and wheat. Therefore, he has decided to ask for a loan. He will also buy fertilizers and hire some workers to cultivate his field. You could become an important part of his family's life. Munavvarkul deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. History of note includes: it was once a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki; and the birthplace of the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.en: Rukiya N. is 45 years old and is married to a retired government employee. They have 3 children. Rukiya sells cereals like groundnuts, beans, peas, and rice in the Nakasero market in Kampala. She purchases her stock directly from upcountry farmers at a fair price, which enables her earn a good profit. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of cereals to meet the rising customer demand and also to hedge against the speculated rise in the purchase price of cereals. This hardworking lady owns a residential house of her own and she hopes that the increased income from her business will enable her to raise poultry in her home within the coming year.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of cereals .

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine N. is a 45-year-old mother of two. She set up her business of selling plastics 9 years ago. Hardworking N. will use the loan to purchase more plastics for her shop and thus expand her business. She is the owner of a plot of land in Kampala and she hopes that the income from her increased business will enable her to construct rental houses, a stable source of income in the country.

loans.use: Purchase more plastics.

loans.name: Nakabugo  A-Mary Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. (far right) is a 34-year-old married mother of five children between ages of one and 18 years. Initially, hardworking Sarah fried pancakes which she sold to the shops in her locality. Selling pancakes earned her the capital to venture into the poultry business. She has been breeding broilers for three years. She also runs a brick-making project in her home. Both her businesses are cost-effective because she conducts them at home with the help of family members.

The major business challenge Sarah faces is insufficient funds.  The loan proceeds will enable Sarah to purchase more broilers for her farm.  She dreams of expanding her poultry farm from just raising broilers to raising layers and exotic breeds. She hopes to see her children reach higher levels of education and also wants to give them a decent residence for a home.

loans.use: Purchase more broilers for her farm.

loans.name: Nakabugo A-Rashida Nakitende Group

texts.en:
Rashida N. (far right) is a hardworking business lady of 24. She is married to a city taxi driver and is the mother of two children, ages 2 and 5. The couple is also looking after three orphaned children of her husband’s late brother.  Rashida wants a happy, healthy, educated, and supported family.  

She rears poultry broilers at home, from which she earns some income to sustain her family. To prevent the loss of her poultry to diseases, she ensures good hygiene, healthy feeds and regular vaccination. She will use the loan to purchase maize brand feeds for the poultry. Rashida hopes that when her business generates more profits, she will be able to buy layers so that she can supply eggs to the retailers in her locality.

loans.use: Purchase maize brand feeds for the poultry.

loans.name: Nakabugo A –Nalongo Group

texts.en:
Tamale N., age 46, breeds poultry and livestock. She has been in this business for 18 years. Her farm is located in her own compound, and includes local breeds of cattle, goats, pigs and broilers (chickens). N. is an enlightened businesswoman who has kept her business running by keeping proper stocks and account records. From the sale of 100 broilers, she earns a profit of approximately UGX 80,000. N. is using the loan to purchase more broilers to meet her customers' demands.She hopes to expand her business by bringing in a variety of breeds like freshians, broilers and layers. 

She also operates a brick-making project in her home, from which she has created employment for four men as brick-makers. She is married and has 9 children between the ages of 7 and 26. Her dream is to see all her children go through life successfully.

loans.use: Purchase more broilers

loans.name: Bulaga B- Evelyne Group

texts.en:
33-year-old Sarah N. is married with 3 school-going children between the ages of 6 and 13. When she acquired dressmaking skills from her husband two years ago, she opened a unisex boutique in Bulaga. She makes both ladies and gents clothes from local fabrics, like bitenge, tie-dye, and batik. 

She is using the loan to expand her business by purchasing both new and second-hand ready-made clothes to meet the needs of customers from all consumer segments. 

Sarah earns an average profit of UGX 50,000 each week, from which she pays monthly rent of UGX 60,000. She is a very hard-working and committed woman who aspires to venture into the importation of fine clothes from overseas markets like Dubai, U.K, and the U.S.A. Her goal is to see her children go through the best schools and attain quality education at all levels.

loans.use: To purchasing new and second-hand ready-made clothes

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine A. A. is a 28-year old woman who lives in Rongo, Kenya, where she runs a poultry business. She raises the chickens at her residence and sells them from a chicken coop stand near the Rongo matatu stage. (Matatus are large vans that function as buses, so a matatu stage is similar to a bus station.)

Originally, Christine raised poultry for domestic use, as food for her husband and herself. When she discovered that there is a high demand in the area for poultry, Christine decided to make what was a side project into a major business. Christine employs one woman to help sell the chickens. Local restaurants are her main customers, though individual consumers are also strong buyers.

A large cock will sell for around 600 Schillings while a medium one will sell for 300. The poultry business is booming and Christine can barely keep up with demand, selling about 30 chickens in a day. She wants to be able to expand into a bigger business, with a bigger coop and more chickens. Christine is requesting a loan of $150 USD in order to expand her current chicken coop and purchase more poultry. It is cheaper to raise the animals rather than purchase them, so she wants to be sure to have enough chickens in order to be able to be selling a large amount, while still producing enough eggs to raise chicks from.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and to expand chicken coop

loans.name: Bulaga B-Lucy Mpagi Group

texts.en:
After working as a nursery teacher two years ago, Lucy M. saved enough capital to start selling cereals in small quantities in the nearby local markets. She is 34 years old and a single businesswoman. She sells cereals, like soya, millet, rice, and oats. Her business is affected by insufficient funds and, hence, earns her an average of only UGX 20,000 each week. 

Lucy is using her loan to purchase more soya, millet, rice and oats. She gets her stock from the Masaja Mumia food industry in Entebbe.  A polite and humble Lucy also aspires to set up her own food industry some day, from which she will be in position to set up a residential house.

loans.use: Purchase more soya, millet, rice and oats.

loans.name: Bulaga B-Pauline Group

texts.en:
Pauline N., age 30, operates a fast-moving consumer goods grocery shop on Bulaga Mityana Road. She also offers tailoring services under the same roof. It is the income from tailoring that enabled her to start her grocery business. She is very skilled at making traditional outfits for both gents and ladies from bitenge, bikoi, and bark cloth.

Due to insufficient funds, Pauline lacks most of the essential commodities in her grocery shop. However, the loan is now helping her stock both soft drinks and alcohol. She is so excited to be able to replace the home-boiled drinking water that she used to sell to her customers cheaply with bottled mineral water that she buys in cartons from various beverage companies. 

Married with four children between ages of 8 and 10, she works tirelessly to ensure that her children's needs are met. She hopes that, with a good turn of events, she will one day open a large wholesale shop offering a variety of fast-moving consumer goods to retailers. With enough savings, she will, no doubt, build a modern residence and ensure that her children get the best education.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and alcohol.

loans.name: Mwanaisha's Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha Hukongo, age 40, is a divorcee with one son age fifteen. She also takes care of her mother and her father. She has a food business which she started 6 years ago, and she works daily from 6am until 1pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 292.

This will be Mwanaisha’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her stock and she repaid the loan successfully. She now hopes for the second loan to buy more foods for her food business.

Mwanaisha will share this loan with her subgroup Kariakoo, which has five members who have shops or are tailors or sell clothes. The members of the subgroup hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mwanaisha is 2nd from left, behind.

loans.use: To buy more foods for her food business

loans.name: 2000-8 Group

texts.es: En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado en el centro focal de Senkata a éste pertenece la asociación denominada “2000-8”, grupo formado por doce miembros que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad. La mayoría de ellas se dedica al comercio de una variedad de productos, que los comercializan en puestos fijos y tiendas de barrio, adquieren productos de mayoristas para luego venderlos por unidad. Ahora ellas necesitan mayor capital para comprar productos al por mayor de este modo sus ganancias serán también mayores y así poder generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The "2000-8" group, comprising 12 hard-working people, is based in the Senkata neighborhood of the city of El Alto.

Most of the members are in the retail business; they buy products wholesale and sell them retail via stalls and shops. Now they need more capital to buy products wholesale, which will give them a bigger margin and enable them increase their incomes for the benefit of their families.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Rashid's Group

texts.en:
Rashid Mizungi, age 30, is married with one child of four. He has a welding business which he started 18 years ago and he works daily from 7am until 6pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 285.

This will be Rashid’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy materials for making gates, doors, and windows and he repaid the loan successfully. He now hopes for a second loan to open a shop to start selling things like saucepans, stove, and frying pans.

Rashid will share this loan with subgroup A of the Tunaweza group. The subgroup has 2 members; the other one sells clothes. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Rashid is the man.

loans.use: To open a shop for selling thing like saucepans, frying pans, and stoves

loans.name: Bartolina Sisa Group

texts.es:
Quince miembros forman parte de la asociación “Bartolina sisa” , esta  pertenece al centro focal  Santiago II, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto. 
Existen diferentes actividades dentro el grupo por ejemplo la venta de dulces, venta de F., pero la actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de  comida. Preparan almuerzo variados y los venden todos los días, pero con la venta de estos alimentos solo consiguen ingresos mínimos para cubrir gastos diarios tanto de sus casas como de sus negocios, necesitan mayor capital para ampliar su producción, por lo que necesitan comprar insumos en mayor cantidad,  de esta manera conseguir mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The "Bartolina Sisa" association comprises 15 members; it is located in the Santiago II neighbourhood of the city of El Alto.

The group members engage in a variety of activities, including the sale of sweets, and the sale of flowers, but they principally cook and sell food. They prepare varied lunches which they sell every day; this provides a small revenue to cover the day-to-day expenses of their homes and businesses.

Now they need more capital to expand production. They plan to buy larger quantities of raw materials with a view to increasing revenues and improving their living standards.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Copo de nieve” pertenece a la familia de  pro-mujer hace dos años aproximadamente,  cumpliendo con 5 ciclos de crédito, esta  se encuentra en la zona de Villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con 12 miembros activos y han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la elaboración y venta de comida, costura de variedad de prendas, además de la venta de fruta, también la venta de verduras, casi todas realizan sus ventas de forma ambulante.
La asociación copo de nieve, afirma que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de mercadería en mayor cantidad, de esta manera aumentaran sus ganancias con el único objetivo de mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
The "Copo de Nieve" (snowflake) association has been part ot the "Pro-mujer" family for about 2 years. It has had 5 loans to date. It is located in the Villa Exaltación area of the city of El Alto.

Its 12 active members have proven themselves capable of meeting their repayment schedules promptly. There are a number of different businesses within the association: production and sale of food, sewing garments, and the sale of fruit and vegetables, mainly in the street.

The "Copo de Nieve" association says it needs more capital to buy larger amounts of merchandise so as to increase earnings and thus improve its members' economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise bulk

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: La Sr. Ana tiene 47 años de edad, habita en el barrio primavera, estado en la capital de Managua, es madre  soltera con dos hijos de 20 y 23 años de edad que están trabajando, Los planes para su familia es terminar la construir   su casa. Doña Ana tiene un pequeño negocio una comediría desde hace cinco años desde horas muy tempranos tiene abierto su comedor para aprovechar a sus clientes con el desayuno, trabaja de esa forma y así a logrado que sus hijos salgan a delante en la vida, lo inicio con financiamiento. Con esta solicitud de préstamo  quiere remodelar su negocio, va hacer un bajarete y embaldosar, para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Así como comprar materia prima para seguir elaborando ricos y variados platillos. A largo plazo espera captar mas clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Ana is 47 years old, and lives in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is a single mom with two children who are 20 and 23 years old, and who also work. The plan for her family is to finish building their house. Doña Ana has had a small business eatery for five years. She opens her diner very early in the morning to to take advantage of its breakfast clients, and has worked in this manner with her children in order to manage to get through life. She began her business with a loan. With this loan request she wants to remodel her business, including tiling, and building a porch in order to improve her service to her clients. She is also going to buy commodities to continue baking a rich variety of dishes. In the long term, she expects to attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer bajarete y embaldozar

loans.name: Frida Alicia

texts.es: La Sr. Frida tiene 36 años de edad, habita en  un barrio de la capital de Managua llamado Hugo Chávez, estado civil casada, tiene una hija de 18 años de edad que es independiente Sus planes para con la familia es terminar la construir  su casa y brindar seguridad a ella y sus seres queridos .Doña Frida se desempeña como secretaria en una empresa privada, los planes en el ámbito laboral es crecer como profesional  aspirando a un mejor puesto, para obtener mejores ingresos. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra invertir en su vivienda comprando materiales de construcción como: cementos, hierros, bloques, hierro entre otros, para hacer su cocina ya que es que es de zinc, y plástico e insegura,  sus metas se estarán realizando, al tener una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Frida is 36 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Hugo Chávezo in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is in a civil union and has a daughter who is 18 and independent. Her goal for her family is to finish building their house in order to provide security for her and her loved ones. Doña Frida holds a position as a secretary in a private business, and her goal for her work career is to grow professionally, aspiring to better positions in order to obtain a better salary. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic, a partner of Kiva, she will manage to invest in her housing, buying construction materials such as cement, iron, and blocks, along with other materials, in order to remodel her kitchen, which is currently made from corrugated iron and plastic and is insecure. Her goals will be realized, and she will have a decent home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer cocina de concreto

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua.  Norma is 40 years old and single; she lives at home with her parents. Norma has a workshop in her house where she sews clothing. She makes custom-fitted dresses and suits. She also participates in another business with other people; they embroider handbags and blouses to export to other countries.  Norma needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy a variety of fabrics.  Norma dreams of directly exporting her work and of going on a Caribbean vacation.

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Norma es socia D. Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. 
Norma es soltera, tiene 40 años y vive en casa de sus padres, Norma tiene un taller de confecciones de prendas de vestir, que esta ubicado en su casa, confecciona vestidos, ternos a medida. Además junto a otras personas se dedican a la elaboración de tejidos bordados, como carteras, blusas que exportan a diferentes países. 
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas variadas. 
Norma sueña con exportar directamente sus productos e ir de vacaciones al caribe.

loans.use: Buy a variety of fabrics

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: El Sr. Abraham tiene 40 años de edad, habitante del barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casado,  su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 2, 10 y 15 años de edad. Los planes para con su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida, ofrecerle seguridad y una mayor comodidad mediante un préstamo para construir completamente su casa,  con la solicitud de préstamo va  a comprar  materiales de construcción  como: cementos, hierros, bloques que se requieren para terminar de hacer su casa ya que solo tiene el arranque de piedra con hierro, su techo es de zinc y parte forrado con plástico, este préstamo va hacer de gran benefició y lograra cumplir esas metas. Don Abraham se desempeña como vendedor de especies independiente desde hace seis años, inicio su pequeño negocio con fondos propios y ahora desea la ampliación de su negocio con nuevos productos y nuevas rutas de distribución. Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra ofrecerle a su familia una mayor comodidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
Señor Abraham is 40 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Villa Reconciliación in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. He is married and he and his wife have three children who are 2, 10 and 15 years old. His goal for his family is to improve their quality of life, provide security, and increase their comfort by means of a loan to completely rebuild their house. With this loan request he is going to buy construction materials like cement blocks and iron that are needed to finish the construction of his house, which is currently only made of stone with iron, and his roof is corrugated iron and partly covered with plastic. This loan will be a huge benefit and will help accomplish his goals. Don Abraham has held a position as a vendor for six years, starting his own small business with his own funds, and now he wants to grow his business with new products and new distribution routes. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, a partner of Kiva, he will be able to provide his family increased comfort and security.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para terminar de hace su casa

loans.name: Marcos  Roberto

texts.es: Sr. Marcos tiene 42 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua  llamado Villa Sur, casado, su esposa es promotora de venta, tiene un hijo de 7 años que esta  estudiando. Los planes que tiene para su familia es asegúrales un patrimonio mejor para su esposa y hijos. Don marcos se desempeña como taxista desde hace diez años, abecés la ruta esta mala y andamos por toda la ciudad buscando cliente, los días buenos son los días de pago,  sus objetivos económico es comprar otra unidad de taxi, aumentar sus ingresos, aspirando a un mejor trabajo y seguir con el progreso de su vivienda, en estos momentos necesita comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques .hierro  hacer su casa de concreto ya que la que tiene es de tabla  y esta en mal estado  y insegura Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra que su casa este segura y sus familia protegida. Para nuestra empresa  es importante el desarrollo de nuestros clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Marcos is 42 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Villa Sur in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. He is married, and his wife is a product demonstrator. He has a son who is 7 years old and in school. His goal for his family is to assure his wife and children a better heritage. Don Marcos has held a position as a taxi driver for ten years, although sometimes the route is bad and he walks through all of the city looking for clients. The good days are paydays. His economic objectives are to purchase another taxi car, augment his salary, and aspire to a better job in order to continue the progress in remodeling his house. To do this he needs to buy construction materials like cement, blocks, and iron to re-make his house out of concrete, since his house is currently made of wood and is in bad shape and insecure. Thanks to loans from Afodenic, a partner of Kiva, he will obtain a secure house and a protected family. For business the development of clients is important.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer su casa de concreto

loans.name: Janorys Paola

texts.es: La Sr. Janorys tiene 20 años de edad, habita en el barrio Enrique Smith,  en la capital de Managua, soltera, sus planes es seguir con sus estudios en la universidad y aspirar a mejores opciones de trabajos y proyectos para aplicar dentro de su propio negocio  venta de cereales,  tiene  ocho años en las  ventas. Lo inicio con fondos propio, su madre  la apoyo para que tuviera su propio tramo ya que ella tiene un tramo también  su. Sus metas para el futuro es ampliar su negocio con nuevos productos y la captación de nuevos clientes para aumentar sus utilidades. Con la solicitud del préstamo va a Comprar  verduras, frutas, y granos básicos para tener siempre surtido y ofertar a sus clientes. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra que negocio comercialice a un amplio mercado en lo general.
texts.en:
Señora Janorys is 20 years old and lives in the neighborhood called Enrique Smith, in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is single. Her goal is to continue studying in a university and she aspires to better job options and projects to apply within her own cereal sales business, which she has had for eight years. She began her business with her own funds while her mother supported her so she could have her own sales, and her mother has her own sales now too. Her goal for the future is to expand her business with new products and attract new clients to increase her profits. With the loan she is requesting, she is going to buy vegetables, fruit, and basic grains so she can always have an assortment to offer her clients. Thanks to loans from Afodenic, a partner of Kiva, she will achieve the commercial business to broaden her general market.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar frutas y verduras para surtir su tramo

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Sr. María tiene 24 años de edad, habita de un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Memorial Sandino, madre soltera, tiene una niña de 5 años de edad. Sus planes para su familia es brindarle un patrimonio a su hija y que tenga seguridad y protección en su vivienda.
Doña María se desempeña en una empresa de la zona franca desde hace dos años de experiencia laboral, sus objetivos  es cambiar de trabajo a, para ganar mejor, ya que se trabaja mucho y de pies, cansada, pero su pago es poco. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para invertir  en la   comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro y bloque, arena y otros para construir su casa. Y poder gozar de un techo digno.
texts.en:
Señora María is 24 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Memorial Sandino in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is a single mother, and has a daughter who is 5 years old. Her plan for her family is to offer patrimony to her daughter and to have security and protection in her home. Doña María has been employed in a duty-free business for two years. Her objective is to change jobs in order to earn more, because she currently works a lot and is on her feet until she is exhausted, but her salary is small. With this loan request she will invest in construction materials such as cement, blocks, iron, sand, and other housing construction materials in order to build her house and to enjoy a decent roof.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer su casa

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es: La Sr. Maria tiene 25 años de edad, habitante de barrio Healeah, en la capital de Managua,  estado civil soltera, tiene un niño de 2 años de edad. Sus planes para con su familia es brindarle seguridad, protección Doña María se desempeña como vendedora de ropas, zapatos, cosméticos y platería desde hace cinco años vende,  inicio con bienes propios. Sus metas  en el aria del negocio es incrementar el volumen de venta y así a la misma vez aumentara sus utilidades. Gracias a los  préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción para construir un porche y así tener más espacio y seguridad para su familia
texts.en:
Maria is 25 years old and lives in Healeah neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She is single and has a 2 year old son. Her plans are to provide security for her family, and she does this by selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics and silver. She has been selling for 5 years, and began with her own funds. Her goals for her business are to increase the volume of sales and at the same time increase her usefulness. Thanks to Afodenic’s loans she will be able to buy building materials to build a porch and subsequently have more space and security for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Arelis

texts.es: La  Sr. Arelis tiene 43 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Hialeah de la capital de Managua, madre soltera, tiene una hija de 16 años de edad que actualmente estudia. Sus planes para su familia dejarle un patrimonio a su hija y mejorar en la actualidad el nivel de vida de su familia. Doña  Arelis posee su pequeño negocio de venta de mariscos, cosméticos, ropa, zapatos, hielo y helado en su casa de habitación desde hace cinco años, iniciándolos con fondos propios. Sus metas para su negocio es ofertar mayor volumen de producto y comprar  nuevos productos con esta solicitud de préstamo como cosméticos, ropa variada. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar mayores cantidades de mercadería y así captar nuevos clientes, lo cual generaran mayores utilidades y mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
Arelis is 43 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua, the capital city. She is a single mother with a 16 year old daughter who studies in school. Her plans are to leave a legacy for her daughter and improve the standard of living for her family. Arelis owns a small business selling seafood, cosmetics, clothing, shoes, ice and ice cream from her home. She has had her business for 5 years, beginning with her own funds. Her goals for her business are offer a large volume of products and buy new products. With this loan she will buy a variety of clothing and cosmetics. Thanks to Afodenic’s loans she will be able to buy larger quantities of merchandise and in this way gain new customers, which will generate more income and improve her family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for children and adults and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to start a motorcycle-taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions and ginger to resell

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 24 años, esta separada de su pareja con la cual tuvo una hija llamada Angy de 3 años de dad.  Se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías, generalmente a bordar tapetes, los cuales vende en las ferias de la ciudad y también distribuye por pedido, desde hace 5 años.
Irma siempre se ha destacado por su creatividad, la cual plasma en cada uno de los bordados que realiza, los cuales son muy cotizados por la clientela debido a sus acabados finales tan bonitos. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es elaborar cantidades de bordados para cumplir con todos los pedidos que le hacen. Irma se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de tela (Bayeta), hilos, etc., para elaborar sus bordados y lograr mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Irma is 24 years old. She is separated from her husband with whom she has a daughter, Angy of 3 years old. She makes handicrafts, generally embroidery mats. She’s been selling them at the town fairs or making them upon request for the last 5 years. Irma has always been popular in this activity for her creativity, which can be observed on each of her embroideries, which are always on demand among her customers, thanks to her beautiful detailed endings. The hardest part of her work is to finish on time all her customers’ requests. This is her fist loan request from Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to purchase larger amounts for fabric (Bayeta), threads, etc., to make more pieces of embroidery and to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for her embroideries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruit and spices

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús tiene 48 años, vive solo ya que migró de la ciudad de Arequipa, hace 3 años. Es un hombre muy trabajador que desde que llegó a la ciudad de Puno, no ha hecho más que trabajar y trabajar en busca de un mejor porvenir, es así que desde hace un año se viene dedicando a brindar servicio de taxi para solventar sus gastos. A Jesús le gusta su trabajo, ya que le no es rutinario y puede visitar diferentes lugares transportando a sus clientes. Para suerte de Jesús, es muy solicitado por los clientes que prefieren de su servicio, es por eso que quiere seguir brindándolo y mejorando, para lograr mayores ingresos. Jesús se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado refaccionará su carro para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Jesús is 48 years old and lives alone as he migrated from the city of Arequipa 3 years ago. He has worked hard since his arrival in Puno, only having worked and worked in search of a better future. So one year ago he decided to provide taxi service to meet his expenses. Jesús enjoys the work, as it is always different and he can visit different places while transporting customers. Fortunately for Jesús, he is sought after as customers prefer his service, so therefore he wants to continue providing and improving his service to obtain greater profit. This is Jesús’ first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he will repair his car to provide better service.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his car

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 34 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de artesanías en la ciudad de Puno, hace bonitos bordados y tejidos, actividad que viene realizando desde hace un año. Noemí siempre ha trabajado mucho para salir adelante, quiere forjarse un futuro mejor, para tener estabilidad y conformar una familia. El negocio es muy rentable, ya que recibe pedidos de diferentes lugares, así como de la isla Los Uros, del lago Titicaca, donde hay una buena venta a los turistas. Lo más difícil de su trabajo son los acabados finales, que son el principal atractivo, pero con la experiencia que día a día gana Noemí, los resultados son cada vez mejores. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de material para elaborar muchos bordados más, y así, mejores los ingresos económicos en época navideña.
texts.en:
Noemí is 34 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. She sells handicrafts in the city of Puno and has been making beautiful embroideries and weavings for around a year. Noemí has always been a hard worker trying to make ends meet. She struggles for a better future and to find stability and to have her own family. Her business is very successful, as she receives requests from different places, such as Los Uros Island or Titicaca Lake, where her work is very popular among the tourists. The hardest part of her work are the final touches, which are the main attraction of her products, but she’s becoming more experienced every day, so her results are improving very fast. This is her first loan request to Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she will purchase more material to make more pieces of embroidery and obtain a better profit during Christmas time.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to make embroideries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Motorcyle for motorcycle-taxi service

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es: Rocío tiene 32 años, se separó de su pareja y cría a sus tres hijos Antoni de 12, Shiomara de 9 y Corayma de 8 años. Ella es una ejemplar madre que en busca del bienestar de sus hijos y teniendo que criarlos sola se ha desempeñado en muchos trabajos, los cuales le han costado esfuerzo y dedicación, es así que hace 15 años decidió incursionar en el negocio de la artesanía, ella elabora bordados para vender por pedido. Las ventas son altas, ya que Rocío le pone muchos detalles a sus bordados, haciendo que la clientela prefiera sus prendas, lo más difícil es tener que realizar las cantidades que le solicitan. Rocío quiere incrementar la elaboración de bordados pagándole a otra persona para que la ayude en la elaboración de los mismos. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de materiales para la elaboración de sus bordados y contratará a una ayudante para realizarlos en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Rocío is 32 years old. She separated from her husband and she is raising her three children on her own: 12 year old Antoni, 9 year old Shiomara and 8 year old Corayma. She is an exemplary mother looking after her children’s wellbeing. With hard work and dedication, she managed to have several jobs. For that reason, 15 years ago, she decided to enter into the handicrafts business. She makes embroideries for sale upon request. Sales are high because Rocío’s work has many details one of the main reasons to be the artisan of choice for her customers. The hardest part of her job is to finish every request on time. Rocío wants to hire another person to help her increase the amount of pieces of embroidery made for sale. This is her first loan request to Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to purchase more material to make more pieces of embroidery and to hire an assistant to produce more textile art.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for her embroideries and hire an assistant

loans.name: Yda

texts.es: Yda tiene 27 años, está divorciada de su pareja con la cual tuvo dos hijos, Renzo de 6 años y Raúl de 1. Se dedica a la venta de artesanía, confecciona tapetes bordados, los cuales vende en las ferias de artesanos de la ciudad de Puno y también por pedidos a las islas flotantes de los Uros de lago Titicaca. La demanda por los tapetes de Yda es grande, ya que los diseños y formas que realiza en ellos son muy novedosos. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es la dificultad de realizar los bordados, ya que requieren de mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, teniendo que realizar grandes cantidades para satisfacer las necesidades del público. Yda se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de lana y tela para elaborar sus bordados.
texts.en:
Yda is 27 years old. She is divorced and has two children, 6 year old Renzo and 1 year old Raúl. She sells handicrafts and makes embroidery mats to sell on artisan fairs in the city of Puno. She also sells products on demand to Los Uros Island or the Titicaca Lake. Yda’s business is very successful due to the unique designs and shapes she makes on her pieces of embroidery.
