She works as a farmer, making $1 US each day, while her husband also does some farming and works as construction worker, making about $3 US each day as well. The family is also supported by two of their children who work in the local garment factories. There are times though, and during the rainy season, the couple will both go fishing and work together by catching and selling the fish. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these difficult times, Chhun is asking for a loan of $800 US to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will reduce the cost that her husband spends everyday on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin H., 44, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her six children. She works as a farmer and is typically able to make $2.50 US each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, as food prices have also been high. Her husband, San Sat, pictured here, has a business catching fish and typically makes $7 US every day. She is asking for a loan of $600 US to purchase a motorbike for family transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family transportation.

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đinh Thị Bình 28 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt nhưng sau khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn và đầu tư vào buôn bán thịt lợn. Nhờ có sự hỗ trợ, giúp đỡ của chồng  nên công  việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị Bình đang ngày càng phát triển với thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Bình mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán thịt lợn của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đinh Thị Bình, 28 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2002. Before she joined the Fund, the income of her family depended chiefly on farming and raising animals. But upon joining the Fund she confidently borrowed money and invested in a business selling pork. With the support and assistance of her husband, her business has thrived and continues to grow, now providing her family with a monthly income of 3,500,000 VND (210 USD). In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Bình hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in her business selling pork.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling pork

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Hay C. is 34 years old and sells fruits in the Kampong Cham province. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes $6 US every day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. Her husband, Chhun Bunthoeun, 43, is a construction worker building houses. On average, he makes $6 US a day. Mrs. Hay C. is asking for a loan of $1200 US to make two investments. She would like to both invest $700 US to buy construction tools for her husband, and also put $500 US into her own fruit business, increasing her stock of fruits to sell. She sees these investments as opportunities that will be able to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To buy construction tools and more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Sáu năm nay 43 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con tại xã Hưng Yên huyện Hưng Nguyên Tỉnh Nghệ An. Năm 2003 chị Sáu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn dể đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ  kinh doanh hàng ăn và buôn bán thịt lợn vơí mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh thịt lợn và đầu tư vào cửa hàng ăn của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi S. is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and child in the village of Hung Yen at Nguyen Tinh district, in the town of Nghe An. She joined TYM Fund in 2003 to borrow fund for livestock raising. Her current income, which mainly comes from selling food and pork, totals at 4,000,000 VND per month. Mrs. Nguyen would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in her pork selling business and in her family's eatery.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Hào năm nay 51 tuổi,chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Hiên tạicông việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi và buôn bán thịt lợn. Ngoài ra chồng chị còn đi làm nghề thợ xây nên thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Với mức thu nhập 3.500.000/ tháng  cuộc sống của gia đình chị  Hào đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
 Vòng vốn tới chị Hào mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về bán
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi H. is 51 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2006. Currently, her main source of income comes from raising and selling pigs for meat. Additionally, her husband works as a construction worker so her family has a steady income of 3,500,000 per month, and her living standard is improved gradually. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in more pigs to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan N., 29, is a widow and sells sugarcane juice from her house to earn a living. She is able to make $8 US a day. She lives with one young child and her old father in Kampong Cham Province.

She would like to take out a loan of $700 US to purchase sugarcane and open a grocery store for additional profit.

loans.use: To purchase sugar cane and open a grocery store.

loans.name: Mr. Yarath Dy's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Yarath D. is the village bank president of sixteen people in Sra Ma village in Kampong Cham province and all the members in this village bank will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. D., for instance, is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for his pig-breeding business and he hopes to increase his income after he sells the pigs. His wife, Mrs. Chi Sive Neang is a rice soup seller who is able to make a small income to support the family.  He is 37 years old and the father of three children who are attending the local school. 

About End-of-Term Loans:
One member in this village bank has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. This first member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Dong

texts.en:
Dong K., 29, has one young child and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband. She sells vegetables in the market to earn a living and is able to make $5 US a day while her husband is a taxi-driver and makes $8 US per day as well.

Mrs. Dong K. would like to take out a loan of $400 US to make a new investment. She will purchase grocery products for sale.

loans.use: To open a grocery store.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Hiến năm nay 29 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003.  Trước đây gia đình chị chuyên kinh doanh ga nhưng từ năm 2006 đến nay gia đình  chị đã đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Hiện nay cả hai vợ chồng chị đều tham gia kinh doanh buôn bán và đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu của gia đình chị Hiến trong thời gian qua. Với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng  gia đình chị Hiến đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống
Vòng vốn tới chị Hiến mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá phục vụ nhu cầu của nhân dân địa phương trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoang Thi H. is 29 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2003. Her family had been selling chickens until 2006 when she decided to invest in running a grocery store instead. Currently, both her husband and she are involved in this business, which provides the main source of income. With her income at the rate of 4,000,000 VND per month, Mrs. Hoang has more opportunity and means to improve her living standard. She would like to borrow 20,000,000 VND to invest in her store to meet the needs of the local consumers for the incoming New Year celebration.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sokkhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokkhoeun S. lives in Boeung Basak village in Kampong Cham province. She is a housewife who is a good cook. Her husband, Mr. Ros Thong, is a construction worker. He earns less income than is needed to support his household. In order to improve their living conditions, he wants to become a motorbike taxi driver, and therefore Mrs. S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to start his taxi business. 

She is 42 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another is enrolled in the local school and the youngest one--who is four years old--is too young to work or study. 

Her husband is also presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
Penh M., 38, is married and lives with three of her children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She works as a farmer and makes $2.50 US a day while her husband is a blacksmith earning around $3 US each day as well. Three of their children are students. 

Mrs. Penh M. would like to take out a loan of $1000 US to purchase steel and others blacksmith tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase steel and others blacksmith tools for her husband.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị S. năn nay 34 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 2005 chiịtham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán quần áo. Hiện nay ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ buôn bán và lương lái xe của chồng nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh quần áo
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi S. is 34 years old. Her family has three children of school age. In 2005, she joined TYM Fund to borrow fund for her clothing business. Currently, besides the income from raising livestock, she has the additional income from clothing sales and her husband's driver salary. Her family grosses 4,000,000 VND per month. Mrs. Tran wishes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in her clothing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Mrs. Khim C. is a villager in Kos Roka Krauv village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Pech Srean, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn their living. In the plantation, they face some problems because their field is infertile and has a lot of insects that damage their crop. In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Khim C. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides. She hopes to use the rest of loan to buy hose for her pump to water the field.

Khim C. hopes to increase her rice revenue and provide better living conditions for her family with this loan. She is 56 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a casino club while another is employed in a garment factory and the remaining one is attending the local school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and  hose for her pump to water the field

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen H., 31, is a pig breeder and resides with three of her children and her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She typically makes $2 US a day while her husband has a business purchasing and selling yams in the village. On average, he makes $5 US a day.

Sen H. would like to take out a loan of $1000 US to expand yams stock by purchasing more yams from the grower.

loans.use: To purchase yams for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pig feed for her pig-breeding business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiệp  năm nay 30 tuổi, gia đìnhchị có 3 con còn nhỏ. Năm 2005 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Sau 3 năm tham gia Quỹ hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị Hiệp còn đầu tư vốn để mua xe  chở hàng thuê. Công việc kinh doanh,  chăn nuôi của gia đình chị Hiệp đang phát triển tốt và cho thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 13.000.000đ để  đầu tư mua thêm một chiếc xe mới phục vụ ngày càng tốt hơn nhu cầu của người dân địa phương
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 30 years old. Her family has three young children. She joined TYM Fund in 2005 to borrow funds for investing in raising livestock. After three years with TYM Fund, in addition to raising livestock, she also invests in a vehicle for her delivery service. Her family's livestock and delivery service are expanding, and give her an income of 4,000,000 per month. She wishes to borrow 13,000,000 VND to invest in a new vehicle in order to meet the needs of her local customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new car

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng C. lives in Sour Sean village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Ors Sophorn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn their living. In this plantation, he faces a small problem because his field is infertile which has a bad effect on his crop. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sreng C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to amend the field to make her crop more productive. She is 54 years old and does not have any children. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her field

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị  S. năm nay 48 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị S. là chăn nuôi, dịch vụ cho thuê cốt pha và thu nhập từ nghề làm xây dựng của chồng với tổng thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị S. mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 để đầu tư mua gỗ đóng cot pha cho thuê.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi S. is 48 years old. She has been with TYM Fund since 2005. The current source of income for her family, which averages 3,000,000 VND per month, comes from livestock raising, wooden forms rental business (planks used as temporary molds for pouring concrete in construction) and from her husband's construction business. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in lumber for her wooden forms rental business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Krous

texts.en:
Mrs. Krous S. is a villager in Siem Bouy village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Huor Sreng, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Even though they have different businesses, they still can not support their family well.

In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Krous S. decided to ask for a loan to buy some ducks and ducklings to start a duck-breeding business. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in garment factory while another stays at home to do housework. One of her children is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some ducks and ducklings to breed

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị M. 46 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Gia đình chị có 2 con đều đã trưởng thành, chồng chị là cán bộ hưu trí. Hiện nay chị ở nhà chăn nuôi lợn gà còn chồng và con buôn bán thuốc thú y. Công việc chăn nuôi, kinh doanh đang ngày càng pấht triển thuận lợi với thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị M. mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ một phần chị đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi, phần còn lại gia đình chị sẽ sử dụng để kinh doanh thuốc thú y.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi M. is 46 years old. She has been with TYM Fund since 1997. She has two grown children, and her husband is a retired government worker. She raises pigs and chickens while her husband and children sell veterinarian pharmaceuticals. Her livestock and pharmaceuticals business are expanding and bring her an income of 3,500,000 VND per month. She wishes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in livestock and her pharmacy.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Salorn

texts.en: Mrs. Salorn K. is a 30-year-old and she now lives in Siem Bouy village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Leng Voeng, is a fisherman. He now wants to improve his family’s living conditions; thus, Mrs. Salorn K. decided to request a loan to buy fish and fish food for breeding. She has five children, four of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is one month old. Her husband is also in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy fish and fish food for raising fish

loans.name: Yat

texts.en: Yat H., 56, is a widowed farmer living in the Kampong Cham province with her children. She typically makes $1 US each day, and one of her children is a goldsmith. The climate conditions have been unfavorable in Cambodia this past year for farming and this has caused food prices to soar. Inflation has also been out of control, and this has turned into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Yat H. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $1000 US to invest in the goldsmith business. She sees this business opportunity as a way to increase her income and to provide a higher standard of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: To invest in the goldsmith business.

loans.name: Ngô Thị Mai Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị M. năm nay 38 tuổi Ms 020201060005 vay mức 5.152.000VNđ. Chị vay vốn về mua cám để nuôi lợn nái và đầu tư vào việc thu mua phế liệu. Chị là một phụ nữ rất năng động và chịu khó. Ngoài chăn nuôi, buôn bán ra, chị còn luôn giành thời gian để chăm sóc gia đình. Còn chồng chị là thợ xây dựng nên thu nhập của gia đình chị từ 130.000VNđ đến 150.000VNđ/ ngày. Chị có 2 con đang đi học, 1 con học cao đẳng và 1 con học phổ thông, nên chị rất thích tham gia hình thức vay vốn này để chị được trả dần và có kế hoạch tiết kiệm để nuôi con học.
 Trong nhóm chị có các tH.nh viên sau :
 Chị Chu Thị H. năm nay 42 tuổi Ms 020201060001 vay mức 5.152.000VNđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 33 tuổi Ms 020201060002 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để xây chuồng trại.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị C. năm nay 32 tuổi Ms 020201060003 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để thu mua phế liệu.
 Chị Mẫn Thị T. năm nay 46 tuổi Ms  020201060004 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ xây dựng chuồng trại, mở rộng chăn nuôi.
 Chị Mẫn Thị N. năm nay 31 tuổi Ms 020201060006 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để mua gỗ sản xuất bàn ghế.
 Chị Mẫn Thị H. năm nay 50 tuổi Ms Ms 020201060007 vay mức 2.016000VNđ đê mua vịt.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị Hà năm nay 28 tuổi Ms Ms 020201060008 vay mức 2.016000VNđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị M. is 38 years old. She is seeking a loan of 5,152,000 VND (304 USD) to buy bran and other waste materials to feed her pigs. She is a very energetic and industrious woman. In addition to raising and selling pigs, she always takes time to take care of her family as well. Her husband is a construction worker, so the family income is 130,000 VND to 150,000 VND (8 to 9 USD) per day. She has two children, one studying in junior college and one still in high school, so she is very eager to participate in this lending program in order to save money to pay for her children's education. Her group includes the following members: Mrs. Chu Thị H. is 42 years old. She is seeking a loan of 5,152,000 VND (304 USD) to raise pigs. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị H. is 33 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (251 USD) to build an animal enclosure. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị C. is 32 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,704,000 VND (276 USD) to buy waste products to feed her pigs. Mrs. Mẫn Thị T. is 46 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (251 USD) to build an animal enclosure to expand the number of animals she can raise. Mrs. Mẫn Thị N. is 31 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (251 USD) to buy wood she will use to produce furniture. Mrs. Mẫn Thị H. is 50 years old. She is seeking a loan of 2,016,000 VND (119 USD) to buy ducks. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hà is 28 years old. She is seeking a loan of 2,016,000 VND (119 USD) to raise pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs and ducks.  Furniture production.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S., 32, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her three children. She works in a grocery store, making around $5 US each day while her husband makes around $5 US each day as a motor-taxi driver. Inflation has caused prices to soar in Cambodia and recent hikes in oil and rice prices have made for economic struggles for many Cambodians. Looking for ways to increase her income and combat rising expense costs, Seng S. has asked CREDIT for a loan of $600 US to add to her grocery’s inventory. She sees this loan as an opportunity to increase her income and to expand her business.

loans.use: To add to her grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chim L., 29, is a grocery seller who lives in Prongel Commune in Pursat Province. She sells items such as cooking ingredients, plastic goods, canned foods, soft drinks, beers, and cakes. She began her business in 2000, and receives a profit of approximately $4 per day. 

She is married and cares for one young child who is attending school. Her husband, Phat Chay, is a 35-year-old rice farmer, who also raises pigs in their home to help meet the family's expenses. Mrs. L. hopes to expand her business, so she would like to request a loan to purchase a range of groceries items to store and resell.

loans.use: To purchase groceries items

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhorn K. is a villager in Sra Mor village in Kampong Cham province. She is a duck breeder. Her husband, Mr. Sok Sopha, is employed in the Department of Land Management in the province. Since her duck-breeding business is going well, Mrs. Sokhorn K. wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks and duck food. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 51 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in Ministry of Land Management in the province while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: to buy more ducks and duck food for breeding.

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin S. is 35 years old and she now lives in Vield village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces some problems because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support her field. In order to solve these problems, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase them for this purpose. She hopes to increase her rice revenue with this new loan.

Mrs. Sophoin S. has five children, three of whom are attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study because they are at the ages of three and five years old. Her husband, Mr. Chen Kosal, is a construction worker. Her husband and children are shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer to support her field.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy S., 39, is married and lives with three children and her husband in Kampong Cham Province. She sells vegetables in the market and is able to make $2 US a day while her husband is a construction worker building houses. Her husband, Ros Thong, 39, typically makes $3 US each day. This couple also gets support from two children who work as garment factory workers.

Soy S. would like to take out a loan of $500 US to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will reduce the cost that he spends everyday on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Mẫn Thị Minh Group

texts.vi:
Chị Mẫn Thị M. năm nay 32 tuổi Ms 020201060009 chị vay mức 5.152.000VNđ để đầu tư mua phân đạm để trồng rau sạch như: rau ngót, su hào, cà chua…vì vậy gia đình chị hàng ngày đều có thu nhập từ trồng rau. Ngoài ra chồng chị còn làm thợ xây dựng, nên thu nhập của gia đình chị cũng ổn định từ 130.000VNđ đến 140.000VNđ/ ngày. Việc thu nhập đó đã giúp chị có điều kiện để nuôi 2 con chị ăn học, đồng thời có điều kiện tích lũy phòng khi lúc ốm đau. Các thành viên chị rất thích tham gia hình thức vay vốn như vậy, cả nhóm đã trả hết vốn chu kỳ2 và tiếp tục đăng ký vay vốn chu kỳ 3.
 Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau : 
 Chị Nguyễn Thị M. năm nay 41 tuổi  Ms 0202010600010  chị vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để bán hàng tạp hóa.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị N. năm nay 32 tuổi Ms 0202010600011 chị vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để buôn bán quần áo.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị M. năm nay 38 tuổi Ms 0202010600012 chị vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để buôn bán hàng tạp hóa.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị L. năm nay 39 tuổi Ms 0202010600013 chị vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để chăn  nuôi lợn .
 Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 46 tuổi Ms 0202010600014 chị vay mức 2.912.000VNđ để chăn nuôi lợn .
 Chị Mẫn Thị A. năm nay 25 tuổi Ms 0202010600015 chị vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để buôn bán T.t lợn.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị T. năm nay 34 tuổi Ms 0202010600016 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua phân, giống rau về trồng rau sạch.
 Chị Mẫn thị X. năm nay 25 tuổi Ms 0202010600017 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để đi chợ thu mua phế liệu và chăn nuôi lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mẫn Thị M. is 32 years old. She is seeking a loan of 5,152,000 VND (304 USD) to buy fertilizer so she can grow more vegetables including katuk, kohlrabi, tomatoes, and others. Her family is able to earn a bit of income each day by selling these vegetables. Her husband is a construction worker, and the total income of the family is fairly steady at about 130,000 to 140,000 VND (8 USD) per day. With this income, she has been able to send her two children to school an at the same time she has been able to save an amount in case a family member gets sick. The members in this borrowing group are very happy to participate in this program. Everyone in the group was able to completely pay back their loan from lending cycle #2 and has registered to continue participating in lending cycle #3. The group includes the following members: Mrs. Nguyễn Thị M. is 41 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,704,000 VND (277 USD) to invest in selling groceries. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị N. is 32 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,704,000 VND (277 USD) to invest in selling clothes. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị M. is 38 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,704,000 VND (277 USD) to invest in selling groceries. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị L. is 39 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,704,000 VND (277 USD) to raise pigs. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị H. is 46 years old. She is seeking a loan of 2,912,000 VND (172 USD) to raise pigs. Mrs. Mẫn Thị A. is 25 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,704,000 VND (277 USD) to invest in selling pork. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T. is 34 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,704,000 VND (277 USD) to buy fertilizer and grow vegetables. Mrs. Mẫn Thị X. is 25 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,704,000 VND (277 USD) to buy waste products at the market which she can feed to her pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing vegetables.  Raising pigs.  Selling groceries and clothes.

loans.name: Phallim

texts.en:
Mrs. Phallim Y. is 33 years old and she now lives in Bantey Thmey village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living. She now wants to cultivate rice in the dry season; unfortunately, she does not have enough money to cultivate this. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the farm. She hopes to increase her rice revenue with this new loan.

Mrs. Phallim Y. has three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Mach Thorn, is a construction worker. Her husband is also present with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the farm.

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou S., 49, is married and lives with three of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making around $5 each day, while her husband is a construction worker. Her husband, Chhum Try, 47, on average makes $4 a day to help support the household. Three of their children are students.

Mrs. Sou S. would like to take out a loan of $500 to add more grocery’s inventory.

loans.use: To add more grocery’s inventory.

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Mrs. Hen T. lives in Kos Roka Krauv village in Kampong Cham province. She is a grocer who owns a small store in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

Mrs. Hen T. is a widow and she has five children, one of whom is a lathe operator, while another is employed in a casino club. Another one is a pig breeder, while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: In

texts.en:
In Y. is a 32 year old resident of Ptasrong Commune in Pursat Province. For eight years, she has been making a living by growing vegetable or rice crops. Y. has no children and is married to Nhet Mao, 30, who is a rice farmer as well. Y. has wanted to own a cow for a long time but she has lacked the funds to purchase one. Therefore, she has decided to apply for a loan to purchase a cow for her farming business. The cow can help to plow the field and make transportation easier. 

Mrs. Y.'s husband is pictured because she was not available on that day.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Kimleang

texts.en: Mrs. Kimleang L. lives in Sou Sean village in Kampong Cham province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Meas Veasna, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He now wants to be a motorbike taxi driver but he does not have enough money to buy a motorbike. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Kimleang L. decided to request a loan to add to her savings to purchase a motorbike to start the new business, in order to increase their income to support the household. She is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start a new business, in order to increase her income to support the household.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang N. I., 54, is married and lives with one married child and her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She stays at home doing house work and cooking food for the family members. Her husband is a theater owner. Her child is also one of the theater members and normally, she makes $10 in revenue a day.

Mrs. Heang N. I. would like to take out a loan of $800 to purchase a generator to power the lighting when the theater puts on performances.

loans.use: To purchase a generator.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim E. is a farmer in Kos Roka Krauv village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetables to earn a living. In the plantation, she faces some problems because she does not have enough money to support the field to make her crop more productive. In order to improve her living standards, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and hoses for a pump to water her field. She is a 46-year-old widow of three children, two of whom are farmers who help their mother on the plantation, while the other is a motorbike repairer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and hoses for a pump to water her field.

loans.name: Abdukahor

texts.ru:
Мирзорахимов Абдукахор мужчина в возросте 50 лет имеет четверых детей занимается продажей продуктов питания на рынке города Худжанда.Сам Абдукахор со времён Союза занимается торговлей. Он сам по профессии продавец.
 У него на сегодняшний день небольшой лорёк, на базаре "Рохи абрешим"
Под новый год Абдукахор хочет взяв кредит пополнить новогодний ассортимент подарков и шоколадной продукции.По бизнесу вовремя отсутствия Абдукахора ему помогает его жена.Он благодарен всем инвесторам за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdukahor M. is a 50 year old man with four children who sells groceries at a market in the city of Khujand. He has been in sales since Soviet times; it is his profession. Today he has a small market stall at the Rokhi Abreshim market. Abdukahor would like to obtain a loan before New Year to fill out his supply of presents and chocolates. When he is out his wife helps with the business. He is grateful to all of the investors for their support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeurn E. lives in Siem Bouy village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Tun Tha, is a fisherman. He now wants to expand his business but he does not enough money to buy a lake for fishing. Thus, Mrs. Savoeurn E. decided to ask for a loan to purchase it for her husband. She hopes to increase their income and provide a better life for her family.

She is 42 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a lake for fishing.

loans.name: Yeur

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeur P. is a villager in Siem Bouy village in Kampong Cham province. She is a mat maker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more raw materials to make mats for her customers. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

Mrs. Yeur P. is 29 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the remaining two are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Sean Sarath, is a construction worker. Her husband and her children are shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to make mats for her customers.

loans.name: Aum

texts.en: 36-year-old Aum K. lives in Banteay Meanchey Province.  She looks after three children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is a policeman who currently gets salary about $80 per month. For a living, she has been selling second-hand cloths outside of the local Seri Soaphoan Market since 2006. Her clothes range from the price of $1 or $1.50. K. is applying for a loan to purchase second-hand clothes for future sale and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang T. lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Tuy Mak, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to cultivate rice. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Leang T. decided to ask for a loan to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work on the field. She hopes to increase her rice revenue with this new loan.

She is 34 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is present on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Sokunthy

texts.en:
Mr. Sokunthy M. is a villager in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Saum Theary, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn little income and they cannot provide a good life for their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Sokunthy M. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ice-cream box and ice creams to resell in the local village for an income.

He is 33 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the remaining two are too young to work or study because they are at the ages of five months and three years old. His wife is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy an ice-cream box and ice creams to resell in the local village for an income.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Dung Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị D. năm nay 55 tuổi Ms 020201050027 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua máy sản xuất đậu đi chợ bán và mua 5 con lợn giống về chăn. Chồng chị làm ở phòng thương binh xã hội của huyện Yên phong- Bắc N.. Hiện tại vợ chồng chị có 1 con đang đi học phổ thông, vì vậy gia đình chị thu nhập mỗi ngày được khoảng 150.000VNđ/ ngày. Sau 2 chu kỳ vay vốn chị trả vốn rất tốt, đồng thời giúp chị tiết kiệm trả dần và không phải trả một gánh nặng dồn vào một lúc. Chính vì vậy, chị cùng nhóm tiếp tục tham gia vay vốn ở chu kỳ tiếp theo.
 Các thành viên trong nhóm chị gồm có. 
 Chị Trần Thị T. năm nay 43 tuổi Ms 020201050028 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để buôn bán T.t lợn.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị N. năm nay 40 tuổi Ms 020201050030 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để buôn bán T.t lợn, T.t bò.
 Chị Lê Thị H. năm nay 48 tuổi Ms 020201050029 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để mua lợn giống.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị Mỳ năm nay 57 tuổi  Ms 020201050031 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để mua lợn giống.
 Chị Đặng Thị C. năm nay 41 tuổi Ms 020201050033 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để buôn bán T.t lợn.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị T. năm nay 48 tuổi Ms 020201050031 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị D. is 55 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,704,000 VND (275 USD) to buy a machine which she will use to produce tofu. She will sell the tofu in the local market. She will also buy five breeder pigs to raise. Her husband works in the office for veterans and social affairs for the district Yên Phong - Bắc N.. They have one child who is currently in high school. The family has a daily income of about 150,000 VND (9 USD). In two previous lending cycles, she was able to repay her loan very well. It helps her very much that she repays the loan in installments, rather than a single lump sum which would impose a heavy burden. Thus she and her group hope to continue their participation in the next lending cycle. The members of the group are: Mrs. Trần Thị T. is 43 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (250 USD) to invest in selling pork. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị N. is 40 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (250 USD) to invest in selling pork and beef. Mrs. Lê Thị H. is 48 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (250 USD) to buy breeder pigs. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Mỳ is 57 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (250 USD) to buy breeder pigs. Mrs. Đặng Thị C. is 41 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (250 USD) to invest in selling pork. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T. is 48 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (250 USD) to invest in raising pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals and selling meat in the market.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Холматова Фотима женщина в возросте 47 лет имеет высшее медицинское образование, работает врачом лаборантом в областной больнице.Фотима имеет 4 детей , муж водитель городского маршрутного такси.
Фотима обратилась в Микроинвест чтоб получить кредит для покупки легкового автотранспорта, для старшего сына.Её сын хочет в свободное время работать таксистом, т.к. в зимнее время очень большой спрос у населения на автотранспорт.Она считает что в кредит очень удобно делать покупку на большую сумму.
texts.en:
Fotima H. is a 47 year old woman who has completed medical school and now works as a laboratory doctor in the regional hospital. Fotima has 4 children and a husband who works as a minibus taxi driver. Fotima came to Microinvest to obtain a loan to purchase a car for her oldest son. Her son wants to work as a taxi driver in his free time, since during winter there is very high demand for transportation among residents. She thinks that spending a large sum on a purchase is made much easier by access to loans.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: consumer credit

loans.name: Bulenga B4- Sarah Namaga Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. is married with 4 children between the ages of 18 and 24. She is 41 years old and very hard-working. She sells matooke (plaintains), potatoes, cassava, yams, and other raw foods in the Bulenga Market. From her business, she fetches a minimum profit of UGX 150,000 per week. 

She is using the loan to purchase more matooke, cassava, and yams from villages like Bukiko, Busama, and Bugama at fair prices that enable her to profit from the sales. Sarah is focused and hopes that, once she collects enough savings from the business, she can open a hardware shop in the same locality. She desires a healthy, educated, and sustainable family.

loans.use: Purchase more matooke (plantains), cassava, and yams.

loans.name: Bulenga B4-Ssekiwuka Sarah Group

texts.en:
Sarah S., 26 and married with two children aged four and two, has operated a retail grocery shop out of her home in Bulenga for the past three years. This business, which earns a weekly profit of over $20, came into existence through the support of her husband, who runs an electrical shop.

Sarah is now requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, flours and rice to meet the demands of her customers. Her major dreams are to open up a pharmacy in the city centre and send her children to the best schools in the country.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, flours and rice.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Bích Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị B. năm nay 36 tuổi Ms 020201060042 vay mức 3.186.000VNđ về mua cám chăn nuôi gà đẻ và vịt đẻ trứng, lợn, bò. Hàng ngày chị đi chợ, chồng chị ở nhà giúp chị chăn nuôi và chăm sóc 2 con nhỏ còn đang học phổ thông. Hiện tại của gia đình chị cũng ổn định từ 180.000VNđ/ ngày. Khi được cán bộ tín dụng của Bình Minh CDC phổ biến hình thức vay trả này, chị cùng nhóm rất thích và đăng ký vay vì nó phù hợp với mục đích của gia đình. Đồng thời được trả dần theo tuần nên chị cùng nhóm rất thích.
 Các thành viên trong nhóm của chị như sau :
 Chị Nguyễn Thị Chè năm nay 43 tuổi Ms 020201060043 vay mức 1.062.000VNđ để mua lợn giống.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị K. năm nay 33 tuổi Ms 020201060044 vay mức 3.186.000VNđ để mua gỗ làm mộc.
 Chị Mẫn Thị T. năm nay 32 tuổi Ms 020201060045 vay mức 2.006.000VNđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
 Chị Mẫn Thị P. năm nay 25 tuổi Ms 020201060046 vay mức 3.186.000VNđ để mua gỗ đóng bàn ghế.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị B. is 36 years old. She is seeking a loan of 3,186,000 VND (189 USD) to buy bran to feed her egg-laying hens and ducks, her pig, and her ox. Each day that she goes to the market, her husband stays at home to help take care of their two young children who are in primary school. At present, the family income is stable at about 180,000 VND (11 USD) per day. When she heard about this lending program from one of SEDA’s staff members, Mrs. B. and her group were very excited and decided to participate because the program matches the needs and goals of their families very well. Also, the group likes the policy of repaying the loan in weekly installments. The members of the group are: Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Chè is 43 years old. She is seeking a loan of 1,062,000 VND (63 USD) to buy breeder pigs. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị K. is 33 years old. She is seeking a loan of 3,186,000 VND (189 USD) to buy lumber that she will process into wooden blocks. Mrs. Mẫn Thị T. is 32 years old. She is seeking a loan of 2,006,000 VND (120 USD) to raise pigs. Mrs. Mẫn Thị P. is 25 years old. She is seeking a loan of 3,186,000 VND (189 USD) to buy wood to make furniture.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals.  Producing wooden furniture.

loans.name: Arina

texts.ru: Ким Арине  47 лет, живёт она одна. Арина  торгует на рынке  специями несколько лет. Арина решила расширить свой ассортимент и также решилась торговать парфюмерией.  В этом же магазине у нее есть партнер по бизнесу, который кроме торговли приправами  занимается также  скотоводством. Он рассказал Арине о выгодных условиях кредитования в Микроинвест и посоветовал получить кредит на скот. Она обратилась в Микроинвест и получила кредит, но  у нее негде держать скот, для этого Насим-ако (ее партнер по бизнесу) согласился держать и ее скот у себя в коровнике. Также он помогает  Арине  ухаживать за скотом, а она в своё время  оплачивает  его труд.
texts.en:
Arina K. is 47 years old, and she lives alone. She has been selling spices at a market for several years. She decided to increase the assortment of her inventory and start selling fragrances. In the same shop, Arina has a business partner, who in addition to selling spices, is also in a business of selling livestock. He was the one who told her about MicroInvest and suggested her to obtain a loan for new livestock business. She came to MicroInvest and got a loan; however, she doesn't have any space for livestock. For this reason, her partner, Nasim-aka, agreed to keep and take care of the livestock as long as Arina pays him a fee.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en: N. Nulu, a 27-year-old hardworking married business lady with three children, operates a clothing business and owns two rental houses. These two sources of income help her to meet her family’s needs, and she is now requesting a loan to purchase more dresses, suits, trousers, and skirts in order to increase her stock and meet the rising demands of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more dresses, suits, trousers and skirts.

loans.name: Gorrette

texts.en: K. Gorrette is a hard-working and ambitious businesswoman. She is 27 years of age, married with 2 children. She lives in her own house which she built in the Nansana Navuro area.  Besides owning a guest house along the Kabalagala-Muyenga road, she runs a clothes business in Nansana. Gorrette will use the loan to purchase more clothes to meet the increased demand as the holidays draw near.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар 1972 года рождения, у него 2 сына. Он занимается разведением скота. Он продает  скот там же  приобретает скот. Такой цикл продолжается каждые  2-3 месяца.  Так как скотоводство это не постоянный источник дохода.  Сначала необходимо откормить скот в течении нескольких  месяцев, что бы скот «созрел», который  можно было выставлять на продажу. И только потом можно получит большую выручку от продажи скота. Но три месяца ждать это долгий процесс, а жить на что-то надо.  Поэтому М. также  постоянно торгует на рынке продуктами питания. Который в отличие от разведения скота приносит постоянный доход. Ему выгодно поддерживать два разных бизнеса,  в этом ему помогает жена и старший сын.
texts.en:
Muzaffar is 36 years old and has 2 sons. He is in the livestock business. He purchases and sells livestock. He goes through this cycle every 2-3 months. Selling livestock doesn't provide him with a continuous flow of income. In the beginning, it is necessary to feed the livestock for a a few months so that it reaches its slaughter weight. After that, it is ready to be put up for sale. And only after that process, it is possible to obtain a profit after the sale of livestock. But since 3 months is a long time, Muzaffar also sells produce at the marketplace, which provides him with a constant flow of income. It is profitable for him to have two businesses, with which both his wife and older son help him out.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business expenssion

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Married with 4 children, 44-year-old N. Grace is a hard-working businesswoman.  She efficiently operates a grocery store in Kawala but resides in Nakawa. She owns some rental houses that complement her income from the grocery business. She receives an average of Ush 250,000 from her tenants. To satisfy her customers’ needs and demand, Grace will use the loan to purchase more rice, sugar, soap and flour for her grocery store.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: N. Gladys is a very ambitious and determined businesswoman. At 38, she is married and the mother of two school-going children. She operates a bar and restaurant on Rubaga Road where she resides. Besides this business, Gladys owns five rental houses which earn her a total of Ush 1,500,000 per month. Gladys will use the loan to purchase more crates of beer, wine, spirits, and soft drinks for her business.

loans.use: Purchase more crates of beer, wine, spirits, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng R., 47, sells porridge and the Khmer traditional noodle in her village located in Kampong Thom Province. Her husband is a sugar palm seller who climbs palms, makes palm juice, then turns it into palm sugar for sale. She has five children, two of whom are married while three remain single. One is employed as a staff of a local NGO and another one works in a purified water company.

Mrs. R. would like to request a loan for her husband to purchase some bamboo-trader equipment to use for climbing the palm tree. From the remaining loan,  she would like to save and buy a second hand motorcycle to transport the sugar palm to sell in the market.

loans.use: To improve sugar palm business

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Mr. Lusiimba Herbert is a 40-year-old hard-working businessman. He is married with 3 children, two of whom are in school. He raises poultry and also makes building bricks. In addition, he is a coffee farmer.  Income from his businesses has enabled him to build his residential home in Kansangati. For the expansion of his business, Herbert will use the loan to buy more poultry feed and some vaccines. This will enable him to have a healthy flock of poultry that will boost his income and profits.

loans.use: Buying more poultry feed and some vaccines.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: N. Flavia has been operating a clothes business on a retail basis for a period of 3 years.  Due to increased customer demand, she is using the loan to purchase more clothes, a move to brace her self for the Christmas season. She is 35 years old, married with 3 children. She resides in Kasangati, a residence she has acquired due to her hard work. She now has the dream of seeing her children through school successfully.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mr. Chea S., 37, has been working as both rice farmer and a fisherman since 1980. He is married to Mrs. Yen Touch, and they have six children who are all in school. He works hard with his wife everyday to support the family. He farms rice two times per year during the rainy and dry season. When he is not farming, he catches fish to sell. His customers always come to buy rice and fish from his house. He would like to request a loan to buy fuel oil for his pump machine and fertilizer for his dry season farming.

loans.use: To purchase farming materials

loans.name: Namasuba A –Yudaya Group

texts.en:
A. S. Yudaya is a 27-year-old business lady. She sells tomatoes, onions, green pepper, garlic, and eggplants, among other agricultural produce used in spicing both local and continental dishes. Her business is now 3 years old and she rents a stand in Namasuba-Mpida market at a fee of Ush 6,000 per month. Hardworking Yudaya wakes up at 5.00 AM every alternate day and heads to the popular Owino market to purchase her supplies. On good days, she sells an average of Ush 20,000. Her weekly profit margin lies at approximately Ush 30,000.

To boost her business, Yudaya is using the loan proceeds for purchasing more supplies like tomatoes, among other things. This reserved lady is a single mother of two children, aged 9 & 6 years. She keeps her business running amidst stiff competition by relating well with her customers and according them the courtesy they deserve. Her major challenge in business is keeping perishable supplies fresh, considering the fact that she does not have a refrigerator. She therefore dreams of running a retail/ wholesale shop for fast-moving consumer goods which have a long shelf life, and also educating her children to university levels.

loans.use: Purchasing more supplies like tomatoes among others.

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: 29-year-old Seak V. resides in Banteay Meanchey Province. His wife takes good care of their young child. He owns a plot of land in his commune to run a garage. In early 2008, he opened a motorcycle/car wash service with several employees. He currently earns an income of approximately $10 a day which remains adequate to cover his family's living expenses. Mr. V. is requesting a loan to act upon his customers requests to re-decorate and re-design his existing garage.

loans.use: To improve garage

loans.name: Namasuba A – Gloria Group

texts.en:
Gloria N. is a 42-year-old business lady. She sells imported new clothes in the busy Kikuubo market. Once every week, Gloria travels to Eastleigh in Nairobi Kenya by bus to purchase her stock. On a good day, she can make sales ranging between Ush 300,000 and Ush 500,000, from which she earns an average profit of Ush 30,000 per day. Gloria is using the loan to purchase more trendy clothes like suits, dresses and skirts so as to meet the tastes and preferences of her customers. Amidst stiff and aggressive competition, she retains and attracts new customers through customer courtesy and fair prices.

She is a single mother 4 children between the ages of 23 and 16, and a caring guardian to 2 of her nephews. Besides, a friendly and ambitious Gloria looks forward to transact her business across geographical frontiers. She dreams of independently importing her own cargos of clothes from Dubai and supplying them to other retailers. She desires to see her children excel academically.

loans.use: Purchase more trendy clothes like suits, dresses, and skirts.

loans.name: Najjanakumbi B-Margret Group

texts.en:
N. Margret, 46, is a widow with 4 children within ages 9-18 years. She also supports her two siblings due to the death of her parents. Margret is  a hardworking and committed lady  who sells scones and cakes around Kampala. She has been in business 5 years, but due to insufficient funds, she has no ovens. She therefore takes her ingredients to a nearby bakery where she has the snacks baked. 

She supplies to retailers around town hence earning an average profit of Ush 120,000 per week. On a good day she makes sales worth Ush 80,000. She is using the loan to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil. She retains her customers by being polite and friendly to them. She dreams of acquiring her own ovens so that she can set up her own bakery. Increased income would enable her to put her children through  school successfully.

loans.use: Purchase wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Mrs. Samon L. lives in Preak Ta Oung Ti Pie village in Kandal province. She is a housewife who takes care of her children in the house. Her husband, Mr. Phorn Chantha, is a farmer. He earns little rice revenue, which means he cannot provide a good life for his household. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Samon L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse with a cart to transport soil to sell.

Mrs. Samon L. is 46 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver, while another is employed in a garment factory. Two children are laborers, while another one is enrolled in the local school. The remaining child is too young to work or study because that child is two years old. Her husband is also present in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a horse with a cart to transport soil to sell.

loans.name: Juliet Kanakulya’S Group

texts.en: Juliet is a leader of 5 members of a group.  She is 37 years old and married with 4 children aged between 17 and 10 years. All of her children go to school. Juliet takes care of five additional family members and her old parents. She resides and owns a four-room house where she is staying with ten people. They have electricity and no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She doesn’t incur any transport costs since she buys from delivery vans .Juliet operates from her home and doesn’t rent her business premises in Kasubi, one of the city suburbs, and works seven days a week.  Juliet has been with MCDT for four years working all this long time with the same group members and servicing her eighth loan. She wants to invest this loan in a firewood business in order to supplement her income.  Juliet is aspiring of going to the villages to get charcoal directly from producers.

loans.use: To invest it in firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sochea P. is 30 years old and she now lives in Preak Ta Oung Ti Pie village in Kandal province. She is a cake seller in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Bo Punlork, is an ice cream seller, also in the local village. He now wants to expand his business to other villages in order to increase his income. Thus, Mrs. Sochea P. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a cart and ice-cream box for her husband's business.

She hopes to provide a better life for her family and improve their living conditions with this loan. She has three children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a cart and ice-cream box for her husband's business.

loans.name: Rovinsa Bakeera’S Group

texts.en:
Rovinsa is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is 42 years old and is married with 5 children aged between 17 and 10. All of her children go to school, and Rovinsa also takes care of three additional family members. She resides in and owns a two room house where she stays with ten people. They have electricity and piped water at home, and the family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport to and from work.

Rovinsa buys from Kampala city and Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. Rovinsa operates a kiosk in Ndeeba, one of the city suburbs, and works seven days a week. Rovinsa has been with MCDT for four years, and has worked all the time with the same group mates, and is now servicing her twentieth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy a refrigerator.

Rovinsa aspires to operate a bridal salon and also build a house.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao S., 49, is a grocery vendor, who resides with two of her children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She typically makes $5 a day, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver and works as a wedding chef. On average, he makes $2.50 a day. This couple also receives support from two children who work as hairdressers.

To make more money and raise their standard of living, Mrs. Sao S. would like to take out a loan of $1200 to add groceries to her inventory and purchase more hairdressing tools for her children.

loans.use: To add grocery and hair dressing tools.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Mrs. Khon M. is a villager in Ou Kandal Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small store where she sells groceries. Her husband, Mr. Chu Tith, helps her in the current business. They have a child who is a motorbike taxi driver. Although Mrs. Khon M. and her family members have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions and in an old house. In order to improve these, Mrs. Khon M. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng C., 38, is married with two children who live at home in the Kampong Cham province. She raises pigs, typically making US$3 each day, while her husband grinds rice crops. Her husband, Yat Vanna, typically makes about US$2.50 each day. Eng C. would like a loan to purchase more pigs to breed and also to purchase feed for the pigs.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Najjanakumbi B-Namudu Group

texts.en:
Leocadia N. is 40 years old. she operates a grocery  shop in Najjanakumbi. She has been into business for a period of 4 years but due to insufficient funds, has been unable to meet the rising demands of customers. loan proceeds are therefore enabling her purchase bags of sugar, rice and flour in lump some.She obtains her stock from the busy Kikuubo market in Kampala town.

On a good day, she can sell goods worth Ush 70,000. Her weekly profit margin lies at an average of Ush  80,000. As a married mother of 6 children between ages 24-7 years, she uses  part of the profits to help her husband in fending for the family. She ensures customer loyalty by providing quality services. N. dreams of running a wholesale retail shop in the heart of the city so that she can get increased income to enable her educate the children to university levels.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of sugar, flour and rice.

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima M.rafiq Group

texts.en:
My name is Ghulam Fatima and I have resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 25 years. My husband's name is M. who is a fruit seller with 15 years of experience. He collects fruit from fruit markets and sells it by bicycle in public places and earns a profit. I am a mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. My elder son is a carpenter and my younger son runs a grocery shop. My elder daughter reads in 5th standard and my younger daughter reads in 2nd standard. I keep myself busy sewing clothes. This work provides me with two benefits: first it helps me to earn income and second it keeps me busy. I save my income to pay the school fees of my daughters. My husband and my sons bear the house expenses. I successfully repaid my first loan which I took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying for a loan again to buy groceries to expand my younger son’s grocery shop. 

I am a group leader of a few more women in my locality. Safia baji wants a loan to buy tea to resell. Sagheeran baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle named “Shahzore”. Parveen akhtar baji and Naheed akhtar baji each want a loan to buy wood to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Tang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tang S. is a group leader of four, who are all living in Korng Keb Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer who owns 2.5 hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. Aside from this, she is a cake seller who can make a small income to support the household. She is a 54-year-old widow with a child who helps her on the plantation. Although she and her child try to work hard, they still cannot support themselves well. Thus, Mrs. Tang S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two piglets to start a breeding business and she hopes to improve her living conditions after she sells the pigs.

All members in this group have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy two piglets to start a breeding business.

loans.name: 35 Tân Sơn-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 35 consists of seven poor women, all of whom live in Tan Son Commune, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Lam is the lead borrower of the group. She is 31 years old, married, and has two children: an 8 year old son and a 4 year old daughter. This is her first loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women and she will use the proceeds to buy shoes that she will then sell in the market.

Mrs. Lam will use the profits from her loan to pay her son's school fees, to buy chickens, and to provide for her family.
The loan will be split equally between all seven borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan as follows:

* Mrs. Ly is borrowing 1,626,900 Vietnamese Dong (~ US$100) to buy 10 hats and 5 handbags to sell in the market.
* Mrs. Thuy will use her share of the loan to buy 15 pairs of shoes to sell in the market.
* Mrs. Loan will buy and raise two pigs. After 3 months she will sell the pigs and buy another two pigs.
* Mrs. Hong will invest in photographic film and paper that she will resell.
* Mrs. Yen will use her share of the loan to buy vegetables for resale.
* Mrs. Nguyen is borrowing to buy clothes that she will sell in the market.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, pigs, shoes, hats, clothes, handbags.

loans.name: Robinah Nabukeeera’S Group

texts.en:
Robinah is a leader of a group of 4 members. She is a 30 year married woman, with two children aged between 7 and 10 years. All of her children go to school, and Robinah doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in and rents a two room house. They have electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala, and uses public transport to and from shopping. She buys from Kampala city.

Robinah operates a ladies salon in Kisaasi. On a good day, she works on 10-15 customers, and works seven days a week. She has been in this business for twelve years. Robinah has been with MCDT for ten years, and has worked with the same group mates, and is now servicing her twentieth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy a hair dryer.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Rubina Shakeel Ahmad Group

texts.en:
I am Rubina and I’m a 35 year old woman living in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. I have been living in this city for the past 5 years. I am an uneducated lady but I know the worth of education. It gives a good direction to people. My husband's name is S. A., who is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has 15 years of experience in this profession. I have four kids: three sons and one daughter. As I said before, I know the value of education, and that’s why I am delivering the same value to my children and giving them an education. My daughters read in 6th standard. My elder son is in 5th standard and my younger son is in 3rd standard.

I am a seamstress by profession. I do this work to pay for my children’s school fees. My husband bears the household expenses. I’m applying for a loan to repair my husband’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) so that he is able to continue his work and perform his duties efficiently. 

I am a group leader of few more women in my locality. Naseem akhtar baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making business. Rashidan baji wants a loan to buy ready made garments for ladies and gentlemen for resale. Asia baji wants a loan to buy spare parts for vehicles for resalel. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk sales business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Mr. Son V. lives in Dambouk Kor Kos village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a battery charger who uses electricity to charge batteries for an income. His wife, Mrs. V. Phally, is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice. Even though they have different businesses, they still cannot support and provide a good life for themselves. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Son V. decided to ask for a loan to purchase two cows for breeding and he hopes to improve his living conditions after he sells his cows.

He is 38 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase two cows for breeding.

loans.name: 24 Tân Sơn- Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 24 consists of five poor women, all of whom live in Tan Son Commune, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Tiến is the lead borrower of the group. She is 32 years old, married, and has one eight year old child.  As with her first loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women, which was repaid on time and in full, Mrs. Tiến will use the proceeds from this loan to buy material that she will use to make and sell women's clothes.

Prior to discovering the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women, Mrs. Tien, like many of the Fund for Poor Women's borrowers, used to borrow money from a money lender at exorbitant rates – in this case 5,000 VND per day (~US$0.30) on a 1,000,000 VND loan (~US$63), equal to an APR of >250%!  The Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women charges her an APR of 24%.

Mrs. Tiến will use the profits from her share of the loan to reinvest in her business and to pay her family's general living expenses.

The loan will be split equally between all five borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan as follows: 

* Mrs. Yến is borrowing 1,963,500 Vietnamese Dong (~ US$123) to buy a range of small household goods (salt, sugar, cigarettes, beer, noodles, etc.) that she will sell from her little store.
* Mrs. Cúc will use her share of the loan to buy and raise 3 pigs and 10 chickens.
* Mrs. Hảo will use her share of the buy and raise 2 pigs (bigger pigs than those bought by Mrs. Cuc).
* Mrs. Hà will use her share of the loan to buy food that she'll use to make and sell Bánh cuốn, a popular breakfast dish in Vietnam.

loans.use: To buy pigs, chickens, rice, cloth, sugar, salt

loans.name: Florence Babirye’S Group

texts.en:
Florence is a leader of a group of 5 members. She is a 43 year old widow with three children aged between 13 and 23. Two of her children go to school, and Florence also takes care of her old father. She resides in and rents a one room house where she stays with four people. They have electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Florence works in a semi-rban area which is o the outskirts of Kampala. She doesn’t incur any transportation costs since she buys from trucks which get the products from the villages. Florence runs a stall in Kamwokya Market, where she sells to an average of 50 customers a day and works seven days a week. Florence sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. Florence has been in this business for over ten years. She has been with MCDT for ten years, and has worked with the same group mates all the time, and is now servicing her twentieth loan.

Florence wants to use this loan to expand her business. She hopes to buy food directly from the farmers in the villages.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Kan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan P. is a group leader of four members who all live in Phum Por village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetables to earn a living. In the plantation, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to purchase bean seed to grow in the field. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase bean seeds for growing. Mrs. Kan P. is a 53-year-old widow with two children who are farmers who help on their mother's plantation.

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase bean seed for growing.

loans.name: Alexander Nabbakka’S Group

texts.en:
Alexander is the leader of a 4-member loan group. She is a 52-year-old single mother of three. She had five children but two died. The three remaining children are in school. Alex also takes care of the four orphans of her late children.  She resides and owns a two-room house where she is staying with four people, and only two people bring in additional income to the family. They neither have electricity nor piped water at home The family gets two meals a day and rarely take tea.

Alexander works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport to and from shopping. Alexander operates a business from home and sells to an average of 20 customers a day and works seven days a week. Alexander sells to all categories of people. Alexander has been in this business for over ten years. She owns a kiosk in the village beside a shoe business. She has been with MCDT for six years working all this long with the same group mates and servicing her twelfth loan. Alexander wants to use this loan to buy more shoes for her business. She is aspiring to build rental rooms in the plot she bought with previous loans. The other group members want to do similar things.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell and to build rental rooms on a lot

loans.name: Khadejah

texts.en:
Khadejah N. is 38 years old and the mother of eight children. She supports her husband and children by selling groceries, canned goods and soft drinks.

Khadejah is seeking a loan of $1,200 to buy basic groceries such as rice, sugar, detergents, milk and other products to increase her stock, expand her business and satisfy the needs of her customers.

Khadejah is very appreciative of the support she receives, as it will allow her to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more basic groceries to expand her stock.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Thiết năm nay 31 tuổi, chị đang sốngcùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại huyện Kim động Tỉnh Hưng Yên.  Chị Thiết  tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ trồng trọt và chăn nuôi vịt với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua giống cây về trồng và cung cấp cho người dân địa phương tăng thu nhập cho gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị Thiết, 31 years old, lives with her husband and two young children in Kim Động district, Hưng Yên province. She has participated in the TYM fund since 2005. Presently, the main sources of income for her family are farming and raising ducks, which provide them with earnings of about 2,000,000 VND (120 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND (900 USD) to buy seedlings. She will plant some of them and sell the rest to other farmers in her community. This will allow her to raise the income of her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seedlings

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thái năm nay 53 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Chị Thái tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Hiện tại hai vợ chồng chị chuyên trồng và kinh doanh cây cảnh còn các con đều đi làm công nhân. Hàng tháng  ngoài thu nhập từ bán cây cảnh  chị còn nhận được sự hỗ trợ từ các con nên kinh tế gia đình chị Thái đang ngày càng ổn định hơn
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 17.000.000đ để mua thêm giống cây về trồng và bán cho người dân địa phương.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thái, 53 years old, has three grown children and has been a member of the TYM fund since 1999. She and her husband specialize in growing ornamental potted plants, while all of her children have gone to work as laborers. Each month, in addition to her income from selling potted plants, she receives some support from her children, so her financial situation is slowly improving. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 17,000,000 VND (1000 USD) to invest in buying seedlings which she will sell to local customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ornamental plant sales

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Khuân năm nay 43 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại Huyện Kim động tỉnh Hưng Yên. Tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000, đến nay qua 8 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị Khuân luôn hoàn trả vốn đúng hạn và thực hiện tốt các quy định của Quỹ. Hiện tại với mức thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng từ chăn nuôi, trồng trọt và lương công nhân của chồng  cuộc sống gia đình chị Khuân đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
Với số vốn vay 17.000.000đ xin vay trong vòng vốn tới chị Khuân dự định sữ sử dụng để đầu tư mua thêm giống cây về trồng
texts.en:
Mrs. Vũ Thị Khuân, 43 years old, lives with her husband and two young children in Kim Động district, Hưng Yên province. She has participated in the TYM Fund since the year 2000. During her eight years of membership, she has always repaid her loans on time and has followed the rules of the Fund diligently. Currently, her family has an income of 2,500,000 VND (147 USD) per month from raising animals, growing crops, and wages her husband earns as a laborer. With this level of income, the life of Khuân’s family is gradually improving. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 17,000,000 VND (1000 USD), which she plans to use to buy more seedlings.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer
