loans.use: Buy seedlings

loans.name: Alice Kalule’Sgroup

texts.en:
Alice is the leader of a 5-member group. She is married with 7 children, aged between 16 and 28; three of her children go to school. She lives in and owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with ten people. The family gets two meals a day.

Alice works seven days a week and doesn’t have a permanent place for her business; she just deals in mobile markets. She has been in this business for two years. She is faced with the challenge of the rainy season because she is living in a swampy area. Alice wants to use this loan to buy more bales of used clothes. Alice buys these clothes from Owino market.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Juon

texts.en:
Mr. Juon S., 52, and his wife, Sin Vanna, 51, reside in Banteay Meanchey Province. The couple have four children, all of whom are single and assist with the family business. They both earn an income making cement jars which they sell from their home, as well as deliver to customers. To facilitate better transportation for their business, Mr. S. is requesting a loan to purchase a cultivating machine. The machine will assist to transport the jars more quickly and efficiently. 

Mr. S.'s wife is pictured because he was not available.

loans.use: To purchase a cultivating machine

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đoàn Thị Thế năm nay 43 tuổi. Năm 1996 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Công việc chăn nuôi phát triển thuận lợi đã đem lại cho gia đình chị nguồn thu nhập ổn định. Đến nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn để mua máy say sát để phục vụ cho bà con địa phương. Hiện tại chăn nuôi và làm máy sát là những công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị Thế với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000 đ để mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đoàn Thị Thế is 43 years old. She became a member of T. TYM Fund in 1996, borrowing money to invest in raising pigs. T. enterprise of raising animals has done well and now provides her family with a reliable source of income. Since then, in addition to raising animals, T. family has invested in T. purchase of a rice grinder, which they use to serve T. needs of other families in T. area. Presently, raising animals and grinding rice are T. main sources of income for Mrs. Thế’s family, earning them about 2,000,000 VND (120 USD) per month. In T. next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (600 USD) to buy more pigs and feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Thuý năm nay 36 tuổi, chị hiện đang sống cùng hai con nhỏ tại thị trấn Lương Bằng huyện Kim động tỉnh Hưng Yên. Chị Thuý tham gia Quỹ tình thương năm 1999 hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho 3 mẹ con chị là từ chăn nuôi và trồng trọt với mức thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 15.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để đầu tư mua giống cây bưởi về trồng, phần còn lại chị đầu tư mua phân bón phục vụ cho việc trồng trọt của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoang Thi T. is 36 years old. She lives with her two young children at the town of Luong Bang, Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. Mrs. Hoang joined TYM fund in 1999. The main income for Mrs. Hoang and her two children, which comes from livestock raising and farming, totals at 2,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to partly invest in pomelo seedlings for planting. The rest of the fund would go to fertilizer for her farming business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and Planting

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed A. is a hard-working man who strives to provide for his wife and seven children. Majed sells a variety of goods from his small store. He also works as a messenger at the governmental office earning about $200 per month - an amount insufficient to meet basic family expenses.

Majed wishes to take a loan of $1200 to increase his inventory in order to increase sales. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: To increase the inventory in his store.

loans.name: Trần Thị Vụ Group

texts.vi:
Nhóm Chị Trần Thị Vụ năm nay 39 tuổi Ms 020211030010, mặc dù là một y sĩ thời gian bận rộn nhưng chị rất năng động, vừa chữa bệnh tại nhà, lại vừa chăn nuôi lợn, đan nón và bán hàng khô. Chồng chị là thợ xây, còn 2 con chị đang đi học cấp 1, nên ngoài công việc chị luôn giành thời gian để chăm sóc gia đình. Hiện tại mức thu nhập của gia đình chị từ 150.000VNđ đến 200.000VNđ/ ngày. Chu kỳ 3 này chị đăng ký vay mức 5.152.000VNđ để mua thêm hang khô về bán.
 Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau:
 Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 32 tuổi Ms 020211030014 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để mua gỗ phát triển nghề mộc.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 39 tuổi Ms 020211030012 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để lấy vốn đi chợ và chăn nuôi.
 Chị Vương Thị T. năm nay 46 tuổi Ms 020211030013 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua gỗ làm đồ mộc.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuỳ năm nay 28 btuổi Ms 020211030017 vay mức 3.808.000VNđ để bán hang tạp hoá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi Vu is 39 years old. Although she is a busy doctor with very little time, she manages a practice at home, raises pigs, weaves hats and sells dried goods. Her husband is a construction worker. Her two children are in elementary school. On top of her work, she always makes time to take care of her family. Currently, her family's income grosses from 150,000 VND to 200,000 VND per day. For her third loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND in order to buy more dried goods to sell. Her group has the following members: Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 32 years old, would like to borrow 4,256,000 VND to invest in her carpentry business. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hang, 39 years old, would like to borrow 4,256,000 VND to invest in livestock raising. Mrs. Vuong Thi Tinh, 46 years old, would like to borrow 4,704,000 VND to buy lumber for her carpentry business. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thuy, 28 years old, would like to borrow 3,808,000 VND to invest in her convenient store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business

loans.name: Najjanakumbi B -Justine Group

texts.en:
Justine N. is a polite and ambitious businesswoman. She is 27 years old and single. Justine is a loving and caring guardian to 7 orphans (her nephews and nieces). She runs a boutique offering trendy ladies' outfits, including some cosmetics. In good times, she can make daily sales of approximately Ush 150,000 from which she earns a weekly profit of approximately Ush 250,000. She is using the loan proceeds for purchasing some dresses to add to her stock of skirts and blouses.

At the university, Justine pursued a Bachelor's of Science in social anthropology. However, due to the the limited employment opportunities in the country, she opted for business and this has enabled her to provide for the children in her care.

Alice has big dreams, however! She looks forward to travelling one day to Dubai and Hongkong to purchase stock which she will in turn sell to retailers on a wholesale basis. She hopes that with a positive turn of business, she will see these orphans through school successfully.

loans.use: Purchase dresses for re-sale

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lưu Thị D. năm nay 52 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị D. chỉ chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ, sau khi tham gia Quỹ nhờ có thêm nguồn vốn công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đã ngày càng được mở rộng hơn. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi khoảng 100 con lợn thịt  cho thu nhập 2.500.000đ/tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000 đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luu Thi D. is 52 years old. She has been with TYM Fund since 2006. Before joining the fund, she had only been able to raised livestock on a small scale. After joining the fund, with additional investment and funding, she has been able to expand her business. Currently, her family raises about 100 pigs for meat, which brings her an income of 2,500,00 VND per month. She would like to borrow 12,000,000 VND to buy more pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lưu Thị Phương năm nay 41 tuổi, chị thma gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 3 năm. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Phương là từ  chăn nuôi và  trồng cây ăn quả. Với 3 sào vườn  chuyên trồng các loại cây ăn quả theo mùa thu nhập của gia đình chị Phương luôn đạt bình quân 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để mua phân bón phục vụ cho việc trồng trọt, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để mua thêm con giống về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luu Thi P. is 41 years old. She has been with TYM Fund for three years. Currently, her main income comes from livestock raising and growing fruit trees. With her orchard of 3 sao ( 1 sao = 360 square meters) specializing in seasonal fruit trees, her family incomes averages at 2,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to buy fertilizer for her plants and to buy additional animals to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing

loans.name: Trần Thị Thuynh Group

texts.vi:
Cô Trần Thị T. năm nay 51 tuổi Ms 020211030001, hiện cô đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con trai, 1 con dâu. Cô là một nhóm trưởng rất nhiệt tình. Hai chu kỳ trước nhóm cô đã tham gia vay vốn và hoàn trả rất tốt. Hàng ngày ngoài việc chăn nuôi lợn ra, cô còn làm bánh tẻ, còn chồng và các con cô đều là cán bộ nhà nước, vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình cô mỗi ngày khoảng 150.000VNđ đến 170.000VNđ/ ngày. Chu kỳ 3 này cô tham gia vay mức 5.152.000VNđ để chăn nuôi lợn và mua đồ làm bánh.
 Các thành viên trong nhóm của cô: 
 Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 37 tuổi Ms 020211030002 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để mua thêm bàn ghế cho thuê.
 Chị Trần Thị V. năm nay 38 tuổi Ms 020211030004 vay m ức 4.256.000VN đ để chăn nuôi gà đẻ.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 59 tuổi Ms 020211030005 vay mức 4.256.000VN đ để chăn nuôi gà làm mộc.
 Chị Nghiêm Thị C. năm nay 31 tuổi Ms 020211030006 vay mức 3.808.000VN đ để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi T. is 51 years old. She lives with her husband, two sons and one daughter in law. She is an enthusiastic group leader. She joined and borrowed from the fund twice before and has completely paid back her loans. Besides pigs raising, she sells rice cakes. Her husband and children are government worker, and the family's income gross from 150,000 VND to 170,000 VND per day. For her third loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise pigs and materials to make rice cakes. Her group includes the following members: Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hanh, 37 years old, would like to borrow 4,256,000 VND to buy furniture for rent. Mrs. Tran Thi Vien, 38 years old, would like to borrow 4,256,000 VND to raise egg laying hens. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hao, 59 years old, would like to borrow 4,256,000 VND to raise chickens. Mrs. Nghiem Thi Chien, 31 years old, would like to borrow 3,808,000 VND to buy feed for pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock raising and cake/pastry making

loans.name: Reung

texts.en:
Reung L., 62, is a rice farmer in Samrong Village in Banteay Meanchey Province. She is married with four children; one of them is married and three are single. Her husband grows green beans for sale as vegetables to eat with porridge, Chinese noodles, and Khmer traditional food. His business has gone well and many customers come to buy green beans at his house.

L. and her husband work hard every day at their business to earn money to cover the family's expenses. Two of her children are studying toward their Bachelor's degree in Phnom Penh City, and one is employed as a guard for a private company. L. is always trying to provide the means for her children to graduate university.

Her children need a motorcycle and she lacks the money to buy it for them. Hence, she would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her children who study in Phnom Penh to drive to school. (Her husband is pictured because she was not available at that time.)

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her children

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn S., 34, is a grocery seller and sells a variety of products such as sugarcane juice, cakes, household use products, and cooked rice with pork. She has been selling these things since 2006 and can earn around US$ 5 per day. She lives with her husband and three children, all of whom are in school. With a view to growing her business, she needs a loan to expand the business by purchasing more inventory such as groceries, sugarcane to make juice, and ingredients for cooked rice.

loans.use: purchasing more inventory such as groceries, sugarcane to make juice, etc.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Ánh năm nay 46 tuổi, gia đình chị có 2 con đều đã trưởng thành. Chị Ánh tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Thời gian đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt, Đến năm 2003 gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn và chuyển sang trồng và kinh doA. cây cảnh. Hiện tại đây là công việc đem lại thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị. Bên cạnh đó để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình thời gian rảnh rỗi chồng chị còn đi làm thêm nghề xe ôm.
Vòng vốn tới chị Ánh mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm cây cảnh về trồng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi A. is 46 years old. Her family has two grown children. Mrs. Tran joined TYM Fund in 1997. In the beginning, she borrowed funds to invest in livestock raising and farming. In 2003, her family has shifted from farming to growing decorative and ornamental plants. Currently, this business provides the main source of income for her family. To increase her family income, her husband works as a motorbike cabbie in his spare time (a motorbike cabbie takes passengers on a motorbike for fares). She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in more plants to grow.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en: N. Margaret is the leader of Musita lending group in Mayuge district. She is married with 6 children of which 4 are in school. She has a retail shop business which she has been operating for 6 years.  With the loans and with support from her husband, she has been able to recapitalize her shop and is now able to sell a lot of items which bring in a reasonable income. She is grateful for the loans. In her shop, she has stocked her products in large quantities and this helps her in reducing the transport costs since she does her buying only once for a long period of time. Margaret needs a loan to help with stocking her shop with more sugar, cooking oil, maize flour, millet and baking flour which will increase her revenues.

loans.use: Restocking her shop wih sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and other items.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 41 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Hiện tại gia đình chị H.  đang chăn nuôi 500 con  gà vịt để phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Chồng chị ngoài thời gian làm ruộng, chăn nuôi còn đi phụ xây để tăng thêm thu nhập.  Với mức thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị hoà đang ngày càng ổn định hơn. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm 150 con gà giống và thức ăn phục vụ chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 41 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 1997. Currently, her family raises 500 chickens and ducks to improve her family's livelihood. In addition to raising livestock, her husband also works as a construction worker. With an income of 2,500,000 VND her family's economy is gradually becoming more stable. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in 150 chickens and chicken feed for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Najjanakumbi A- Resty Group

texts.en:
N. Resty is 48 years old and operates a restaurant  in Najjanakumbi. Her business is 5 years old and she prepares a variety of local dishes like matooke, lumonde, mayuni, buga, luwombo, among others. She purchases the food stuffs and spices from the  Kibuye market. On a good day, Resty sells about 150,000USH worth of food from which she earns an average daily profit of 20,000USH.

She is hardworking and jovial. She is married with 4 children aged between 18 and 27 years. She also takes care of 2 of her grand children. Resty dreams of transforming her restaurant into a modern one that would earn her a reputation in catering services to functions like weddings, kwanjula (traditional marriage), and graduations.

loans.use: Purchase a bag or rice, crates of soda and mineral  water.

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Chị  Phạm Thị Hoà 30 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó 2 con đã trưởng thành. Năm 1997 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi và lương làm thợ xây của chồng với tổng thu nhập bình quân 2.500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hoà mongmuốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm gà, vịt và thức ăn phụcvụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi H. is 30 years old. She has three children, two of whom are grown. She joined TYM Fund in 1997 to invest in livestock raising, and farming to improve her family's economy. Currently, the family's income, which comes from livestock raising and her husband's salary as a construction worker, averages at 2,500,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy more chickens, ducks and animal feed for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Hiền 30 tuổi, chị tham  gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt, sau khi tham gia Quỹ được vay thêm vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư để kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Công việc kinh doanh ngày càng phát triển cho thu nhập ổn định  giúp cho cuộc sống gia đình chị ngày càng được cải thiện hơn
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm hàng phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của người đân đại phương trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi H. is 30 years old. She has joined TYM Fund since 2002. Before joining the fund, her family's income depended mainly on livestock raising and farming. After joining TYM, her family has borrowed loans to invest in a grocery store. Her business is expanding and giving her family a more stable and improved living standard. She would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in more supplies for her store to meet the needs of her local customers for the incoming New Year celebration.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en: Janet N. is one of the executive members of Galikwoleka lending group in Jinja. She is married and a business woman. She has operated a bar selling local brew, bottled wines, spirits and beers from her home for a long while. During her free time, Janet is also involved in the tailoring business where she makes and repairs clothes for her customers, out of the materials that she buys in Jinja town. She is grateful for the loan that enabled her to start her second business, where she bought a sewing machine and 2 pairs of scissors. Now, her home is presentable compared to how it was before the loans. Janet is requesting a loan to buy materials for her local brew business, like sim sim, bananas and millet as well as a few materials for making clothes.

loans.use: Locally brewed drinks and clothing materials.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Nhưng  55 tuổi, chị có 4 con trong đó 3 con đã trưởng thành. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị Nhưng rất khó khăn do chồng chị không may mất sớm các con còn nhỏ. Năm 2004 chị tham gia Quỹ và vay vốn để  đầu tư kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Hiện tại đây là công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị.Ngoài ra hàng tháng chị cũng có thêm sự giúp đỡ của các con đã đi làm nên cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định hơn.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm hàng phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của người dân đại phương trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Ms. V. Thi Nhung is 55 years old. She has 4 children and 3 are grown. Before joining TYM fund, her family's economic situation was quite difficult. Her husband died at an early age while the children were still young. In 2004, she joined the fund to borrow money to invest in a grocery store. Presently, the store is her family's main source of income. She also has additional monthly help from her grown children who also work, so the family's economic situation is getting more stable by the day. For the next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to buy additional merchandise as requested by the customers for the upcoming Tet Holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Sơn Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị S. năm nay 29 tuổi Ms 020211030007 là một phụ nữ trẻ rất nhanh nhẹn, tháo vát. Hiện nay chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ, gia đình chị có rất nhiều hoạt động kinh doanh như: Bán quán, bán hàng khô, hang ăn chin, nước giải khát và hoa quả. Ngoài việc bán hang vợ chồng chị còn chăn nuôi 8 con lợn, vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình chị khá ổn định, trung bình khoảng từ 150.000VNđ đến 160.000VNđ/ ngày. Cả nhóm chị đã tham gia vay và hoàn trả rất tốt qua 2 chu kỳ. Chu kỳ 3 này chị vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua thêm hang về bán trong dịp tết.
 Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau:
 Chị Nguyễn Thị D. năm nay 27 tuổi Ms 020211030014 vay mức 2.912.000VNđ để chăn nuôi gà.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị C. năm nay 61 tuổi Ms 020211030009 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để làm nghề gò hàn.
 Anh Nguyễn H. T. năm nay 34 tuổi Ms 020211030011 vay mức 2.464.000VNđ để mua lợn giống.
 Chị Phạm Thị B. Thuỷ năm nay 32 tuổi Ms 020211030016 vay mức 3.808.000VNđ để phát triển nghề mộc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Son, 29 years old, is a quick and resourceful woman. She lives with her husband and two young children. Her family has many entrepreneurial businesses such has running an eatery, selling dried goods, prepared and cooked food, refreshment and fruit stands. Additionally, her family also raises eight pigs. Because of that, her family's income is stable, averaging from 150,000 VND to 160,000 VND. Her loan group has repaid its loan successfully for the past two loan cycles. For the third loan cycle, Mrs. Nguyen would like to borrow 4,704,000 VND to buy additional goods to sell during the incoming New Year celebrations. Her group includes the following members: Mrs. Nguyen Thi Dung, 27 years old, would like to borrow 2,912,000 VND to raise chickens. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Chat, 61 years old, would like to borrow 4,704,000 VND for her welding/repairing business. Mr. Nguyen Huu Thang, 34 years old, would like to borrow 2, 464,000 VND to buy stud pigs. Mrs. Pham Thi Bich Thuy, 32 years old, would like to borrow 3,808,000 VND to expand her carpentry business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Lan

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Lan năm nay 48 tuổi. Gia đình chị Lan có 3 con trong đó 2 con đã trưởng thành. Năm 2002 chị Lan tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào nuôi cá và baba. Công việc chăn nuôi phát triển thuận lợi đêm lại cho gia đình chị Lam thu nhập rất ổn định. Bên cạnh đó để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình, ngoài thời gian giúp đỡ vợ chăn nuôi chồng chị còn đi lái xe thuê. Thu nhập của gia đình chị hiện tại  đạt bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn dược vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm  cá và baba về nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Lan is 48 years old. She has 3 children and 2 are grown. In 2002, Ms. Lan joined TYM fund and borrowed money to invest in raising fish and turtles. Her business expanded and brings in a stable income for her family. To increase the family's income, in addition to helping her with this business, her husband also works as a rental car driver. Her family's income currently averages 180 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to purchase additional fish and turtles to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy additional fish and turtles to raise

loans.name: Annet Kalyesubula Group

texts.en: K. Annet is a member of Busuyi lending group in Jinja, Mayuge. She is a hardworking lady with a fish selling business where she buys fish from Busuyi landing site and sells from her home plus taking it to other markets for sale. She says that before the loans, she used to sell fish in very small quantities but now she has plenty to sell and as a result, her profits have increased. She is happy that now her children go to school with ease, there is food since she has the money and generally her family’s standard of living has greatly improved. Annet needs another loan to buy more fish for sale.

loans.use: More fish for sale.

loans.name: Najjanakumbi A- Dorah Group

texts.en:
Dorah N., 36, operates a bar and restaurant in Najjanakumbi. It is now 6 years since the inception of her business. She purchases her stock from various authorized suppliers in Kampala. On average, she can make Ush 60,000 in sales, from which she can earn an average profit of Ush 20,000. The loan proceeds are enabling Dorah to purchase beer, vodka, liberty and Smirnoff.

Dorah is a single mother of 3 children between the ages of 12 and 6. She also takes care of 3 orphans (nephews). She seems to be a jovial and friendly lady. She dreams of expanding and transforming her bar and restaurant into a modern classy one. When her income base increases, she would love to purchase a car and also ensure her children and nephews attend the best schools in the country.

loans.use: To purchase beer, vodka, liberty and smirnoff.

loans.name: Dinh

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Dinh năm nay 50 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị Dinh rất khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn. Sau khi được vay vốn của Quỹ chị Dinh đã có điều kiện đầu tư mua thêm các loại rau, đỗ… và phân bón phục vụ cho công việc trồng trọt. Đến nay chỉ sau 2 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị đã được cải thiện hơn, kinh tế gia đình cũng vì thế mà ngày càng ổn định
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các loại rau và phân bón phục vụ cho việc trồng trọt của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. L. Thi Dinh is 50 years old. She joined TYM fund in 2006. Prior to joining the fund, her family's economic situation was very difficult and she lacked the capital to do business. After borrowing from the fund, Ms. Dinh was abL. to buy vegetables, fertilizer for her farming business. Now after only 2 years in the fund, her family's income has improved and their economic situation is more stabL.. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to buy additional vegetables and fertilizer for her family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy vegetables and fertilizer

loans.name: Naziran Abdul Ghanni Group

texts.en:
My name is Naziran and I’m a 54 year old married lady. I have resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan since 1985. I belong to a Punjabi family. Punjabi people are famous for their kind heart and soft feelings. I am proud to be called a Punjabi. My husband's name is A. G., and he is a wood seller by profession, and has 20 years of experience. I have five children: four sons and one daughter. My first two sons drive a tractor for agriculture. The other two work as delivery men and use a donkey cart for loading material from one place to another. My daughter stays at home and helps me in making embroidered dresses. I make embroidered clothes by order and earn Pak rupees 2000. My work supports my husband in some ways, e.g. to pay electricity bills, and water bills. I successfully repaid my first loan which I took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again to expand my husband’s business of buying wood.

I am a group leader of a few more members in my locality. Sajida S. baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Ameeran baji wants a loan to buy plastic shopping bags to resell. Samreen naz baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle named “Shahzore”. Razia sultana baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to resell

loans.name: Muhand

texts.en:
Muhand A. is 24 years old, a single man living in Gaza city. At a very young age he has taken on the responsibility of caring for his elderly parents. He opened a small store in which he sells a variety of items ranging from soap and canned goods to prepaid cell phone cards. 

Muhnad is requesting a loan to increase the variety of items in his inventory and to improve the appearance of his shop. He wants to attract more customers, expand his business and increase his income so that he can better care for his parents.

loans.use: To increase the variety of items in his inventory and improve the appearance of his shop

loans.name: Thuy

texts.vi:
Chị Lưu Thị Thuý năm nay 36 tuổi, chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại huyện Kim động Tỉnh Hưng Yên. Chị Thuý tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 11 năm. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị Thuý có một cửa hàng  nhỏ chuyên kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Sau khi có thêm nguồn vốn vay của Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh quần áo. Hiện tại chị đang là chủ cửa hàng kinh doanh rất nhiều loại quần áo tại huyện Kim Động với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài ra chồng chị còn làm thêm nghề xe ôm nên thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  15.000.000đ để đầu tư cho việc kinh doanh quần áo của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. L. Thi Thuy is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 small children in Kim Dong District in the town of Hung Yen. Ms. Thuy joined TYM fund 11 years ago. Prior to joining the fund, Ms. Thuy had a small grocery store. After being able to borrow money from the fund, she invested in a clothing shop. Presently she is the owner of a clothing store that carries many different styles in Kim Dong District with average monthly income of 120 USD. In addition, her husband also makes money giving rides on his motorcycle, so her family's economic situation is very stable. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 900 USD to invest in her clothing shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nusrat Parveen Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
I am Nusrat Parveen and I live in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its sweetmeat and handicrafts. I have been living in this city for the past 20 years. I am a widow and am bringing up my children without any support. My husband left me in circumstances where I had no way to go on. But I am very thankful to God that I know the skill of embroidery and sewing clothes. This skill helps me in improving my financial conditions. I am a mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. My elder son is a carpenter and makes wooden doors. The next son drives a truck. My younger son has a scrap business. My two daughters are enrolled in a local school. I want to give my daughters a good education. For this purpose I am still involved in an embroidery business. I save my money to pay their tuition and school fees. I have successfully paid my first loan to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now, I am applying to buy wood for my elder son so that he able to make more wooden doors and earn a good profit.

I am a group leader of a few more women in my locality. Shamshad and Razia each want a loan to pay the installments of their auto-rickshaws (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nazia wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw . Najma wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Fatima wants a loan to repair their vehicle (named “Shahzore”). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase wood to make wooden doors

loans.name: Benna Akiya Group

texts.en: Benna A. is 34 years old and a mother of one child who is aged 8. She supports two dependants aged 6 and 9 years respectively.  She has a business of selling beer and local brew, and has been in this business for over 10 years in Luwayo. Her loans have been helping her so much with her business and now this one will help her acquire raw materials like sim sim and bananas for her local brew business. Her biggest challenge is the seasonality of her business, but because of the experience she has, she has been able to retain her customers throughout the season.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for making local brew like sim sim, bananas and others.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em S., 35, sells vegetables and meats by transporting them to customers' homes. She has been selling since 2000. She is married with four children, all of whom are single and in school. Her husband is a construction worker, as well as a motorcycle taxi driver. This means that after he works as construction worker, he drives a motorcycle taxi. Because the motorcycle is old and often breaks down, S. would like to request a loan to change her husband's motorcycle to attract customers. S.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: To change her husband's motorcycle to attract customers

loans.name: Hao

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hảo 33 tuổi tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Chị Hảo đang sống  cùng chồng và 3 con tại xã Hưng Phúc huyện Hưng Nguyên tỉnh Nghệ An. Hiện nay công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đìnhchị Hảo là tư chăn nuôi và  đánh bắt cá với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng . 
Với mức vốn xin vay 10.000.000đ  trong vòng vốn tới chị Hảo dự định sẽ sử dụng để mua trâu về nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Hao is 33 years old, and joined TYM fund since 1999. Ms. Hao lives with her husband and 3 children in the village of Hung Phuc, District of Hung N. in the town of Nghe An. Currently, the main source of her family income is from raising animals and fishing with income of 180 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to buy buffaloes to raise

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional buffaloes to raise

loans.name: Najjanakumbi A- Barbra Group

texts.en:
Barbra N. is friendly and seems hard-working. She sells agricultural produce like maize, beans, millet, sorghum, soya beans, and groundnuts in Najjanakumbi where she rents a stall at the rate of Ush 120,000 per month. On average, Barbra sells goods worth Ush 200,000 per week from which she earns a weekly profit of Ush 60,000. She is using this loan to purchase more cereals, especially maize, beans, groundnuts, and millet. She has also made some advance payments to upcountry suppliers.

Barbra is a married mother of 4 children. In addition, she cares for 7 orphaned children. With the responsibilities at hand, she dreams of opening up a wholesale retail shop in the city, hoping that it will earn her more income as compared to the present business. With increased profits, she would love to see these 11 children through school successfully.

loans.use: Purchase more cereals, especially maize, beans, groundnuts, and millet

loans.name: Te

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Tế  năm nay 36 tuổi. Gia đìnhchị  có 3 con còn nhỏ. Năm 2000 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn.  Công việc chăn nuôi đang phát triển tốt và là một trong  những công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đìnhchị Tế hiện nay. Bên cạnh chăn nuôi hàng năm gia đình chị Tế còn có thêm nguồn thu từ công việc thợ mộc của chồng nên kinh tế đang ngày càng phát triển hơn với mức thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 13.000.000đ để đầu tư  mua trâu về nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. T. Thi Te is 36 years old. Her family has 3 young children. In 2000 she joined TYM fund and borrowed money to raise pigs. Her animal farming business is expanding quite well, and is one of the sources of her family's income currently. In addition to raising animals, her husband also has a carpentry business so their family's economic situation improves day by day with average income of 208 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 775 USD to buy buffaloes to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy buffaloes to raise

loans.name: Menunatu

texts.en:
Menunatu A. is single and has no children. She has received no formal education. Menunatu prepares porridge, known as Koko, and a special kind of doughnut which is known as Koose. She uses corn and millet for the preparation of the Koko, and uses beans and flour to prepare the Koose. She normally sells them in the morning as breakfast to her customers who don't have time to fix breakfast before leaving home.

Her business is located at Koforl near Elmina. She has been in business since 1994. Menunatu uses her income to take care of her family. Menunatu will use the loan to increase production and sales by buying more corn, millet, beans and other ingredients needed for the food production. With the new profits from her expanded business, Menunatu plans to pay utility bills and other expenses. In the picture is an example of millet, which she uses to make the porridge.

loans.use: Menunatu will use the loan to increase production and sales by buying more corn, millet, beans, and other ingredients needed for food production.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M., a 45-year-old mother from Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur, is a rice farmer. Her husband helps her till a small parcel of land just to have enough food to share with her children. She has spent her life growing rice and other crops. She never loses hope that someday she and her family will have a better life.  

Agnes would like a loan of $175 to purchase sacks of certified seeds and fertilizers to improve the quality of her harvest. She also is willing to look for some other possible work to augment their income.

"Joining the CEVI credit program is the best thing that has ever happened to me, ” she said. “Since then, I have access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI offers to their clients,” she added.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of certified seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
This 40-year-old member from Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental is expanding her business with a meager capital of PHP 3,000. Maricel D. J. has 5 children and has received various loans from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, being a member for almost 8 years. Her 1st loan was used in fish vending and ran for 7 years. She got a micro-housing loan for the completion of their home. Her husband manages a blacksmithy and repair workshop where the capital was also financed by Paglaum MPC.

All these loans were repaid in a timely manner, and Maricel remains until present a member in good standing. The loan windows of Paglaum MPC helped the couple send their children to school. Recently, Maricel is hooked on the idea of putting up a little "sari-sari" (variety) store. She thinks their daily needs can be supplied by the income from the store. She said it's not a losing battle facing everyday hardships, having her husband by her siD.. And she is truly thankful to Paglaum MPC for keeping them company in all their financial needs. What they focus on is taking care of their existing businesses.

Maricel has applied for a loan in the amount of PHP 40,000 which shall be used for expanding their blacksmith business. A portion of the amount will be for her little store and a fraction will be for the educational needs of her daughter who is in college.

In the future, the couple wishes to operate a real grocery store and wants to acquire a "videoke" machine. They aspire to support their children through their chosen courses and until they establish their own careers. Maricel said all the reason for their sacrifices is their children.

loans.use: additional capital for blacksmith, stock for "sari-sari" (variety) store & education of her children

loans.name: Nay

texts.en: Mr. Nay M. is a motorcycle taxi driver in Pursat Province. He can earn around US$ 3 per day, but currently his income has declined because his motorcycle is old. He is married to Mrs. Un Nhanh who is a rice farmer. He has three children, all of whom are in school. To keep a stable income, M. would like to request a loan to change his motorcycle and purchase another one that can attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase another newer motorcycle that can attract more customers

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
GraceT. is one of the executive members of Kilibaki lending group in Jinja. She is a devoted and hard-working lady with a business of selling old clothes in markets as well as running a tailoring business for 6 years. She is happy that now she has a larger bale of clothing to sell and also she now owns two sewing machines with which she does her tailoring work.

Grace has also been able to acquire a bicycle which complements her tailoring business by serving for collecting materials as well as distributing the already sewn clothing to the respective owners. Grace needs another loan to help with buying more used clothes as well as materials for sewing; the profits will help her to send her kids back to school next year.

loans.use: More used clothing and materials for sewing

loans.name: Seidu

texts.en:
Seidu A. A. sells a variety of men's and women's watches at Cape Coast. She has received a junior high education. 

Seidu has been selling a variety of watches since 2006. He is responsible for paying rent and other utility bills. His loan will be used to increase his capital to buy more watches. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest for the expansion of his watch business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to increase his capital to buy more watches to sell.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman A. Z. is a 23-year-old young woman who sells office and school supplies. She is good at what she does, which is why she has been able to support her family, especially her sick father who needs special care and medicine.

Eman wishes to expand her business and purchase more office supplies to sell. She is requesting a loan of $1200 for this purpose.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more office supplies.

loans.name: Fatimatu

texts.en:
Fatimatu Z. is single and has no child. She has received schooling through the primary level. Fatimatu sells plastic bowls and other items at Iture near Elmina, which she has done for a brief time. Fatimatu uses her income to pay rent and other utility bills.

Fatimatu will use the loan to purchase additional capital to buy more plastic products for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fatimatu plans to save towards building a house which has been her greatest heart's desire.<> The items in front of her are some plastic products, a sample of what she sells.

loans.use: Fatimatu will use the loan for additional capital to buy more plastic products for resale.

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en:
Nhoem S. is 34 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She is a farmer who specializes in rice, vegetables as well as fruit crops in her village, growing corm trees and morning glories. Farming is her main source to earn income for her family's expenses. Generally, she will sell her production to wholesalers, 4 or 5 months after planting. To help earn additional income for her family, S. is raising pigs at her home.

S. is married with one son who is attending school. Her husband, Nou Eum, 32, also works with her. S. hopes to have two buffalo to help her plow her farmland, therefore she decided to request a loan to be able to do that. (S.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase two buffalo

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria K. sells food items like raw rice, fresh tomatoes, Gari, and others at Iture near Elmina. Victoria has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Victoria has been selling food like raw rice, fresh tomatoes, Gari and other items since 1998. She is responsible for the family's food and other expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more food for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest and expand her trade in food sales.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi H. is a single, 20-year-old man who lives with his parents and a younger brother who is still in school. Mahdi started a business selling spices such as cinnamon, cloves, raisins and vinegar to help support his family. Although Mahdi's father works, his salary is not enough to cover the expenses of the family.

Mahdi is hoping to take his first loan to purchase more spices, which will help him to support his family and provide for their basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more spices for sale.

loans.name: Vay

texts.en: Mrs. Vay Y. is 44 years old and a rice farmer who lives in Koh Village. She has been farming since 1980 and is married with three children; one is employed and the other helps with the family's farm. Her husband is a construction worker and being mobile is one of the requirements of his job. Rice farming is the main source of income for the family and she is responsibility of caring for the farm. She is requesting a loan to purchase three oxen to use on the farm.

loans.use: Purchase three oxen for use on the farm

loans.name: Mursal

texts.en:
Mursal lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. Her house is near a course where she studied part-time. She is married and she has two children. She works in tailoring and she is 40 years old. She wants to expand her business to help her family and she needs a loan.

She has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for term of 12 months to complete her stock and take a shop for her tailoring near her house, so she can start working really hard. She wants to thank Kiva for this process of loans that helps poor people around the whole world.

Mursal is very happy with this loan process of Kiva's, and she is very happy for this loan. She hopes to continue her partnership with both AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: To complete her stock and take a shop for her tailoring

loans.name: Hiede

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiede H. is 27 years old, married and has 1 child. Her husband is a carpenter, motor-tricycle taxi driver and a jeweler. Her husband is well rounded and must be resourceful in order to raise his family. Aside from driving his passenger tricycle for hire, he is also makes rings on a per order basis from his neighbors and friends. He is building his first fishing boat. It will used for fishing as they live nearby the seashore.

Hiede joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative over a year ago and she very much appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending their Weekly Center Meetings.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 13,000.00. This loan is intended to purchase additional materials to finished her husbands fishing boat.

They are planning to build their own house since they are now living together with her mother. They would like to send their child on to college to complete a degree.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for a fishing boat

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. sells food items like fresh tomatoes and pepper, onions, and others at Iture near Elmina. Elizabeth has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children; her husband is a mason. Elizabeth has been selling food items since 2007. She is responsible for paying the children's school fees and other utility bills.

Her loan will be used to buy additional capital for more food for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy as an additional capital to buy more food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Near the seashore of Becor Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Mrs. Flora A. resides. She is 61 years old, a widow, and blessed with 7 children. Six are already married and one is still single. Her husband died last December 9, 2005, and she is now living as a single parent.
 
After the tragedy, Flora never stopped finding ways to inspire herself and find to generate a daily income by managing her little Sari-sari Store.      

She applied for membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative 5 years ago, and she admires the programs and services being offered and other benefits like continuous education, insurance and dividends to the members.

Paglaum MPC is her partner in business. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000.00, as additional capital to her business to purchase additional grocery stock to sell in her Sari-sari store.

What she plans now is to renovate her little Sari-sari store and leave a comfortable life through God’s will.

loans.use: Purchase additional grocery stock to resell

loans.name: Munisa

texts.en:
Munisa J. processes and sells various types of dried apricots. She has been in this business for many years. She is 40 years old and she has two children with her husband. Her husband is a farmer who grows vegetables.

Munisa purchases dried apricots from local farmers at wholesale prices and after remaking them, she sells them at the local food market. Munisa’s revenues contribute significantly to the household and help support the education expenses of her children. She is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for working capital and to pay to transport her food items. She believes the extra income will help to improve the living conditions of her family. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. History of note includes: it was once a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki; and the birthplace of the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jerrylin

texts.en:
“I want to raise my children well. I want to provide for their needs and help them build a bright future,” says Jerrylin S., a 31-year-old mother of three children from Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Concerned about her children’s education, she joined the CEVI credit program in order to start a business and earn a living for the family. Jerrylin knows that with her husband’s income as a tricycle driver, she would struggle to send all of their children to school.

Jerrylin raises pigs in their backyard and wants to increase her profits from this venture. She is also looking into some other lines of work to increase the family’s inadequate income.

She would like a loan of $175 to purchase piglets and feed. She believes that by taking good care of the pigs, she would earn enough income to address her family's  needs.

CEVI has provided Jerrylin with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage, to help her grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. is married and has 8 dependants. She has received no formal education. Efua sells a special kind of doughnut. This type is larger in size, and the ingredients are flour, margarine, and sugar. She sells her doughnuts at Atonkwa near Elmina. Her husband is a pensioner. Efua uses her income to pay for her children's school fees and other utility bills.

Efua will use the loan to purchase additional capital to buy flour, margarine, and other ingredients for the preparation of doughnuts for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to take care of the family's financial needs, which she has been struggling to meet, along with her husband. In the picture, she is in the act of frying the 'Bofrot'.

loans.use: Efua will use the loan to purchaseb additional capital to buy more flour, margarine, and other ingredients for the preparation of doughnuts to sell.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en:
Marhamat is married and has 4 children. She is a 58 year old woman. Despite her age, she’s still strong, bright, and doing well with her business. She started her business processing dried fruits and selling them at the market 10 years ago. The business has been growing little by little, permitting her to cover her family's needs, especially those of her children. Her goal is to grow as a business owner; she likes the work she is doing.

Marhamat is very hopeful about this business; you can help by fulfilling her loan request. She is requestinga loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD). With these funds, she will purchase dried apricots, which will help her to increase the range of goods she sells.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. History of note includes: it was once a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki; and the birthplace of the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). loans.use: To purchase dried apricots to sell

loans.name: Amena

texts.en:
Amena M. sells fish, which she buys from fishermen, and brings them home for processing and preservation. She then sends them to the market for sale at Atonkwa near Elmina. Amena has received no formal education. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a sanitary officer. Mena has been selling fish since 2002.

She is responsible for paying the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of her trade in fish sales. She was frying fish when the picture was taken.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Makhsusa

texts.en:
Makhsusa M. is 20 years old. She sells foodstuffs and children's toys. She has been in this business for four years. She began her business as a street vendor near the local school in her community. She has expanded her business and now she has a little kiosk where she sells her goods. Weekly, she travels to the neighboring town to purchase new goods to sell.

Makhsusa currently lives with her parents and brother. Her father recently came back from Russia. He got seriously ill and now he receives a pension because he is disabled. Because of this hardship, Makhsusa works very hard; she is the family's primary bread-winner.

Currently Makhsusa is requesting a loan of 1500 Somoni ($450 USD) to purchase foodstuffs to expand her business. Makhsusa sincerely thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be faithful with the loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Mohijon

texts.en:
Mohijon N. is 50 years old. She is married with 2 children. Mohijon is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family and educate her children. Thanks to her example, her children are now working adults.

Mohijon sells various sorts of dried apricots at the local food market in the town of Isfara. She purchases her products from wholesalers and then, after processing them, sells them at a local market. She has been in the business for 15 years. She got her startup money after saving from her previous business.

Mohijon has received 15 loans from IMON International. The loans have helped her business; her customers tell her that her business is well-stocked with high-quality products. Furthermore, having cash in hand has permitted her to purchase more goods and make better deals with wholesalers. Now she is requesting a loan in order to purchase dried apricots. She will re-make them to sell in the market at the best prices. With your help, Mohijon will be able to get ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. loans.use: To purchase dried apricots to sell

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en:
Dilafruz N. is 19 years old. She lives with her parents. She is a well-known seamstress in her community. She has more than two years of experience.

Two years ago, Dilafruz decided to take advantage of her reputation. Her father bought her a sewing machine. Since then, she has been working as a tailor. She is now a successful entrepreneur with well-established clientele, the majority of whom are young girls who often order the national dresses. She constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow.

Now she is requesting a loan of 3700 Somoni ($1100 USD) for the term of 12 months so she can purchase a new, modern sewing machine to make dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Dilafruz and her family are grateful for your generosity and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
Zafar R. is 37 years old. He is married with three children. Zafar is a very diligent and hard-working man. He provides taxi services with his car. Zafar’s usual center of business is Isfara-Khujand. For the last two years, his taxi business has been the main source of income for his family. This has allowed him to help improve the living conditions of his large family.

Currently, his daily profit is about 80-100 Somoni. In addition to his wife and children, he also supports his parents. Like any business, his business requires additional capital from time to time. His car has fallen into disrepair and he needs to fix it. For this reason, Zafar is requesting 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for the term of 9 months. Zafar promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all who support him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Rahimdjon

texts.en:
Rahimdjon R. is a hard-working man. Over the years, he has been focused on strengthening the family business - cattle sales - so he can provide for his children. With the experience he has gained over the last 15 years in business, he has been able to grow his business and bring stability to his family.

Rahimdjon has a friendly family who always try to help each other. In the photo, you can see his wife who helps him with the business. Now Rahimdjon has decided to build his own business raising animals. He will care for the animals for a short period of time and then sell them at his city's large stock shows. Therefore, he has requested 4,000 Somoni ($1,200 USD) for the term of 5 months.

Rahimdjon has already received one loan from Kiva. Thanks to his previous loan, he was able to increase the number of cows he cared for and improve his business. Rahimdjon is counting on your help once again and thanks you very much for your love and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Ma. Erlene

texts.en:
Ma. Erlene A. is 40 years old, and married with five children. She and her husband grow rice to support their children’s education. Ma. Arlene knows that with their current income, they need to go the extra mile to be able to provide for all the family's needs.  

She would like a loan of $175 to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds for her farm. She believes that with a loan from CEVI, she can increase her yield and earnings, which will help the family's living situation.

CEVI keeps its promise to continuously uplift its clients. Through the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage they offer, more entrepreneurial poor like Ma. Arlene will benefit in augmenting their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice seed for farming

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba Z. is married and has 10 dependants. She has received no formal education. Araba sells food, such as plantain, cassava, maize, and other items at Atonkwa near Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is a teacher. Araba uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs.

Araba will use the loan to purchase additional capital to buy more food for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to invest towards further the education of their children. In front of her are plantain and empty gallons, which she uses to buy oil for resale.

loans.use: Araba will use the loan to purchase as an additional capital to buy more food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.en:
Jamoliddin S. is 55 years old. He lives in Isfara. He is married and has 5 children. Jamoliddin has a business processing and selling dried fruits in the central local market. He is experienced in the business of making dried fruit.

Jamoliddin is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children. Today his children are working adults thanks to his example.

Jamoliddin purchases dried fruits from local farmers at wholesale. After processing them, he sells them to his customers. Because he buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Jamoliddin to make his business quite successful and it brings a stable income to his family. Currently, he needs a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) to buy supplies so he can continue to offer good products to his customers. Jamoliddin expresses his gratitude for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur V. is 29 years old. He is married with two children. Bahodur provides taxi services in the community. He has been in this business for the last 3 years. He has always tried to provide the highest quality services but at attractive prices to the customers. Bahodur is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable. He is the main bread-winner for his family and also cares for his parents.

Bahodur works from the early morning until late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones. Currently, he plans to replace the fuel supply system in his car with one that uses gas, which is less expensive than petrol. Therefore, he is requesting 3000 Somoni ($900 US Dollars) for the term of 9 months. He thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. loans.use: To purchase a new fuel system for his car

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is married and has 3 children. She has received no formal education. Cecilia sells food stuffs like plantain, banana, oranges, and others at Atonkwa near Elmina. She has been in business since 1998. Cecilia uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs.

Cecilia will use the loan to purchase additional capital to buy more food for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to invest towards educating her children.

loans.use: Cecilia will use the loan to purchase additional capital to buy more food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat Z. is a 44-year-old married mother of four children. She lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. For the past 6 years, Sharofat has helped her husband earn money by processing dried apricots and selling them at the market. Sharofat has applied for a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) to expand her operation. She wants to buy more dried apricots so she can earn more and improve her living. Sharofat says that this is the perfect time for her to take out a loan. By offering a better selection of produce, she knows she will be able to capitalize on this opportunity by obtaining more clients. Her goal is to continue expanding and improving her business every day, and, more importantly, to always ensure that her four children can attend a good school. Sharofat is very grateful to everyone who is helping her to achieve her dreams with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. History of note includes: it was once a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki; and the birthplace of the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina A. sells fish, which she buys from fishermen, and then brings them home for processing and preservation. She then sends them to the market for sale at Atonkwa near Elmina. Dina has made her way through a junior high education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a trader.

Dina has been selling fish since 1998. She assists her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest in fish sales to expand her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles D. is 48 years old, married and has two children. For the last 10 years, he has worked as a taxi driver. He picks passengers up at the local lorry station and carries them to nearby towns. However, his business is in crisis because his car has broken down and needs repair. This loan will permit Charles to fix his car, resume his business and make money to support his family and get his children back to school.

Charles is a member of a loan group called Ultimate Trust Group. Members of this group support one when it comes to repaying the loan.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina M. is married and has 4 dependants. She is educated through junior high. Augustina sells fabric and footwear at Elmina, which she has done since 2005. Her husband is a teacher. Augustina uses her income for paying her children's school fees and other utility bills.

Augustina will use the loan to buy more fabric and footwear for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Augustina plans to open a savings account so that she can start saving towards achieving her goals. In her lap is a sample of the things she sells.

loans.use: Augustina will use the loan to buy more fabric and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. started her restaurant three years ago in Ashaiman, a suburb of Tema where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 32 years old and married with a child, who is currently in school. 

She serves many kinds of local dishes, including fufu, rice balls and banku. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and eaten with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and eaten with hot pepper or soup. These are the popular local dishes most Ghanaians enjoy very much.

With the loan, Alice wants to buy the supplies -- such as bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish and firewood -- she needs to expand her business. She hopes to use part of the loan to finance her child’s education. She is a member of a borrowing group called the Favour Trust Group. Members of this group agree to help each other repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies, including bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish and firewood.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi Z. sells fried fish. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen at the shore, and brings them to her house for frying. She then sends them to the market for sale at Atonkwa near Elmina. Esi has received a junior high education. She is married and has 6 dependants.

Esi has been selling fried fish since 1993. She actually spends all of her income on the business, since her husband takes care of all the family's financial expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities and oil for frying the fish, and then for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she wants to build with her husband for the family, and also support her husband to get their children a high level of education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities and oil for frying the fish and then for sale.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan I. is 56 years old, married and has five children. Two of his children have completed teacher-training college and are now working. The rest of them are still in school. He lives with his family at Teshie, a suburb of Accra. 

Alhassan has made a living as a beef seller for the past 22 years. He buys cows in Ashaiman, a town 30 kilometers away, and resells the meat to his customers. Because the price of cows is now very high, Alhassan no longer has enough money to support his business. He is applying for a loan to buy additional cows so that he can serve his customers good-quality beef for their meals. He hopes to increase his income and support his younger children in school. Alhassan belongs to a community organization called the Awake Trust Group. Members of this group agree to support each other when it comes to making loan payments.

loans.use: To buy additional cows.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena Q. sells food items like rice, cooking oil, sugar, and other items at Atonkwa near Elmina. Helena has received no formal education. She is married and has 4 dependants. Her husband is a trader.

Helena has been selling food items since 2000. She is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy additional capital for her food for her shop for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy as an additional capital to buy more food stuff and groceries into her shop for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith makes a living selling vegetables and spices -- such as tomatoes, peppers, onions and other items -- in the local market of Ashaiman, a suburb of the city of Tema in Ghana. She is 28 years old, married and has one child who is currently in school. She travels to nearby faming communities to procure supplies directly from farmers. This allows her to avoid middlemen who resell to traders like her at higher price. Judith does not have adequate working capital to support her business, which is why she sometimes obtains her supplies on credit and makes payment after sales, with lender's charges added.  

Judith has applied for a loan so that she can increase her supplies of vegetables and spices. By doing this, she also hopes to increase her profit margin so that she can have more money to support her family and fund her child's education.  Judith is a member of an organization called the Knowledge Trust Group. Members of this group help one another repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. is 49 years old, married and has four children who are currently attending school. Doris loves education but could not go far in her own life because of lack of financial support. It is her fervent wish to provide her children with better life opportunities through education. She owns and operates a grocery store in one of the busy local markets of Accra. She sells various items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts and evaporated milk.

She has applied for a loan so that she can upgrade her stock by buying more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil and other items. She wants to take advantage of Christmas festivities to increase her income and support the schooling of her children. She is a member of the community group called Awake Trust Group. Members of this group pledge to help each other repay loans if needed.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk and vegetable oil and other items

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is a wife and mother of two children ages 17 and 9. She is a 30-year-old trader who sells in charcoal in Ashaiman, a suburb of Tema where she lives with her family. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. It is obtained from burned fresh logs. Through this trade, she has earned enough money to allow her oldest child to complete senior high school. Christiana obtains her supplies of charcoal from surrounding villages and resells them to her customers.

She has applied for a loan to buy supplies in bulk. She believes the loan will allow her to increase her savings and provide for the educational needs of her children. She is a member of an organization called the Knowledge Trust Group. Members of this group help each other repay loans, if needed.

loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Mama Agi, as she is popularly called by her many customers, is a 42-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and blessed with six children. With the income from her business, she has provided for five of her children to graduate from high school while her youngest child is still studying.

In her restaurant, she prepares and sells local foods like fufu and banku. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Agnes says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs a loan to meet production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

Agnes is a member of the Gold Trust Group. Members of this group agree to help each other repay a loan, if needed.

loans.use: To buy more supplies like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish and firewood.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is 55 years old. She is married and the mother of three children who are now grown. She makes a living selling undergarments and children’s clothes. She sells her goods while walking around, balancing her stock on her head as she moves from door to door.  She is very hard working and resourceful, as is her husband, which is why they were able to send all of their children to school. 

With the loan, she wants to expand and upgrade her supply of items to sell. Comfort especially wants to take advantage of Christmas festivities to make more income.  She is a member of the Awake Trust Group. Members of this group agree to help each other repay a loan, if needed.

loans.use: To buy more undergarments and clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Berna Nanyonga’S Group

texts.en:
Berna is a leader of 4-member loan group. She is a 50-year-old widow with 5 children between 30 and 15 years old. Two of her children died. She is looking after 5 orphans of her late children and her old parents. She resides and owns a three-room house where she is staying with ten people. They have electricity and no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. 

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport to and from shopping and rents her business premises at 40000 per month in Kamwokya, one of the city suburbs, and works seven days a week. Berna has been with MCDT for eight years, working all along with the same groupmates. This is her twelfth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy clothes for the Christmas season. The other loan members want to do similar things.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the Christmas season

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa A. is 36 years old, married and the mother of two children, Muniru and Mariama Ganiru, who are in school. She operates a clothing shop in Ashaiman, a suburb of Tema, where she lives with her family. For the past three years, Latifa has made a living selling jeans, blouses, skirts, women slippers, bags and headscarfs. But a lack of funds has forced her to operate on a very small scale. 

She has applied for a loan to expand her business. She believes the loan will help her buy a larger and higher-quality inventory of goods, particularly of jeans, women's clothing, headscarfs and slippers. Latifa is a member of the Gold Trust Group. Members agree to help each other repay loans.

loans.use: To buy jeans, ladies clothing and slippers

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 32 years old, married and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her family in Tema, where she has worked as a seamstress for five years. She specializes in women's clothing, and makes a wide range of garments that can be worn at weddings, funerals and other occasions. She also sells bottled water as a source of extra income. 

Cecelia has applied for a loan to buy additional supplies such as linen, threads and thimbles. Her goal is to increase her income by improving her output and efficiency. She plans to use the increased income to provide her children with high-quality education. She is a member of the “Nyame ye” (or God is Good) Group. Members help each other secure and repay loans.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as linen, threads and thimbles

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel A. T. is a 62-year-old merchant. He is married and has five children. He is quite advanced in age and limited in strength, yet he is committed to care for his children.
