In particular, it is his dream to provide quality education for all of them so that they have a better life in the future. Currently, two of his children are still in school. 

Emmanuel owns and operates a grocery store where he sells items such as rice, canned foods and drinks, cooking oil, biscuits, candies and evaporated milk. With the loan, he wants to buy more supplies, including cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil. By increasing his stock of different items, he hopes to make enough income to provide for the educational needs of his children. He belongs to the Awake Trust Group, whose members agree to help each other secure and repay loans.

loans.use: To buy more spuulies, including bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk and cartons of vegetable oil

loans.name: Akole

texts.en:
Akole T. is 38 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. She makes a living selling food, including cassava dough, corn dough and maize, in the local market of Koforidua, the town where she lives. Cassava and corn dough are produced by milling fresh cassava and maize to obtain the main ingredients for banku, one of the most popular dishes in Ghana. She has been in this business for the past eight years, and has lots of experience in serving and winning over customers. 

Akole is a hard worker, and aims to save enough money to provide her children with a quality education. She plans to use this loan to buy increased supplies of cassava and maize so that she can make enough dough to satisfy her customers’ needs. She is a member of the Good Shepherd Trust Group, whose members agree to help each other secure and repay loans. 

Akole does not sell on the days her group meets, and this photo was taken during a meeting. She would be grateful for any assistance Kiva lenders are able to provide.

loans.use: To buy additional cassava and maize.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah T. is 33 years old, married and blessed with five children. When it comes to paying her family's bills and providing enough food to eat, Sarah is a very resourceful and hard worker. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey, a local dish made from corn dough (milled from fresh maize grains) which is cooked and then eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She sells kenkey in the morning and afternoon to school children, and as a breakfast dish for local workers. She has many customers, since Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for both breakfast and lunch.

With this loan, she wants to increase the size of her business by buying more supplies such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. If she can expand her business, she will be able to increase her savings and pay for her children’s education. Sarah is a member of the Good Shepherd Trust Group, whose members agree to help each other repay loans. 

Sarah does not sell on the days her group meets, and this photo was taken during a meeting.

loans.use: To purchase supplies such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie B. is 40 years old, and married with six children. She is a rice farmer. Her husband is a carpenter, and they joyfully work together to provide all of their children’s needs and send all of them to school.

Melanie would like a loan of $125 to purchase sacks of certified seeds and fertilizers for her farm. She is certain that she needs to invest well in her farm to achieve a good yield.

She is thankful to have joined the CEVI credit program because she now has access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage, which the program offers to all of their clients.

loans.use: To purchase certified seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Mrs. O. is employed by National House Insurance, working as a consultant in the department calculating pensions and allowances. She has been working in this office for 7 years, since 2001. She has a monthly income of 2701.85 lei. Ana is married and lives with her husband in their apartment in Ungheni City. She has one child at home who is a student. Ana's husband gets a monthly salary of 2500 lei. 

She has not benefited from other loans from Microinvest. She has requested a loan worth 10,000 lei 
to improve their living conditions, to purchase equipment for heating. The total cost of the investment is 18,000 lei because her own contributions are worth 8000 lei.

loans.use: To improve living conditions

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel A. is 30 years old, married and has three children. Currently, all of them are in school. She lives with her family in Odumase, a suburb of Koforidua in the eastern region of Ghana. Here, Rachel makes a living caring for babies and selling infant's clothes, pampers, powder, napkins, detergents, bottles and other items. Her experience in this market over the past six has won her many customers, but her major difficulty has been raising funds to expand her business. 

With a loan, she wants to buy more supplies such as clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil and detergent. She believes this will allow her to increase her income and provide her children with a good education. Rachel is a member of the God is King Trust Group, whose members agree to help each other secure and repay loans. 

She does not work on the days when her group meets, and this photo was taken during a meeting.

loans.use: To buy more supplies, such as baby's clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil and detergents

loans.name: Milly Nampebwa’S Group

texts.en:
Milly is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 27-year-old widow with 2 children ages 4 and 7 years. Both her children go to school. She doesn’t take in additional family members. She resides in and owns a three-room house where they have electricity and no piped water. The family gets three meals a day. 

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She operates her business from her home and doesn’t incur any transportation costs since she buys from Kasubi, one of the city suburbs, and works seven days a week. Milly has been with MCDT for four years, working all along with the same groupmates, and this is her eighth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Milly is aspiring of being able to buy a full lorry of charcoal. The other group members want to do similar things.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. is a 47-year-old widow who has two children. As a single parent, she must work very hard to support her family. Currently, one of her children has completed high school, while the other is still in school.  For the past 20 years, Agnes has made a living selling porridge in her neighborhood. She has lots of experience in porridge production and selling to a wide range of customers. 

Agnes has applied for a loan to buy more maize, milk and sugar,  the major ingredients in her porridge. Buy buying in bulk now, she will be able to avoid price hikes and lower her costs significantly. This will allow her to pay for her younger child’s education. 

Agnes is a member of the Awake Trust group, whose members agree to help one another repay loans.

loans.use: To buy maize, milk and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth T. is 24 years old and single. She had to leave school early to support her family, and went into business baking bread, which she sells to customers in Koforidua, a town where she lives. She also provides bread to other businesses who sell porridge, coffee and breakfast to their customers. Demand for her bread is high, but Elizabeth has lacked funds to meet that demand. Also, the prices of commodities such as flour, sugar and margarine are going up, which makes it difficult to earn a good income. 

Elizabeth has applied for a loan to make bulk purchases of ingredients such as flour, sugar and margarine. This will allow her to expand her operations and meet customer demand. She also hopes to use her additional income to go back to school and pursue her dream of becoming a nurse. 

Elizabeth is a member of an organization called God is King. Members of this group agree to help each other secure and repay loans. She does not sell on the days her group meets, and this photo was taken during a meeting.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, sugar and margarine

loans.name: Chrstine Nabadda’S Group

texts.en:
Christine is the leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 35-year-old married woman with 5 children, ages 2 to 15 years. All her children go to school. She doesn’t take in additional family members. She resides in and rents a three-room house. They have electricity and no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. 

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She rents her business premises and uses public transportation to and from work. Christine works seven days a week. Christine has been with MCDT for four years, working all along with the same groupmates, and this is her eighth loan. She wants to use lthe oan to buy clothes for the festival season. Christine is aspiring to buy clothes from Dubai directly. The other group members have similar aspirations.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the festival season

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nanama

texts.en: Nanama A. is a single parent with 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Nanama sells soft drinks at Atonkwa near Elmina, which she has done since 1995. Nanama uses her income to take care of her children's financial needs. Nanama will use the loan to increase her capital to buy soft drinks in larger quantities  in addition to purchasing other goods for sale. With the additonal profits from her expanded business, Nanama plans to save for a house she would like to build for the family and also save for education expenses for her children.

loans.use: Nanama will use the loan to increase her capital to buy soft drinks in larger quantities.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 42 años, es soltera y viven en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas para poder solventar sus gastos, incursionó en este negocio desde hace 15 años, los cuales han sido muy productivos, ya aprendió a conocer los secretos del negocio, y hoy en día obtiene buenos ingresos económicos. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es adquirir la mercadería, ya que tiene que viajar para comprarla, pero a pesar de esos pequeños inconvenientes Irma sabe que su trabajo es dignificante y lo realiza con la mayor alegría, esperando progresar y salir adelante en busca de sus sueños. Ella se encuentra en su noveno préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Y con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Irma is 42 years old, single, and lives in a house that her parents left to her. She sells sweets to cover her expenses, and has been involved in this business for the last 15 years, which have been very productive. She has learned the secrets of the business, and today she makes a good living. The most difficult part of her work is acquiring merchandise, as she has to travel to buy it. However, despite these small inconveniences, Irma knows that her work is dignifying and she does it with much joy, hoping to move toward achieving her dreams. She is looking for her ninth loan from Microfianzas Prisma, and with the loan, she hopes to buy a larger quantity of sweets in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase volume of merchandise in the shop

loans.name: Lhurielyn

texts.en:
“I started worrying about the cost of sending all of my children to school," says Lhurielyn V., a 40-year-old mother from Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur.  “I become very reluctant when it comes to school fees because I know that paying them would reduce our family budget," she added. But when she joined the CEVI credit program, she started to raise pigs and sell them to Mr. Pitagara, a meat retailer. From this, she earned enough money for herself and her family. Now, she no longer worries about where to get the money for school fees.

Lhurielyn would like to increase the size of her pig fence. She needs a loan of $125 to purchase additional piglets to raise. She also is willing to invest in other lines of business.

CEVI continues to help Lhurielyn sustain her business. Through credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage it offers, she can accomplish more in her chosen ventures.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Yaa Ya

texts.en: Yaa Ya A. is married and has 6 dependents. She has received no formal education. Yaa Ya sells fried fish to earn an income. She buys the fresh fish from the fishermen at the shore, brings them to her house for frying and then sends them to the market for sale at Atonkwa near Elmina, which she has done since 1992. Her husband is a fisherman. Yaa Ya uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Yaa Ya will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities and to purchase oil for frying the fish. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa Ya plans to save towards a house she wants to build for the family and also invest in further expanding her business.

loans.use: Yaa Ya will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities and to purchase oil for frying the fish.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah O. is the wife and mother of four children who are currently in school. She is a 42-year-old trader who trades in charcoal. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. Through this business, she has supported her first child to complete senior high school. Hannah obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Koforidua and retails them to her customers. Her starting capital provided by her husband is not adequate to purchase the large quantities to meet customers’ demands. Her sales and profit margin have ultimately been small. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of charcoal to increase her inventory. She believes the loan would enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children. Hannah is a member of the community group called God is King Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support to one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days, and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
“I dream of having a chain of bakeries someday. In this way I will be able to send all of my children to any college they choose to attend," says Marissa A., a 34-year-old mother from Trento, Agusan Del Sur. Her husband helps her manage their business and joyfully fulfills whatever dreams she has for the family.

Marissa and her husband started the bakery business in 1992.  Now, they need additional capital to increase their production to compete well with other bakeries. She needs a loan of $150 to purchase ingredients for making bread, to accommodate the increase in customer orders.

CEVI has always supported Marissa in her business and provides her with the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage she needs.

loans.use: Purchase flour and other ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en:
Salomey B. is 51-year-old woman, married, and the mother with eight children. She sells denim and lingerie. She says selling lingerie for women is very profitable, and she has been selling ladies' denim and lingerie for six years to support her husband in taking care of the family’s needs. With income from her business, Salomey has supported her six children to finish senior high school and the university.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more bales of lingerie and jean materials to upgrade her inventory with more variety. She wants to take advantage of the Christmas festivities and make more income during them to support her last two in school. She is a member of the group called Awake Trust Group. Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie and jeans material.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia A. sells food items like rice and sugar at Atonkwa near Elmina. Cynthia has received no formal education.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a carpenter. Cynthia has been selling food items since 1996. She spends all of her income on the business since her husband takes care of all the family's financial expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs and groceries for her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she wants to build for the family and to save for their children's a higher education.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs and groceries for her shop to resell.

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
Elona B. is 40 years old, and married with four children. She raises hogs and her husband drives a tricycle to  share in the family earnings. All her life Elona has dreamed of having a higher standard of living. She believes she needs to work harder to realize her dreams.

She needs a loan of $225 to purchase pig feed. She wants to take good care her pigs to ensure a profit from her business. She is also interested to find other sources of work to support her husband and children. 

Because Elona is a CEVI  client, she has been provided with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage to help her small business grow.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married and has 6 dependents. She has received no formal education. Mary sells groceries like biscuits, sugar, Milo, milk and others at Elmina, which she has done since early this year. Her husband is a pensioner. Mary uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Mary will use the loan as  additional capital to buy more food stuffs for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save toward extending the house to meet the needs of a large family.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty est une femme qui vend des produits artisanaux (collier, ceinture , bracelets etc). Son commerce est en plein centre ville. En cette période de saison touristique, elle sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter ses bénéfices. Avec cette actiovité elle arrive à subvenir à ses besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Maty is a woman who sells hand-crafted goods (necklaces, belts, bracelets, etc.) Her business is in the centre of town. During this current tourist season, she is asking for this loan to increase her sales. With this business, she is able to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell hand-crafted items

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 30 años, es soltera vive de forma independiente en una cuarto que alquila. Ella es una joven muy creativa que se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades desde hace 8 años, teniendo muy buenos resultados, ya que las ventas son muy buenas por los bonitos diseños que ella realiza. Lo que le gusta a Sandra de su trabajo es crear, aprendió a realizar estas manualidades viajando por las ciudades de Cuzco, Arequipa y Lima, donde asistió a cursos donde enseñaban a realizar estas novedades. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es confeccionar los pedidos que le solicitan, ya que aveces suelen ser en cantidades grandes y como ella los confecciona manualmente se demora en realizarlos. Sandra quiere progresar y salir adelante para poder cumplir sus metas trazadas, de nuestra ayuda depende que sea más fácil lograrlo. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de material para elaborar sus manualidades, en estas épocas navideñas.
texts.en:
Sandra is 30 years old, single and lives on her own in a rented room. She is a very creative young woman who has been making crafts since she was 8 years old. She has been successful because the pretty designs she makes sell very well. What Sandra likes about her job is creating. She learned how to make these crafts while traveling through cities such as Cuzco, Arequipa and Lima, where she took courses on how to make these novelties. The most difficult part of her job is making all the orders she gets. Usually they are large orders that take a long time since she makes them by hand. Sandra wants to improve her situation and get ahead in order to fulfill her goals, which would be easier with our help. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will buy larger amounts of supplies to make her crafts this holiday season with the money she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for her crafts

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es: Ursula tiene 51 años, es madre soltera de una hija llamada Sonia de 27 años de edad. Se dedica a la venta de comestibles en la tiendita escolar del colegio Claudio Galeno de la ciudad de Juliaca, obtiene muy buenas ganancias, ya que todos los niños adquieren gran cantidad de golosinas y dulces en la hora del recreo y a la hora de salida, logrando que su negocio sea muy rentable. Lo más difícil es atender a todos los niños, que presa de su entusiasmo, piden a gritos los productos que quieren comprar, pero Ursula con una gran paciencia y bondad los atiende unos uno, ya que como ella dice, son sus engreídos. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado abastecerá su tiendita escolar con más productos para abastecer la demanda de su clientela.
texts.en:
Ursula is 51 years old and a single mother. Her daughter Sonia is 27 years old. Ursula sells refreshments at the Claudio Galeno school refreshment stand in the city of Juliaca. She earns good pay since the children buy large amounts of candy and sweets at recess and after school, making the business profitable. The most difficult part is serving all the children since they get caught up in their enthusiasm and scream for the items they want to buy. Ursula serves them one by one with great patience and kindness since, as she says, they are her spoiled kids. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she has requested, she will stock her school refreshment stand with more products to meet the demands of her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina tiene 47 años, es madre soltera de dos niños, Janet de 16 y Brolin de 13 años, con quienes vive. Preocupada por el bienestar de sus pequeños hijos incursionó en el negocio de la venta de pescado, negocio con el cual viene manteniendo a su familia durante 13 años. Rufina vende el pescado de manera ambulatoria, generalmente pejerreyes, ya que estos tienen más demanda por su escasez y se usan en múltiples platos como en el ceviche, frituras, etc., los cuales buscan bastante las cocineras de los restaurantes. Lo difícil es adquirir los pescados, tiene esperar largas horas para la distribución. Rufina se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de pescado para vender y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rufina is 47 years old, single and lives with her two children, Janet 16 and Brolin 13. Worried about the well being of her small children, she got into the fish selling business which has supported her family for 13 years. Rufina travels to sell the fish. She generally sells silversides since there is more demand due to its scarcity. It is used in many dishes such as ceviche, fried food, etc. and many restaurant cooks look for it. It is difficult to get the fish. She has to wait long hours for delivery. This is Rufina's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she has requested, she will buy larger amounts of fish to sell and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase larger amounts of fish

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Madame Ramata Traoré est une femme mariée de 36 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui vit  avec son époux, ses deux coépouses et leurs enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la républque du Mali.)
Pour des raisons sociales elle abandonna les études pour se consacrer aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère. Après de longues périodes d’apprentissage elle décida de se spécialiser dans l’achat et la vente d’articles de fête. Avec une expérience de 15 ans, Ramata Traoré maîtrise parfaitement son activité et est très sollicitée des jeunes filles et jeunes femmes de la place.
Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle intégra une association de femmes de son  quartier. Après deux prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) tous  correctement remboursés, elle  passe en individuel où elle est à son premier prêt.
Elle compte achéter avec ce prêt , 15 douzaines de mèches (de variétés et de qualités différentes) auprès des commerçants grossistes de Bamako(capitale du Mali). La vente de ses articles se fait au grand marché de Bougouni ainsi que dans le quartier où elle habite.
Les périodes propices de ses ventes sont surtout les différentes fêtes( noël, ramadan, tabaski., saint sylvestre..) et les évenements sociaux (mariages, baptèmes...). Sa clientelle est composée surtout de femmes et les ventes sont généralement effectuées au comptant et à détail.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFA qu’elle espère utiliser pour améliorer les perfomances de son entreprise, payer les intérêts du prêt, et subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramata Traoré is a 36-year-old married woman and mother of four who lives with her husband, his two other wives and their children in the North Hérémakono area in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region in the republic of Mali). For social reasons, she quit school to devote herself to earning a living with her mother. After long periods of training, she decided to specialize in buying and selling party supplies. With 15 years of experience, Ramata Traoré has mastered this business and is very sought after by young girls and women in the area. In order to build up her business, she joined a women’s group in her neighborhood. After two group loans, both of which have been properly repaid, she is seeking her first individual loan. She plans to use this loan to buy 15 dozens of hair extensions (of different sorts and qualities) from wholesalers in Bamako (capital of Mali). She sells these items at the big market in Bougouni as well as in the neighborhood where she lives. The fruitful periods of her sales are around the holidays (Christmas, Ramadan, Tabaski, St. Sylvester…) and social events (weddings, baptisms…). Her clientele is generally composed of women and the sales are usually carried out in cash and at retail. With this loan, she counts on earning 30,000 CFA francs a month, which she hopes to use to improve the bottom line of her business, repay her loan, and provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions

loans.name: Sandu

texts.en: Sandu M., 23 years old. He lives in Bogdanovca village, which is at a distance of 5 km from Cimislia. He lives with his wife and daughter. Because the village has no work he has decided to start their own business. He is a beginner in this business and does not have much experience yet. He leased a booth from the town, Cimislia, costing 200 lei a month. 5000 leis are his own contribution and he needs a loan of 10000 lei to really get started. He brings cargo once a week from Odessa. He hopes to increase the assortment of goods for sale.

loans.use: Purchasing inventory to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy K. sells bread which she bakes herself. She also sells sachets of treated water, which is popularly known as "pure water", at the Elmina lorry park. She has been selling these items since 2002. Mercy has received an education through junior high school.  She is married to a farmer and has 2 children. She is responsible for paying utility bills and the children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy flour and other ingredients for baking the bread and increasing the sale of the "pure water". She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for a house she wants to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy flour and other ingredients for baking bread.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella A. is a single parent and has 4 dependents. She has received no formal education. Stella prepares porridge, which is known as Koko, and a special kind of doughnut which is also known as Koose. She uses corn and millet for the preparation of the Koko and she uses beans and flour to prepare the Koose. She normally sells in the morning as breakfast to her customers at Ataabadze near Elmina, which she has done since 1990. Stella uses her income to pay for utility bills and the children's school fees. Stella will use the loan to increase production and sales by buying more corn, millet, beans and other ingredients which are needed for the food production. With the new profits from her expanded business, Stella plans to invest in her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: To purchase more corn, millet, beans and other ingredients which are needed for the food production.

loans.name: Maria Orfilia

texts.es:
María Orfilia U. es una humilde dama que habita en el municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León dedicándose a su negocio de elaboración y venta de pan teniendo su propia panadería que por ser muy pequeña son sus sueños convertirla en un gran negocio para mejorar su nivel de vida.

El negocio de la señora Orfilia funciona de manera que ella elabora el pan horneándolo y luego vendiéndolo en su propia casa de habitación donde es visitada por sus clientes, luego cuando logra obtener el dinero recibido de  la venta del pan, compra la materia prima para continuar con este ciclo y de esta forma mantener su humilde hogar de habitación. 

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para continuar con este negocio que tanto requiere del apoyo de ella para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
María Orfilia U. is a humble woman who lives in the Nagarote municipality of León city where she makes and sell bread. She has her own small bakery and has dreams of converting it into a great business to improve her standard of living. The way Orfilia’s business works is that she makes and bakes the bread and then sells it from her own home where she is visited by customers. Then when she receives money from selling her bread she buys raw ingredients to continue this cycle and in this way support her humble home where she lives. The reason she has approached Ceprodel is to be the recipient of a loan that will enable her to buy the ingredients to continue with this business that so requires her support in order to continue its development.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary Akins is married to a farmer and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Mary sells groceries like biscuits, canned products and others at Elmina, which she has been doing for a few years now. Mary uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Mary will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to increase her capital base.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes M. is married to a blacksmith and has 5 dependents. She has received schooling through junior high school. Since 1994, Agnes has been selling a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey' which is made out of corn. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country and it is normally eaten with hot sauce and fried fish at Ataabadze near Elmina. Agnes uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Agnes will use the loan to increase her purchase of maize, fresh fish and other ingredients which she uses to prepare the Kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To increase her purchase of maize, fresh fish and other ingredients which are used to prepare the Kenkey.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is a single parent and has 4 children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Esi sells plastic products at Ataabadze near Elmina, which she has done since 2005. Esi uses her income to pay for her children's school fees and utility bills. Esi will use the loan to purchase more plastic bowls and cups for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save towards a house she wants to build for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic bowls and cups for sale.

loans.name: Fortaleza Divina Group

texts.es:
hola nosotros somos el Grupo Fortaleza Divina, somos personas luchadoras, responsables y con muchos deseos de superarnos y salir adelante, todos vivimos cerca y tenemos mucha experiencia en nuestras actividades diaras.
nuestro grupo se forma de esta manera:
Henry S.: soy el cordinador del grupo y me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de cuadros de pintura, tengo muchos clientes, mi obras la mayoria son por encargo pero tambien salgo a vender en las afueras de los hoteles mas prestigiosos de nuestra ciudad capital.
Doña Fermina elabora y vende baleadas ella tiene una pequeña galera en la esquina de su casa, ella tiene muchos clientes ya que su negocio esta muy cerca de una escuela.
el Señor Jorge L. se dedica a la reparacion de articulos electricos como ser estufas, televisores, refrigeradoras y otros, cuenta con un pequeño taller y de esta manera sale adelante con su familia.
todos en estos momentos necesitamos de un credito para sacar adelante nuestros negocios por tal razon estamos solicitando del mismo.
texts.en:
Hello. We are the “Fortaleza Divina” (Divine Strength) Group. We are hard-working, responsible people with great desire to improve ourselves and be successful. We leave near each other and we have a lot of experience in our daily professions. Our group is made up of following people: Henry S.: I am the coordinator of the group and I make and sell paintings. I have many customers. My works are primarily commissioned but I also sell outside of the most pretigious hotels of our capital city. Fermina makes and sells “baleadas” (a typical Honduran dish similar to a burrito). She has a small stand on the corner near her home. She has many customers as her business is very close to a school. Mr. Jorge L. repairs electronic items like stoves, televisions, refrigerators among others. He has a small shop and in this way supports his family. Today we all need a loan to help grow our businesses so therefore we are asking for one at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for each of our businesses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Juan M. me dedico a la Sastreria, tengo un taller desde hace 11 años, poco a poco hemos contruido mi casa con nuestra madre, ahora necesitamos remodelar un cuarto y un baño para tener mejor acondicionada a nuestra mama, ella es una señora mayor de 60 años, en mi negocio me va bien y mis clientes me prefieren por la atencion que les brindo y por supuesto la ropa que les hago que les gusta mucho porque les queda muy bien tallada. el credito que solicito lo ocupo para reacondicionar nustra casa. gracias
texts.en:
Hello. My name is JuanM. and I am a tailor. I have had a shop for 11 years. Little by little we have built our home with our mother. Now we need to remodel a room and bathroom in order to better accommodate our mother, as she is a 60 year old older woman. My business is going very well and my customers prefer my services for the attention I provide and of course they like the clothing that I make them a lot because it fits them very well. The loan I am seeking will be used to remodel our home. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to remodel a room and bathroom

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
hola nosotros somos el grupo Alfa y Omega residimos en el Barrio los Arcos de la ciudad de Danli, todos somos unas personas muy luchadoras y con ganas de salir adelante con nuestras familias.
nuestro grupo se forma de la siguiente manera:
Norma suyapa G.: soy la coordinadora del grupo mi actividad principal es la elaboracion de chicharras esta actividad la realizo diariamente tambien me dedico a la confeccion de ropa esta actividad la hago los fines de semana cuando tengo tiempo asi no descuido a mi familia.
Antonia del Carmen V.: ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, ella vende su producto en su casa de habitacion, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales todos estan grandes, ahora su esposo y ella estan como al principio de un matrimonio ya que estan solitos y desean salir adelante los dos.
Luis L.: el trabaja para un beneficio de cafe, es casado y tiene un hijo, los fines de semana se dedica a la construccion y el solo esta remodelando su casa para esto utilizara el credito.
todos nosotros tenemos muchas ganas de salir adelante y sabemos que asi sera. gracias
texts.en:
Hello. We are the Alpha & Omega group. We live in the Arcos neighborhood of the city of Danli. All of us are striving to get ahead so that we can better support our families. Our group includes:

Norma Suyapa G.: I am the coordinator of the group. I operate a business making "chicharras" (a local pork-based food), something I do during the week. I also earn extra income by making clothes on the weekends when I have time that doesn't interfere with caring for my family.

Antonia del Carmen V.: She makes and sells tortillas, selling them from her house. She's married and has 4 children, all grown. She and her husband are on their own now, like they were when they first married, hoping to get ahead the two of them. Luis L.: He works for a coffee processor. He's married and has one child. He works construction on weekends and he's remodeling his house himself. He'll use the loan for the remodeling project.

We all very much want to get ahead and we know that we will. Thanks.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Cristales Preciosos Group

texts.es:
hola nosotros somos el grupo Cristales Preciosos vivimos en Ojo de Agua, Yuscaran, departamento de EL Paraiso, todos somos muy unidos y tenemos mucho tiempo de conocernos, nuestro grupo se forma de la siguiente manera:
Mercedes H.: soy la cordinadora del grupo tengo mas de 4 años de dedicarme a la venta de cafe por tazas y a la venta de tortillas de maiz, mis clientes son las personas viajeras en especial los volqueteros que halan arena del rio, soy casada y tengo 3 hijos, gracias a este negocio le ayudo a mi esposo para los gastos del hogar.
Leonarda C.: ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitacion y tambien lo reparte en diferentes negocios cercanos de su hogar, actualmente ella elabora golosinas y vende refrescos esto es para generar mas ganancias y asi poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Alba R.: ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas de maiz y tambien a la venta de granos basicos, ella es madre de 5 hijos, debido a los gastos de su hogar ella se vio en la necesidad de poner su propio negocio para poder ayudarle a su esposo.
Sagrario R.: ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas de maiz, ella vive con su esposo y tien un hijo, su esposo es maestro de construccion.
Berta R.: ella se dedica a la venta de articulos plasticos, antes vendia este mismo producto pero con comisiones ahora ella ya tiene su propio negocio y desea invertirle dinero para salir adelante.
todas necesitamos de este credito para salir adelante con nuestras familias.
texts.en:
Hi. We are the Cristales Preciosos ["Pretty Crystals"] group. We live in Ojo de Agua in the Honduran "departamento" of El Paraiso. We are all very close and we've known each other for many years. Our group includes:

Mercedes H.: I am the group's coordinator. I have operated a business for more than 4 years, selling coffee by the cup and corn tortillas. My customers are generally people passing through town, largely drivers of the dump trucks who haul sand from the river. I'm married and have 3 children. Thanks to this business, I'm able to help my husband with everyday expenses.

Leonarda C.: She earns a living making and selling bread, making the bread at home and delivering it to businesses in the area for sale to their customers. She's now making sweets and selling cold drinks to generate extra income so that she can help her husband with household expenses.

Alba R.: She sells corn tortillas along with basic grain products. She is the mother of 5 children. Because running a household is expensive, she decided to set up her own business to help her husband pay the bills.

Sagrario R.: She sells corn tortillas. She lives with her husand and has one son. Her husband is a construction foreman.

Berta R.: She sells plastic items. She used to sell the same products on commission but now she has her own business and wants to invest cash in improving it.

We all need this loan to help our families get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Rosas Blancas Group

texts.es: El grupo de las "Rosas Blancas" esta representado por la señora Josefina, se encuentra conformado por 9 mujeres y 2 varones que se reúnen constantemente para organizarse y para verificar como  se invierten los fondos otorgados. Son gente responsable y honesta, ellas se dedican al comercio de diferentes productos como ser ropa, cosméticos, peluches, celulares y a la venta de comida criolla y entre los varones a la fundición de metales. En vista de que la competencia para el sector comercio es muy grande ellas necesitan  incrementar su capital de trabajo para en cierta manera disminuir el precio y poder vender mas cantidad o en menor tiempo y así tendrán mayor flujo de dinero para responder a la demanda del mercado y a la mejora de la calidad de vida de sus familias. La mayoría de los socios (as) tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que conoces el modo de trabajo y también la responsabilidad que se necesita para corresponder con la ayuda que le brindada la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The group "Rosas Blancas" is lead by Josefina C. A.. It is made up of 9 women and 2 men who meet regularly to organize grant money and determine how they ought to invest it. They are honest and responsible people. The women trade in various products, such as clothing, cosmetics, stuffed animals, and cellphones. They also sell traditional Latin American food. The men work in the smelting and casting of metals. Since there is significant competition for business in the commercial sector, the women need to increase the money they have to work with, so that they may stably lower their prices and enable themselves to sell a greater quantity of goods in less time. By doing this, they will create a greater flow of incoming money, which will allow them to better respond to market demands and to improve quality of life for themselves and their families. Most of the group members have previous experience with group loans, so they are familiar with group work and know how to take advantage of the opportunity they are being offered by Fundacion AgroCapital.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Business Enhancement

loans.name: Los Ceibos Group

texts.es: El grupo " Los Ceibos"  esta representado por le señora Carmen, todos los socios se dedican al rubro comercial ambulante como a la venta D. dulces, ropa, comida, sastrería servicio D. mensajera y al transporte público, son gente D. escasos recursos pero honrada y con ganas D. trabajar para salir adelante es por eso que la Fundación Agrocapital les brinda una oportunidad D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. los suyos y a mejorar sus pequeños negocios que representan el sustento D. sus familias. El financiamiento esta destinado a la compra D. insumos y materiales a la venta así como a la mejora D. sus puestos D. trabajo. Los socios (as) tienen experiencia con grupos solidarios la cual adquirieron en la fundación Agrocapital en financiamientos anteriores en los cuales demostraron puntualidad y responsabilidad. Dentro del grupo existe un parentesco entre el seeñor Omar Willy y Eddy Fidel pero ambos tiene ingresos totalemnete independientes por lo que no existe ningún problema dentro del grupo.
texts.en:
The group "Los Ceibos" is lead by Carmen. All of the members are street vendors, selling such items as sweets, clothing, and food, and providing seamstress, messenger, and public transportation services. They are people of few resources but much honor, and they desire greatly to work their way toward further success. It is for this spirit that the Agrocapital Foundation offered the group an opportunity to improve their quality of life by improving the small businesses which they rely on to proviD. for themselves and their families. The funding they receive is designated for the purchase of raw materials and supplies, the sale of which would help them to improve their workplace. The members have experience working with financial assistance from the Agrocapital Foundation, and they have demonstrated both punctuality and responsibility in their relationship with the foundation. Within the group there is a relationship between Omar Willy and Eddy Fidel, but both members have totally independent sources of income, so this situation causes absolutely no problem within the group.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Funding for Operations

loans.name: Jardin Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "JARDÍN " ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA MARTHA QUIEN SE DEDICA AL LA VENTA Y PRODUCCIÓN D. LECHE AL IGUAL QUE EL RESTO D. SUS COMPAÑEROS D. GRUPO, ELLOS ENTREGAN SU PRODUCCIÓN A LA PLANTA PROCESADORA D. LECHE (PIL), PERO LOS SOCIOS (AS) TAMBIÉN ELABORAN ALGUNOS D. LOS DERIVADOS D. LA LECHE PARA LA VENTA DIRECTAMENTE AL CONSUMIDOR COMO EL YOGUR CASERO, QUESILLO Y OTROS. PESE A EXISTIR COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO LÁCTEOS LAS SEÑORAS  LOGRAN VENDER SUS PRODUCTOS NATURALES DIRECTAMENTE EN EL MERCADO. EL DESTINO D. ESTE CRÉDITO ES PARA LA ADQUISICIÓN D. MAS VACAS LECHERAS PARA AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCIÓN Y MEJORAR SUS INGRESOS. LOS SOCIOS (AS9 YA TIENE EXPERIENCIA TRABAJANDO CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE SABEN D. LA RESPONSABILIDAD Y LA PUNTUALIDAD QUE EXIGE UN FINANCIAMIENTO POR LO QUE SE COMPROMETEN A ADMINISTRAR BIEN SUS RECURSOS Y A CUMPLIR SUS OBLIGACIONES CON LA FUNDACIÓN.
texts.en:
The group "Jardin" is lead by Martha. She produces and sells milk, just like the rest of her partners in the group. The members hand over their raw milk to the processing plant (PIL), but they also manufacture some milk-derived products themselves, including yogurt, small cheeses, and similar foods, and sell these items directly to their customers. In spite of the competition they face from other companies in the dairy market, the ladies of the group succeeded in selling their natural products directly to customers in the market. They will use this loan to acquire more dairy cows to increase their production and improve their income. The members have previous experience working with group loans, and understand the responsibility and punctuality demanded of them by their financier. They promise to manage their resources properly and to fulfill their obligations to the foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Funding for Business Operations

loans.name: Coronel Sanches Group

texts.es: El grupo " Coronel Sanchez" esta conformado por personas pertenecientes a la provincia de Sacaba ellos estan representados por la señora Mirian. Los Socios (as) tienen rubros diversificados, donde se manifestan por lo general negocios de comercio al por menor como a la venta de tarjetas de celulares, comida, abarrotes, ropa, atencion en internet y al transporte público puestos en los cuales esperan surgir y aprovechar las fechas navideñas en la cual existe mayor demanda de productos. El financiemiento esta destinado a la compra de materiales e insumos a la venta y a la mejora de sus herramientas de trabajo para atender las demandas del mercado. Los socios (as) demostraron tener experiencia en grupos solidarios viendo sus antecedentes crediticios en Instituciones similares a la Fundacion Agrocapital demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos y sabiendo administrar bien los fondos otorgados para mejora sus ingresos y llegar a sus objetivos de mejorar su calida de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Colonel Sanchez group, represented by Mirian, is made up of people in Sacaba province. The members, both men and women, have various occupations, generally including retail sale of items such as mobile phone cards, food, groceries, clothing, Internet service and public transportation—occupations in which they expect to get ahead, taking advantage of the Christmas season when demand peaks. To meet market demand, this funding is intended for the purchase of materials and supplies for sale and to upgrade work tools. Members have past experience with solidarity group loans, having established their credit worthiness with institutions similar to Fundacion Agrocapital, where they made payments on time and managed the funds allocated towards increasing their income and achieving their goals of improving quality of live for them and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Don Bosco Group

texts.es: El grupo "Don Bosco" esta representado por el señor Cristóbal, los socios (as) se dedican a diversas actividades económicas, como a la atención tiendas de barrio, venta de celulares, Transporte publico, pintura y al la venta de comida al paso. Son personas Responsables como lo han demostrado en anteriores financiamientos otorgados por la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben que se necesita perseverancia y trabajo en equipo para poder salir adelante. la competencia en el M. es grande pero la experiencia y los años que tienen trabajando en el rubro los saca adelante siempre. El destino del Crédito otorgado por la Fundación es para el mejoramiento de sus herramientas de trabajo y de sus puestos de venta así como la compra de materiales para estocar su mercadería en especial en la época navideña donde existe la mayor cantidad de demanda en el M..
texts.en:
The "Don Bosco" group is represented by Mr. Cristóbal. The partners carry out different economic activities such as servicing local stores, selling cell phones, public transportation, painting, and selling food as street vendors. They are responsible individuals, as proven by previous loans from Fundación Agrocapital, they have experience in solidarity groups and they know that perseverance and team work are necessary to be able to get ahead as competition on the market is strong, but the experience and the years working together always help them to move forward. The loan from the Fundación will be spent on improving the work tools and the sales stands as well as purchasing materials to increase ther merchandise for the Cristmas season as demands on the market grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is married and has 4 children. She sells jeans at the central market in Vinogradovo City. Her kiosk is located at the center of the city market. Her gross income is 10,000 UAH per month, and her profit is about 4,000 UAH.

Nadiya has been in this business for 6 years. She decided to start her business because she needed to provide for her growing family. Jeans are has always in demand, so Nadiya decided to sell this kind of goods. She is a hard-working person and desires to develop her business even more.

Nadiya would like to receive a loan of 1,000 UAH for 1 month to purchase winter jeans wear. She hopes that the loan would help her to increase her profit.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of jeans for sale

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married and has one son. She owns a kiosk at the central market in Vinogradovo city and sells lights. Her kiosk is located at the very center of market which makes her business more successful. Her gross income is 10,000 UAH per month; profit is about 3,500 UAH.

Anna has been in this business for 5 years. She knows this business well and believes that the key to success is treating customers well and having a large variety of lights. Anna's business goal is to increase her sales and open a second kiosk.

Anna would like to receive a loan of 1,500 UAH for 1 month to purchase more inventory. She has repaid all her previous loans well and says that the loans have helped her a lot.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Cristo Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
hola nuestro grupo se llama Cristo es mi fortaleza, nuestro grupo esta formado por tres personas las cuales nos conocemos muy bien y que somos nativos de la Colonia Juan Pablo David. nuestro grupo se integra de esta forma:
Maria A.: soy la cordinadora del grupo tengo 44 años de edad y estoy casada con el sr. Francisco Flores con el cual hemos procreado 3 hijos, mi esposo trabaja como ayudante de Bus, yo me dedico a la venta y produccion de tortillas, esta actividad me genera ingresos para poder aliemntar a mis hijos.
el Sr. P. se reconoce en la comunidad como una persona luchadora que ha salido adelante con su esposa Oneyda Ramirez, la que se dedica a la sastreria y tambien han procreado 3 hijos, el Sr. P. se dedica a la Agricultura y el comercio.
La Sra C. G. es una persona que trabaja arduamente con su esposo Daniel para poder sacar adelante su famia ellos han procreado 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas.
todas necesitamos este credito para poder hacer nuestros negocios mas grandes y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Members of the group “Cristo es mi fortaleza” are well-known to one another and are natives of Colonia Juan Pablo David. Their group consists of the following three people: Maria A. is 44 years old and the group coordinator. She is married to Francisco Flores and they have three children. Her husband works as a bus attendant, while she makes and sells tortillas. This business generates income to feed her children. Maximo P. is recognized throughout the community as a fighter who, along with his wife Oneyda Ramirez, has prospered. His wife is a seamstress and they also have three children. Maximo engages in both agriculture and trade. Urania C. G. and her husband Daniel work hard in order that their family might get ahead. They have two children. Urania sells tortillas. They are all in need of this loan in order that they might expand their businesses and increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, firewood, lime; tailoring supplies; and general grocery store merchandize

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: El señor Jorge Alberto Guzmán tiene la edad de 42 años, habita en la ciudad de Masaya en el municipio de Monimbo, junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como técnica en el laboratorio clínico para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia un futuro de don Jorge es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia . Este señor se dedica desde hace veinte años a presta servicio de zapatería  lo cual con sus propios esfuerzos ha logrado comprar sus herramientas para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes como un buen trabajo. La mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento, lo cual necesita el apoyo de nuestra financiara para poder hacer efectiva la compra de mas materia prima  para poder dar un mejor servicio y así poder cobrar un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Alberto G. is 42 years old and lives with his wife in the city of Masaya, in the municipality of Monimbo. In order to cover household expenses, his wife works as technician in a clinical laboratory. They are hoping that in the future, Jorge will be better able to improve his family’s standard of living. He has been a shoemaker for twenty years, and his hard work has allowed him to buy the tools he needs to provide a good service to his customers. The biggest difficulty Jorge faces is a lack of funding, which is why he needs the support of a loan. This will allow him to purchase more raw materials, offer a higher quality of service, and charge a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing raw materials to improve his shoemaking business

loans.name: Milagro De Dios Group

texts.es:
hola nosotros somos el grupo Milagro de Dios, todos nos conocemos muy bien y nos llevamos como si fueramos hermanos, en la foto la señora de edad es mi madre la cual nos guia mucho en nuestras actividades, digamos que ella es como la Jefe de nosotros, nuestro grupo tiene estas actividades:
Maria C.: soy la cordinadora del grupo tengo 40 años de edad, tengo un taller de bicicletas, en este lugar no hay muchos talleres de bicicletas por lo tanto a mi me va bien con mi negocio pero necesito comprar herramientas y mas repuestos para poder dar una mejor atencio a mis clientes.
Melvin Almendares: tiene 23 años de edad, esta casado con oneyda Alvarado con la cual han procreado una hija, el vende zapatos y ropa, el tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, tiene muchos clientes ya que el anda vendiendo su mercaderia en varias zonas cercanas a nuestra comunidad.
Jose F. esta casado con Marina Posadas la cual se dedica a la venta de baleadas, el tiene una pulperia en la cual ha prosperado poco a poco pero necesita inyectarle capital para poder sacar adelante su negocio.
todos necesitamos este credito para mejorar en nuestras fuentes de ingresos y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Our group is called “Milagro de Dios,” and we know each other very well and treat one another like family. The older lady in the photograph is my mother, who guides us in our business endeavors. It could be said that she is our boss. Our group is involved in the following undertakings: María C.: I am 40 years old and the group coordinator. I have a bicycle shop. This place has few bicycle shops and therefore my business does well, but I need to buy tools and more parts in order to better meet my customers needs. Melvin Almendares is 23 years old. He is married to Oneyda Alvarado and they have one daughter. Melvin sells shoes and clothing, and has been in the business for several years. He has many customers because he travels and sells his merchandize in various locales near our community. José F. is married to Marina Posadas, who sells baleadas, a Honduran tortilla filled with mashed, fried beans and possibly other ingredients. José has a small grocery store where he has slowly prospered, but he needs to inject capital into it in order to ensure the success of his business. We all need this loan to increase our sources of revenue as well as be able to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bicycle parts, clothing and shoes, and ingredients to make flour tortillas and baleadas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eugenia Celina

texts.es:
La señora de nombre Eugenia Celina T. López tiene la edad de 65 años su estado civil es soltera, Doña Eugenia tiene 7 hijos de los cuales no tiene hijos a su cargo, en sus deseos esta salir adelante con su negocio para mantenerlo activo ya que este negocio le proporciona la ayuda necesaria para sacar adelante a sus hijos y darle lo que ellos necesitaban, en sus propósitos esta el proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que no tiene un lugar adecuado en donde cocinar y el lugar que utiliza para cocinar es un fogón   por lo que quiere trabajar fuerte para lograr sus propósitos ya que los materiales de construcción tienen un elevado precio es por eso que esta ahorrando lo suficiente para llevar a cabo sus propósitos.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de tortilla, la ubicación de su negocio es la siguiente barrio de subtiava, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 20 años, ella inicia este negocio por con 1 quintal de maíz por lo que en el tiempo en 
el que Doña Eugenia inicio las tortillas tenían un precio de 25 centavos y al paso del tiempo es que decide aumentar el precio ya que debido a lo difícil que se torno la situación pero aun así logra conseguir afluencia de clientes y es así como esta con su negocio actualmente, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de leña, maíz entre otros ya que esta agradecida trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas por lo que se interesan que los clientes salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eugenia Celina T. López is 65 years old, single, and has seven children (whom are not dependent upon her). One of her dreams is to keep her business going, since it helps to provide opportunity for her children and fulfill their needs. She plans to improve her home since she does not have adequate space for cooking - the space she uses is actually a wood-burning oven. She is working hard and saving money up to fulfill her plans since construction materials are expensive. She's had her tortilla-selling business, located in the Subtiava Barrio, for 20 years, which she started with one bag of corn and a price of 25 cents for tortillas. She raised the price as times became difficult but she was still able to grow her client base and that's how her business grew to its current size. This loan is for capital which she needs to buy firewood and corn, among other things. She is grateful to work with the Fundación León 2000 and the partner organizations as they are very supportive in helping their clients succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Sobeyda Jazmina

texts.es:
La joven de nombre Sobeyda Jazmina E. tiene la edad de 42 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera esta Joven tiene 3 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguiente su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 25 años y trabaja en  restaurante, su hijo de 20 años trabaja en una camaronera  y 2 su hija de 17 años de edad que cursa el 2 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son ampliar su negocio para ayudarle a su hija ya por lo que necesita darle a su hija un porvenir en los estudios ya que le falta un largo camino que recorrer en el ámbito de los estudios, en sus deseos esta proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un lugar cómodo donde vivir.


Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 15 años, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, ella inicia este negocio con pocos productos como lo es pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios y rubor por lo que no tenia mucha afluencia de clientes decide incrementar mas su producto y es así como obtiene su negocio y se gana  a los diferentes clientes que tiene actualmente, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de sus productos en los diferentes lugares como lo es en  Managua y las diferentes casas comerciales.
texts.en:
Sobeyda Jazmina E. is a young 42-year-old single mother of three: her son, aged 25, the oldest, who works in a restaurant, her second son, aged 20, who works on a shrimp farm, and her daughter, aged 17, who is in her second year of high school. Her goal is to grow her business in order to help her daughter with her future school needs as she has a long road ahead. Her dream is to improve her home so her children will have a comfortable place to live. She has a business selling cosmetics, which she has had for 15 years. She started this traveling sales business with a few products like nail polish, lipstick, and blush, but had few clients, so she expanded her product selection, which is how she built her current business and grew her client base. This loan is for capital which she needs in order to buy products in Managua and at the various commercial houses.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sergio Rene

texts.es: El señor Sergio Rene Castro tiene la edad de 40 años, habita en el reparto Juan Ramón padilla, ubicado en municipio de ticuantepe, junto a su esposa , la cual le apoya con las cosas del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo una niña de siete años , la cual estudia su primaria , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia , don Sergio trabaja en Ineter desempeñándose como Idromensor desde hace diez años , el solicita el apoyo de nuestra institución para la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, para terminar de construir su casa, y así tener un poco de comodidad ya que es pequeña.
texts.en:
Mr. Sergio Rene Castro is 40 years old and lives with his wife in Juan Ramon Padilla, an area in the Ticuantepe municipality. Sergio's wife is a homemaker; they care for a seven year old girl who attends primary school. Sergio wants to improve living conditions for his family, so for the last decade, he has been working at INETER (The Nicaraguan Institute of Earth Studies) as a hydrology technician. He's seeking your support so that he can purchase construction materials like stone, sand, cement and iron. These will allow him to finish building his home and make it a little more comfortable, because it is a bit small.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to finish building his house

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Juan Alberto P. D. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es acompañado, Don Juan tiene 4 hijos sus edades son las siguientes una varón de 2 años que no estudia, una niña de 3 años que cursa recientemente primer nivel de preescolar, un varón de 5 años que cursa recientemente tercer grado de primaria y su ultimo hijo que tiene la edad de 12 años y cursa recientemente el quinto grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora como cajera de la empresa UNION FENOSA, sus propósitos son de mantener a su familia y darle el beneficio de darle un lugar donde vivir ya que con su negocio es que puede salir adelante, sus sueños son edificar su casa y darle las condiciones necesarias sus deseos son establecer un taller de bicicleta donde ofrezcan el mejor servicio de pintado y la mejor variedad  de accesorio de bicicleta y en un futuro desea ampliar el taller y aumentar su inventario y crecer con su taller.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de taller de bicicleta, la ubicación de su negocio es en el pueblo de malpaisillo, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de es de 10 años, Don Juan inicia este negocio después que termina sus estudios de técnico medio en administración decide buscar una fuente de ingresos  que le ayudara a mantener a su familia y decide instalar un negocio de taller de bicicletas y es así como obtiene este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo es para invertir mas en su negocio y para comprar los repuestos de bicicletas necesarios para que sus clientes obtengan lo que buscan en sus taller.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Alberto P. D. is 36 years old and lives with his partner. He has 4 children: a boy aged 2, a girl aged 3, in pre-school, another boy aged 5, in the first grade, and, the oldest boy, aged 12, in the fifth grade. His partner works as a cashier at the UNION FENOSA. His goals are to support his family, provide them with a home, improve his house, and establish his bicycle shop as offering the best paint jobs and the greatest variety of bicycle accessories. In the future he'd like to expand the shop to augment the inventory and thus grow the business. His business is selling bicycles - his shop is located in the town of Malpaisillo. He's had the shop for 10 years. Juan started this business after graduating with an administration certificate. He was looking for an income to provide for his family and decided to start this bicycle shop. This loan is for capital to invest in an array of parts so that his clients can find whatever they need in his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Virna Urania

texts.es:
La Joven Virna Urania V. tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es soltera esta Joven tiene 3 hijas de las cuales sus edades son las siguientes la mayor tiene 20 años de edad y cursa un técnico medio su otra hija de 18 años de edad cursa el 2 año de de su carrera y su otra hija de 17 años de edad cursa el 1 año de su carrera, sus propósitos son comprar al por mayor para comprar mas barato y obtener mejores precios, sus deseos son crecer con su negocio para lograr a cumplirles a sus hijas y darle mejor preparación a través de los estudios ya que desea prepararlas para un futuro ya que cada día que pasa la situación es mas difícil.


La actividad económica es la venta de pan como: cosas de horno y  otros derivados del maíz, la ubicación de su negocio es en el pueblo de malpaisillo, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es de 17 años, sus inicios en el negocio se dan por la necesidad de mantener a su familia que crecía y tenia que buscar el medio para poder subsistir y lo hizo por medio de este negocio para que de esta forma puedan salir adelante y fue entonces que decide obtener el negocio y vender sus productos de forma ambulante, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de maíz, azúcar ya que esta la materia prima necesaria para producir sus productos ya que este tipo de producto sube de precio y así podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virna Urania V. is a young 40-year-old single mother of three daughters: the eldest, aged 20, studying her last year in high school, the second, aged 18, in her junior year, and the youngest, aged 17, in her first year. Virna's goals are to buy wholesale to get better prices, in order to build her business and help her daughters achieve in school so they can be prepared for a better future as times are getting harder every day. She runs a bakery business in Malpaisillo, baking and deliverying items such as corn-derived baked goods. She's had her business for 17 years, which she began as a way to provide for her growing family and help them succeed. This loan is for capital to buy corn and sugar (for which prices have been rising), the primary ingredients needed for her products, so she can fill her client orders.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia T. is 32 years old, and married with four children.  Nelia has 97 ducks. Thirty-seven (37) of which are egg layers, which she raises to generate income for the family. She works hard to make her poultry business flourish. Her husband is a farmer who also helps her raise the ducks. Together, they dream of giving all of their children a good future. By sending all of them to school, they believe their children will fulfill their dreams in life.

Nelia needs a loan of $125 to purchase additional ducklings for sale. She also plans to open a store where she can sell eggs directly to customers. In this way, she can increase her profits and address the family's needs. 

CEVI helps Nelia sustain her poultry business through the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that they offer to entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase ducklings to raise and sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta D. is 52 years old and married with ten children. She tills a small parcel of land, which she inherited from her father. Her life is in farming and she loves growing crops, especially rice. Vicenta believes that rice is an important commodity, and will always be a good business opportunity. Her husband, who is also a farmer, is her partner in sending all their children to school and in meeting the family needs.

Vicenta needs a loan of $125 to purchase sacks of certified seed and fertilizers. She also plans to open a store where she can sell her farm produce, and increase her profits to support her family.

CEVI always seeks what is best for its clients. Through credit assistance, training, and the insurance coverage they offer to entrepreneurs like Vicenta, CEVI benefits the lives of the people in the community.

loans.use: To purchase certified seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es: Bacilio es un hombre de 50 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos menores. El es muy activo en su trabajo y en los negocios que realiza, siendo uno de ellos la venta de cerveza, a la cual está dedicado hace 3 años. Su iniciativa de incursionar en este ámbito se debe a la gran demanda que hay de estas bebidas, sobretodo en los meses y de fiesta, donde las pequeñas tiendas requieren del producto para estar a la altura de la demanda por festividades. Bacilio está iniciando su crédito, y es una persona muy respetuosa y responsable dentro de su comunidad. Ahora él requiere de mayor cantidad de bebidas, ya que se acerca la navidad y la demanda tiende a subir y por ello invertirá la cantidad que solicita.
texts.en:
Bacilio is a fifty-year old man, who lives with his wife and three small children. He is very active in his job and in the businesses he has started. One of these businesses is selling beer and he has dedicated three years to it. What initiated his entrance into this business was the great demand for these drinks, especially during the months of festivities. During this time, small stores require the product to meet the high demands for the festivities. Bacilio is beginning his loan and he is a very respectable and responsible person within his community. At this time of the year, he requires the most drinks, since is already almost Christmas and the demand for drinks tends to rise during this time. The amount he is requesting will go towards investing in the drinks for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of products he sells

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es: Dorotea tiene 48 años, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos menores de edad. Ella es una agricultora muy alegre que inició su actividad desde los 23 años y desde entonces nunca dejó de producir, en este caso, calabazas, que vende en los mercados, ya que personalmente se dedica a venderlos y no dar a intermediarios, ya que le resulta más rentable vender por unidad que por cantidades mayores. Aunque siempre hay algo de dificultad en la venta, no deja de hacerlo con mucho entusiasmo. Dorotea inicia su crédito y está muy comprometida con las demás personas de su banco comunal para crecer económicamente. Ella empezará a cultivar nuevos productos y requiere de 300 soles para la compra de abonos para sus terrenos  de producción.
texts.en:
Dorotea is 48 years old and lives with her spouse and her two young children. She is a farmer who is very happy to have started her business 23 years ago. Since she has started, she has never failed to produce, in this case, pumpkins, which she sells in the markets. She sells them herself, without giving them to intermediaries, since it is more profitable to sell them individually instead of in large numbers. Although there is always some difficulty in the sales, this doesn't stop her enthusiasm for her work. Dorotea is beginning her loan and is very committed to the people of the communal bank for allowing her to advance financially. She will begin to cultivate new products and require 300 soles in order to buy fertilizer for her land.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de abono para sus cultivos

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika es una joven de 24 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres. Desde pequeña aprendió el oficio de la familia, que es el cultivo de productos agrícolas, y gracias a su gran habilidad se ha independizado de sus padres y desde hace 2 años empezó a invertir en sus  propios cultivos, en los cuales le va muy bien, ya que el mercado es altamente demandante de estos productos durante todo el año, y Erika trata de aprovechar en todo tiempo de mejorar la calidad de su producción, para así poder incrementar el valor de venta y tener mayor competitividad entre los demás agricultores, pero para ello requiere de buenos abonos que es lo más costoso. Erika inicia su primer préstamo y está muy feliz de poder formar parte de un grupo que confía en su persona. Para mejorar su producción tendrá que invertir 1000 soles en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para sus terrenos, pero ella por ahora está pidiendo 300.
texts.en:
Erika is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She began to learn the family farming business at a young age, and thanks to her skills, Erika is now able to support herself. For the last two years, Erika has been investing in her own crops. Things are going well because there’s a year-round high demand for these particular crops. Erika always tries to take advantage of the demand by increasing the quality of her products, which can boost sales prices and allow her business to compete with other farms. In order to improve her crops, she needs need good fertilizer, which is very expensive. This is Erika’s first loan, and she’s very happy to be involved with a group that has so much confidence in her. In order to improve her products, Erika will need to invest 1,000 Soles in fertilizers for her land, but for now, she’s only asking for 300 Soles ($100 US).

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Iván tiene 20 años, vive junto a sus padres. Desde muy pequeño tuvo que dedicarse a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, ya que era el único medio de supervivencia para su familia, actividad que le empezó a gustar y a realizar de manera independiente desde que obtuvo su primer toro hace 4 años, desde entonces no ha dejado de trabajar con esmero e invertir en su  trabajo, su juventud y su dinero.
