Esta actividad no es sacrificada para Iván, arar sus tierras con su buey es fascinante, aunque lo dificultoso es regar sus terrenos y  cultivar los pastos que son necesarios para la alimentación de sus bueyes. Iván está iniciando su primer préstamo con MFP, con el fin de poder convertirse en un próspero ganadero y agricultor. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un toro que le ayude en el arado de sus terrenos y el valor aproximado es de 1200 soles, y él pondrá la diferencia.
texts.en:
Iván is 20 years old and lives with his parents. Since he was small, he had to dedicate himself to agriculture and the caring of animals, which is the only means of survival for his family. It is an activity that he began to like and independently take on when he obtained his first bull four years ago. Since then, he has not stopped working with care and investing his youth and his money in this job. This activity isn't a sacrifice for Iván. Plowing his lands with his ox is fascinating, though the difficult part is irrigating his lands and cultivating the pastures that are necessary for feeding his oxen. Iván is beginning his first loan with MFP, with the goal of being able to convert himself into a prosperous rancher and farmer. With the money he is requesting he will buy a bull that will help plow his lands. The value of the bull is approximately 1200 soles and he will cover the difference.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 45 años, es separada de su esposo y actualmente vive con su hijo. Inició siendo agricultora, pero con el paso de los años encontró en el comercio, una de sus mejores capacidades, y desde que lo descubrió supo aprovechar las oportunidades, hace 2 años empezó a vender dulces en el colegio de su localidad, negocio con el cual pudo mejorar sus ingresos económicos gracias al gran consumo  de los estudiantes y maestros del colegio. Julia desea ir mejorando la atención a sus clientes, aunque para ello tenga que viajar constantemente a la ciudad para traer nuevas golosinas para los colegiales. Con mucho entusiasmo está iniciando su primer crédito, está muy comprometida con los pagos que hay que realizar. Con la cantidad que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de dulces para su tienda.
texts.en:
Julia is 45 years old, separated from her husband and currently lives with her son. She began as a farmer, but in time she found herself in commerce, one of her best talents. Ever since she discovered her skill in commerce she knew how to take advantage of opportunities.

Two years ago she began to sell sweets at the school in her neighborhood, a business that betters her income thanks to the great consumption of the students and teachers of the school. Julia wishes to improve her service to her customers, although in order to do this she must constantly travel to the city to bring new candies to the schoolchildren.

With much enthusiasm she is asking for her first loan and is very committed to making the necessary payments. With the amount that she asks for she will buy a larger quantity of sweets for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of the merchandise that she sells

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 45 años, es madre soltera, vive con su último hijo de 26 años. Siempre tuvo la fortaleza de salir adelante por sus hijos y desde hace 20 años encontró en la agricultura la manera de hacerlo, y gracias a su gran capacidad en la  crianza y venta de animales pudo educar a sus hijos quienes ahora son profesionales. María tiene hasta hoy en la crianza de animales una forma de ganarse la vida, y aprovecha los meses de fiesta para vender a mejores precios y obtener grandes ganancias de sus animales, en quienes invierte grandes cantidades de dinero para su alimentación. María está iniciando su préstamo, con la mejor condición de pagar y asumir su compromiso con responsabilidad. Durante estas fechas de fiesta tiene pensado comprar algunos animales y revenderlos a precios altos en las ferias, con ese fin invertirá la cantidad que solicita.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and a single mother. She lives with her youngest son who is 26 years old. She always had the strength to go forward for her children and 20 years ago she found that agriculture was the manner in which to do it. Thanks to her great ability in the raising and sale of animals she could educate her children who are now professionals. As of today María has a way to earn a living through the raising of animals and she takes advantage of the holiday months in order to sell at the best prices and obtain large profits from her animals, in which she invests large quantities of money for their food.

María is beginning her loan in the best possible condition to pay and take on the commitment of responsibility. During the holiday time she plans to use her loan to buy some animals and resell them at higher prices at the fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 57 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 14 años. Desde muy niña le fascinaron los animales y a medida que estuvo creciendo logró convertir este gusto en una manera de ganarse la vida, criando y vendiendo. Es así que esta actividad la viene acompañando por 20 años, pero lo más importante es que no tuvo que alejase de sus seres queridos para poder trabajar, sino que tuvo el tiempo necesario para estar pendientes de su familia. Además, la venta de carne en los mercados es solvente y el consumo que hay en la zona y en diversas ciudades lo hace un negocio muy rentable. Yolanda es nueva en el tema de créditos, pero está comprometida en asumir  la responsabilidad de pago para con la institución. Utilizara en dinero solicitado en la compra de ganado y algunos animales menores  para venderlos en estas festividades.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 57 years old and lives with her husband and 14-year-old son. Since a very young age animals fascinated her and as she was growing up she succeeded in turning her fascination with animals into a way to earn a living by raising and selling them. She has been raising and selling animals for 20 years, but the most important thing is that she did not have to leave her loved ones in order to work and had the time necessary to be available to her family.

Additionally, the sale of meat in the markets is reliable and the consumption in the area and in different cities makes it a very profitable business. Yolanda is new to the microfinance system, but is committed to assuming the responsibility of paying according to the institution. She will use the money for the purchase of livestock and some smaller animals in order to sell them during these festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in her livestock

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
“I am the provider for all of my family's needs. I want to build a good future for them and let them live a happier life,” says Romulo S., a 46-year-old father from Trento, Agusan Del Sur. His wife is a dressmaker and has always been supportive of him in his decision to be the head of the family. 

With 12 years of experience as a craftsman, Romulo decided to start his own business. He shapes metals and manufactures tools used in gardening like bolos, shovels, etc. He needs a loan of $125 to purchase materials for molding metals.

CEVI gives Romulo the chance to grow his business. His participation in the CEVI credit program gives him access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage, which CEVI offers to all of their clients.

loans.use: Purchase materials such as charcoal, wood, and steel for making garden tools

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao R. is 30 years old and is a resident of Kandal Province. She runs a business selling Khmer Noodle in front of her home in the village of Svay. Most of her clients are neighbors who live near by. She always gets up early in the morning to make her noodles, which she will have completely sold by the afternoon. She is married with three children, all of whom are single. Her husband, 29, is a construction worker. To earn extra income to help with the family's expense R. also sells water. She is requesting a loan to purchase a cart for transporting her water barrel.

loans.use: To purchase a cart

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yat S. is 38 years old and the mother of five children, who are all attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice for a living. In addition to this activity, she also sells fruit at the local market. Since the business is going well, she wants to expand it. She is asking for a loan to buy more fruit to sell at the market. Her husband, Mr. Nhem Sarorn, is a government officer earns a small salary.

Mrs. Yat S. is a group leader. The four members live in Kaoh Reah Leu village in Kandal province.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell at the market.

loans.name: Savoen's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The group consists of five people who live in Sdoa Kanlaeng village in Kandal Province. The members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Savoen P. is the group leader. She is 47 years old and the mother of seven children. One of her children is employed at a company and three of them help with farming. The remaining three attend the local school. She owns a 1 hectare field, on which she cultivates rice for a living. She is facing a small problem because her pump cannot pump enough water for the crops and needs to be repaired. In order to deal with this problem, she is asking for a loan to fix her pump. Her husband, Mr. Nuk Yan, helps his wife with the farm.

loans.use: to fix her pump

loans.name: Mr. Ny Souern Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for eleven people who live in Damrei Chhlang village in Kandal province. The members will use the loan for different purposes. The group leader, Mr. Ny Souern, is the village bank president. He is 42 years old and the father of five children, who all attend the local school. He is a farmer who has a 2 hectare field, on which he cultivates rice for a living. He has insufficient rice seeds to cultivate rice. Therefore, he requests a loan to buy them. He will alS. use the funds to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to improve his crop yield. His wife, Mrs. Touch Pov, owns a small grocery store where she sells grocery products.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main loan type. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Borrowers can repay portions of the principal earlier than the end of the term if they are financially able, which most clients tend to do. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Mrs. Pom Mai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The seventeen members live in Damrei Chhlang village in Kandal province. Each will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. Pom M. is a village bank president and is the group leader. She is 35 years old and the mother of three children, who all attend the local school. She owns 1 hectare farm on which she cultivates rice for a living. This season, she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to for this purpose. The loan will also allow her to purchase a water pump, which will increase her crop yield. Her husband, Mr. Sen Sun, constructs houses for a living.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main loan type. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Borrowers can repay portions of the principal earlier than the end of the term if they are financially able, which most clients tend to do. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Mrs. Vorn K. is a villager in Kor village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is 54 years old and the mother of two children, who are construction workers. She is thatch maker. The thatch she makes is used to cover the roofs in the rural area. Her husband, Mr. Uch Yeam, is a farmer who owns a 2 hectare farm, on which he cultivates rice for a living. Although they work hard, they still cannot provide a comfortable life for their family. Therefore, Mrs. Vorn K. is asking for a loan to buy a cow. She will breed the cow and sell it for a profit.

loans.use: to buy a cow to breed

loans.name: Norng

texts.en: Mrs. Norng P. was born in Kor Village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a 63 year old widow with a child who is a construction worker. She makes thatch. In addition, she is a farmer who owns 0.5 hectare plot on which she cultivates rice. Despite her hard work, she is unable to provide a comfortable life for her family. To improve her living conditions, she is asking for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny Sokunthea is 30 years old and lives in Kandal Province. She has been a fish seller since 2000. Everyday she gets up in early morning and goes to the fish wholesale market to purchase supplies of fish and sell them in the retail marketplace to earn income. She currently earns a profit of approximately $10 per day which she uses to meet the family's food needs. She is married and has three children, all of whom are still young. Her husband, San Soaphorn, 38, is also a fish seller and works with her. As fish sales are the main source of their family income, Sokunthea and Soaphorn decided to request a loan to purchase more fish and increase their sales.

loans.use: To purchase more fishes for resale

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mrs. Sophal N. is a villager who lives in Kraing Leav village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory while the remaining three attend the local school. Mrs. Sophal N. is a grocer who makes a small income, which is used to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sith Buntheourn, is a security guard.  Together, they are still unable to provide a good standard of living for their family. Therefore, Mrs. Sophal N. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Mrs. Vandy Ly Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The group consists of eighteen people who live in Char village in Kandal province. Each will use the loan for different purposes. One of these loans is an end-of term loan. The remaining seventeen require monthL. payments.

Mrs. Vandy L. is a village bank president and the group leader. She is 42 years old and the mother of four children.Two of her children are employed at a garment factory while the remaining two attend the local school. Mrs. Vandy L. sells dessert in the village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients for her delicious desserts. Her husband, Mr. L. Sambor, is a farmer. He cultivates rice on a small piece of land.

loans.use: to buy ingredient to make desserts

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en: Mr. Khoun H., 55, is a rice farmer and works with his wife in Chumrom Sieam Village in the Pursat Province. H. and his wife work hard everyday with the farming jobs. He has six children, two of whom are married; one daughter is a grocery seller and one son is a construction worker. Because rice is the main income for the family, H. needs to expand their farmland as much as possible. Therefore, he would like to request a loan to purchase a plot of farmland. His wife is pictured here as he was not available.

loans.use: Purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Thanh

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Thành năm nay 56 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương tư năm 2004. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đìnhh chị là chăn nuôi vịt, trồng trọt và làm thúng. Nhờ sự giúp đỡ của chồng và các con đã trưởng thành công việc chăn nuôi, sản xuất của gia đìnhchị Thành phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. P. Thi Thanh is 56 years old, and joined TYM fund in 2004. Currently, the main source of income for her family is her business in raising ducks, growing vegetables and making baskets. With the help of her husband and her grown children, her business in farming and producing expands quite well and brings in 245 USD monthly. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to buy feed for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising ducks

loans.name: Mrs. Yom Soth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is group loan. The fifteen members live in Damrei Chhlang Village in Kandal Province. Each will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Yom S. is a village bank president and is the group leader. She is 55 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is employed at a garment factory while the remaining three attend the local school. Mrs. Yom S. is a farmer who owns a 1 hectare farm on which she cultivates rice for a living. However, she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds this season. She is requesting a loan to buy them. The loan will also allow her to buy more fertilizer and pesticides to increase her crop yield. Her husband, Mr. M. Gnoy, is a laborer.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main loan type. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Borrowers can repay portions of the principal earlier T. the end of the term if they are financially able, which most clients tend to do. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Hoa

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Hoa 33 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con nhỏ tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hoá. Năm 2006 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào nghề đệt chiếu truyền thống của địa phương. Hiện nay ngoài đệt chiếu, để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình chị Hoa còn đi đánh bắt cá, chồng chị đi làm thợ xây. Vì thế hàng tháng gia đình chị đều có mức thu nhập ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hoa mong muốn được vay 6.000.000để đầu tư mua thêm 1 chiếc thuyền nhỏ phục vụ cho công việc đánh bắt cá
texts.en:
Ms. P. Thi Hoa is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 young children in the District of Quang Xuong in the town of Thanh Hoa. In 2006 she joined TYM fund and borrowed money to invest in the business of weaving sedge mats, a tradition in this region. In addition to weaving mats, to increase their income she also fishes and her husband is a construction worker. Therefore, every month her family has the ability to bring in a stable income of 187 USD. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 375 USD to buy another small boat for her fishing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fishing business

loans.name: Mr. Peng Tuy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan.  The seventeen members live in Damrei Chhlang Village in Kandal Province. 

Mr. Peng T. is a 56-year-old widower with three children. One of his children is employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending the local school. Mr. Peng T. is a village bank president and group leader. He owns a rice mill. He also owns a 1 hectare farm on which he cultivate rice for a living. He does not have enough money to buy rice seeds this season. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase thE.. The loan will also allow him to buy fertilizer and pesticides to increase his crop yield.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main loan type. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Borrowers can repay portions of the principal earlier than the end of the term if they are financially able, which most clients tend to do. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị L. 40 tuổi. Năm 2004 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi chị L. còn đi làm thợ đá cho thu nhập 35.000đ/ ngày, chồng chị đi làm thợ xây cho thu nhập 65.000đ/ ngày. Với mức thu nhập ổn định này gia đình chị đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoang Thi L. is 40 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2004 to invest in her duck raising business. Currently, in addition to her ducks, she works at a stone quarry, making 35,000 VND per day. Her husband is a construction worker, making 65,000 VND per day. With this stable income, her family's living standard is gradually improving. She wishes to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in feed for livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị N. 37 tuổi. Năm 2004 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà. Hiện tại ngoài thu thời gian giúp đỡ vợ chăn nuôi, chồng chị còn đi làm thuê để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Với mức thu nhập ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng gia đình chị đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi N. is 37 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2004 to invest in raising chickens. Currently, in addition to helping with raising livestock, her husband works as a hired hand to increase the family's income. At a stable income of 3,000,000 VND per month, her family has more opportunity to improve its living standard. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in feed for livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ThienN. Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Loh

texts.en: Loh M. is 55 years old and makes a living selling freshwater fish. She uses a bicycle to transport her fish and sells them traveling from village to village in her area. Loh is currently earning around of $5 per day. She is a mother of seven children, three of whom are employed and are working in a garment factory. The other four children are in school. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver who earns about $5 a day. Together they meet family's food needs. To make transportation in her business easier, Loh is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle to replace her old bicycle for her business travels.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 47 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện tại công việc đem lại thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị H. là  từ tiền công làm thuê của hai vợ chồng chị và chăn nuôi lợn, bò. Với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng chị  H. không chỉ thực hiện tốt việc  trả vốn mà gia đình chị còn có điều kiện hơn để đầu tư cho các con ăn học
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ  để đầu tư mua thêm một con bò và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 47 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2004. Currently, the main source of income for her family comes from the couple's salaries as hired hands and from raising pigs and cows. With an income of 3,000,000 VND per month, Mrs. Nguyen not only can pay her loans on time but she can also has the means to send her children to school. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in buying a cow and feed for livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Mrs. Than R., 32, raises pigs and lives in Batrumdoul Village in the Pursat Province. She is married to Mr. Seng Ol, who is rice farmer. They both work hard everyday and live with their two children, who are young and in school. To increase the size of their farmland for rice growing, Mrs. R. is requesting a loan to purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.use: Purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị T. tham gia quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Qua 4 năm tham gia Quỹ  chị T. luôn hoàn trả vốn đúng hạn và thực hiện tốt các Quy định của Quỹ. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi hai vợ chồng chị T. còn  làm thêm nghề đan thúng để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Ngoài ra hàng tháng hai con của chị đều hỗ trợ thêm cho bố mẹ nên thu nhập của gia đình chị T. rất ổn định. 
Vòng vốn tới chị T. mong muốn được vay thêm 7.000.000đ, một phần chị sử dụng để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để đầu tư cho con gái làm may.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi T. has been with TYM Fund since 2004. In the past four years with the fund, she has always paid back her loans on time and follow the fund's rules well. Currently, in addition to raising livestock, Mrs. Pham and her husband work as basket weavers to increase the family's income. Her two children also help the couple out financially each month, so the family's income is very stable. She would like to borrow 7,000,000 VND to partly invest in raising livestock and to invest in her daughter's tailor business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Mr. Ly Math Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The seventeen members of the group live in Svay Bakav village in Kampong Chhnang province. Each member will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mr. L. M. is a village bank president and group leader. He is 58 years old and the father of five children. Three of his children help on the famiL. farm while the remaining two attend the local school. Mr. L. M. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice for a living. However, he does not have enough money to buy rice seeds this season.  He is therefore requesting a loan to buy them. The loan will also allow H. to purchase fertilizer to increase his crop yield. His wife, Mrs. Sman L. Sas, helps H. on the farm.

This is a village bank loan consisting of end-of-term loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main loan type. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Borrowers can repay portions of the principal earlier than the end of the term if they are financialL. able, which most clients tend to do. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thi D. 51 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 1 con đã trưởng thành và đã đi làm. Hàng ngày ngoài chăn nuôi  chị D. còn tranh thủ thời gian  đan thúng bán nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Hiện tại với thu nhập  3.000.000đ/ tháng từ chăn nuôi, đan thúng và lương thợ xây của chồng kinh tế gia đình chị D. đang ngày càng ổn dịnh và phát triển hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị D. mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng mua nguyên liệu về đan thúng, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi D. is 51 years old. She has been with TYM Fund since 2005. She has three children, one of whom is grown and is working. Besides raising livestock, Mrs. Pham also weaves basket to increase her family's income. Currently, with an income of 3,000,000 VND per month from raising livestock, weaving baskets and from her husband's salary as a construction worker, her family's economy is becoming stable and growing. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to party invest in materials for weaving baskets and to invest in raising livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Dam Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đàm Thị Lĩnh năm nay 59 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiên tại hai vợ chồng chị đều là cán bộ hưu trí hàng tháng đều có lương ổn định. Ngoài thu nhập từ lương hưu gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi nên kinh tế rất ổn định.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 đ để đầu tư vốn mua máy đổ bê tông tạo thêm  việc làm cho các con.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dam Thi L. is 59 years old. She has been with TYM Fund since 2004. Currently, Mrs. Dam and her husband are tired government workers with a stable pension. In addition to the pension, her family also has an additional income from livestock raising so her family's economy is stable. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in a concrete mixing machine to create jobs for her children.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hồ Thị Liên  45 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hoá. Hiện nay công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Liên là từ kinh doanh đồ điện. Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm cán bộ thuỷ nông của chồng nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn  định với thu nhập  5.000.000đ/ tháng
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh đồ điện của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Hồ Thị Liên is 45 years old. She, her husband and their 3 children live in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hoá province. Her family main income comes from electronic goods retail business. Her husband is a cadre in agriculture. Their family income is stable, 5.000.000 VND a month. For this round of loan, Mrs Liên is requesting 9.000.000 VND to invest in her electric goods retail business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her electronic goods retail business

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.vi: Chi  Cao Thị O. 42 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi, trồng trọt gia đình chị O. còn làm thêm nghề đánh bắt cá, đây cũng là công  việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập  chủ yếu cho gia đình chị. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để mua thêm lưới phục vụ cho công việc đánh bắt cá tăng thu nhập cho gia
texts.en:
Cao Thị O. is 42 years old, a TYM fund member since 2004. She and her family raise animals, cultivate and fish. The later is their main source of income. For this loan cycle, she is requesting 9.000.000 VND to buy fishing net to improve their fishing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fishsing net

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um R., 56, sells food in her area. She sells a variety of food to her customers who live in her village and people who travel to her store. Her husband has been an experienced rice farmer, since 1979. Mrs. R. has ten children, four of whom are married and six are single, two of the children have jobs that help support the family's expenses. As selling rice is the main income for the family, Mrs. R. is requesting a loan so that her husband can purchase a cow for breeding. The cattle produced in the future will be used for farming. Mrs.R.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: Purchase of a breeding cow

loans.name: Mrs. Nub Sor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The nine members of the group live in Svay Bakav village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Nub S. is a village bank president. She is 49 years old and the mother of five children. Three of her children work in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. She has 0.5 hectare plot on which she cultivates rice for a living. Unfortunately, her field is infertile. To rectify the problem, Mrs. Nub S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to increase her crop yield. Her husband, Mr. H. S., helps her with the farm.

This is a village bank loan consisting of end-of-term loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main loan type. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Borrowers can repay portions of the principal earlier than the end of the term if they are financially able, which most clients tend to do. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Huệ 50 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi, trồng trọt gia đình chị Huệ còn làm thêm nghề đánh bắt cá trên biển, đây cũng là công  việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.000.00đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để mua thêm dụng cụ  phục vụ cho công việc đánh bắt cá tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Lê Thị Huệ is 50 years old. She participates in TYM fund since 2004. Beside raising poultry and some cultivation, she and her family also fish at sea, this is their main source of their income which amounts to 3.000.000 VND a month. This round of loan she is requesting 9.000.000 VND to buy fishing gear to catch more fish and increase their revenue.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fishing gear

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Ngô Thị Bảo năm nay 30 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện tại chồng chị Bảo đang lamg nghề thợ mộc còn chị chăn nuôi  lợn, gà và chăm sóc hai con nhỏ. Công việc làm mộc, chăn nuôi của gia đình  chị đang ngày càng phát triển và đem lại cho gia đình chị nguồn thu nhập ổn định 3.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mongm uốn được vay 6.000.000để đầu tư mua thêm gỗ phục vụ cho việc sản xuất của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Ngô Thị Bảo is 30 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 2007. Her husband is a carpenter, she raises pigs, poultry and takes care of their 2 young children. Her husband work is stable, her animal raising business is good. They make a good combined income of 3.500.000 VND a month. For this loan cycle, she is requesting 6.000.000 VND to invest in her husband's business: to buy wood.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood for her husband

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Kob Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The fifteen members of the group live in Svay Bakav village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Mom K. is village bank president. She is 38 years old and the mother of four children, who attend the local school. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a small plot for a living. However, her field is infertile and she does not have fuE. for her water pump. Therefore, Mrs. Mom K. is asking for a loan to rectify these problems. Her husband, Mr. Man Prohim, is a fisherman.

This is a village bank loan consisting of end-of-term loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main loan type. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Borrowers can repay portions of the principal earlier than the end of the term if they are financialL. able, which most clients tend to do. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fuel to cultivate rice

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam P., 25, is rice farmer and her husband cuts and sells wood. Her husband cuts the wood in the forest and sells it to customers who live in the town. He transports the wood to his customer's homes by oxen. P. has two children who are young and in school. To increase their business income, P. would like to request a loan for her husband to purchase one additional ox for use with the business.

loans.use: Purchase one ox to transport wood for sale

loans.name: Buluh Sari Group

texts.id:
Beberapa orang yang berdomisili atau bertempat tinggal  di Desa Pangkung Buluh yang sudah membentuk kelompok dengan Nama Kelompok ” Buluh Sari ”. Dalam pinjaman pertama mereka mendapatkan keuntungan yang minimal yaitu antara Rp. 500.000,- sampai Rp. 700.000,- per 6 bulani. Walaupun demikian anggota kelompok tetap semangat untuk bisa melanjutkan usahanya. Oleh karena itu kelompok  Buluh sari tetap mengajukan pinjaman untuk periode yang kedua, dimana jangka waktu pijaman 6 bulan dan pengembaliannya pinjaman dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
Pinjaman yang kedua ini akan dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit babi unggul dan pakan babi yang akhir-akhir ini mengalami peningkatan yang sangat drastis. Sehingga anggota kelompok Buluh sari sangat memerlukan tambahan dana untuk kelanjutan usahanya.Dengan usaha beternak babi yang tetap dijalankan oleh anggota kelompok Buluh sari, maka mereka dapat menunjang ekonomi keluarga mereka yang nantinya dapat memperbaiki  keadaan ekonomi keluarganya khususnya dalam pendidikan anak-anak mereka.
texts.en:
Several prople who lives in Pangkung Buluh village who already build an club with the name: ” Buluh Sari ” group. From their first loan, they made a small profit, between Rp. 500,000,- to Rp. 700,000,- for the 6 month period (Translator's note: 1 US$ is about Rp 10,000-12,000). However, club members are still enthusiastic to continue their business. Therefore Buluh sari group still applies for their 2nd period loan, dor aperiod of 6 months, and loan return at the end of loan period. This second loan will be used to buy superior piglets and pig feed which has increase in price drastically lately. That is why Buluh sari members very much need the increased funds to continue their efforts. By pig farming that is continued to be run by Buluh sari club members, they could support the family economy, and better their family economic situation, especially in their children's education.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Superior quality piglets and feed (Bibit kwalitas unggul dan pakan)

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị H. năm nay 33 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện nay ngaòi chăn nuôi, hai vợ chồng chị H. đều làm nghề buôn bán thịt lợn. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi mua lợn thịt về giết mổ còn chị H. bán lẻ tại chợ cho thu nhập bình quân 100.000đ/ ngày. Với mức thu nhập ổn định này gia đình chị H. đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để nâng cao chất lượng cuộc sống.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 5.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư cho việc buôn bán thịt lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs Lê Thị H. is 33, she is a TYM fund member since 2004. She and her husband raise livestock. They also sell pork. Everyday her husband would buy pig from a supplier, butchers it and H. would sell it at the local market. Their make 100.000 VND a day. With a steady income her family living condition improves eveyday. This round of loan Mrs H. is requesting 5.000.000 VND to invest in her pork retail business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her pork retail business

loans.name: Ni Luh Budi Artini

texts.id: Keinginan yang sangat besar untuk membantu suami dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya cukup tinggi.Ibu Budiartini Adalah seorang Ibu rumah tangga dengan satu orang anak perempuanSelama ini Ibu Budiartini hanya seorang ibu rumah tangga yang hanya mengurusi rumah tangganya.tetapi setelah ada program dari Dinari Ibu Budiartini Ingin berusaha memelihara 4 induk  babi,agar ada tambahan untuk kebutuhan rumah tangganya.Suami yang selama ini hanya bekerja sendiri sangat mendukung program yang ditawarkan oleh Dinari.Untuk itu Suami Budiartini ingin agar Modal Yang didapat nantinya bisa membatu kebutuhan Rumah Tangganya.Karena Ketut Sedana Hanya sebagai sopir truk yang mengangkat pesanan pasir dari pelanggan.Itupun Ketut Sedana bekerja ditempat orang lain yang hanya dibayar harian.Ibu Budiartini berharap bila mendapat modal akan memelihara Induk babi.Semoga usaha ini bisa menopang dan membatu Suami agar bisa memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya.
texts.en:
Her willingness to assist her husband to meet househould needs is quite high. Mrs Budiartini is a mother with one daughter. So far Mrs Budiartini is a homemaker who is only concern about her household. However, after a Dinari program, Mrs Budiartini like to raise 4 mother pigs, for addition to her household expenses. Her tenant employed husband is very much in support of the program offered by Dinari. Therefor Budiartini's husband wishes that the obtained capital could help their household needs, since Ketut Sedana only works as a truck driver who delivers orgered sand for customers. For that Ketut Sedana works in other people's location, and is only paid daily. Mrs Budiartini hopes that if capital is obtained she could raise mother pigs. Hopefully these efforts could support and help husband to meet household needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mother pigs and feed (Induk babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Ni Kadek Juli Asih

texts.id: Dirumah yang sangat kecil dan sederhana yang hanya terbuat dari batako,Ibu Kadek Juli asih tinggal dengan suami dan satu orang anak perempuan yang masih kecil berumur 2 Tahun.Setiap harinya Ibu Kadek hanya mengurusi keluarganya.padahal kadang ibu kadek ingin membantu suami bekerja sebagai buruh tani harian.tetapi anak ibu kadek tidak ada yang menjaga.kebutuhan yang dirasakan tidak mencukupi,karena suami ketut sudiana hanya bekerja sendiri.Hasil kebun yang dimiliki tidak seberapa.Setelah ada program bantuan dari Dinari Ibu kadek ingin ikut program tersebut.Ibu Kadek akan memelihara 1 babi  penggemukan.Walaupun belum punya kandang,Ibu kadek berusaha akan membuat kandang sederhana.Program ini sangat membantu Ibu Kadek untuk bisa mendapat keuntungan yang akan bisa menutupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya.Sehingga Ibu kadek sangat semangat bila modal itu akan diberikan dalam waktu yang cepat.Semoga bisa dipakai untuk usaha dan bisa berkembang dengan baik.Sehingga Bisa untuk tambahan keluarga.
texts.en:
In a very small and simple hut made from batako, Mrs. Kadek Juli Asih lives with her husband and 2 year old daughter. Every day Mrs. Kadek is only concerned about her family, however sometimes Mrs. Kadek likes to help her tenant farmer husband who is paid daily. Yet nobody is taking care of Mrs Kadek's daughter. Daily needs are not met, since husband Ketut Sudiana works alone. Farm results are meager. After there is an assistance program from Dinari, Mrs kadek like to join that program. Mrs. Kadek will raise 1 fattening pig. Although they have no stall, Mrs kadek tries to make a simple stall. This Program very much help Mrs Kadek to obtain profit that could help cover household expenses. Therefor Mrs kadek is enthusiastic if the capital could be obtained speedily. So that it could be used for business and expand quickly, hence could add family's income.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mother pig & feed (Induk babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Ni Ketut Kamar Adiani

texts.id:
Suatu anggapan bahwa seorang ibu rumah tangga hanya memiliki tugas di dapur dan mengurus anak saja itu tak berlaku Lagi bagi kalangan ibu –ibu desa di Bali Khususnya.Banyak pekerjaan atau usaha yang dulunya dilakukan oleh kaum pria kini sudah dikerjakan oleh para wanita. Seperti apa yang telah dilakukan oleh Ni Ketut Kamar Adiani . Memelihara ternak babi yang telah ditekuni sejak 2 tahun belakangan ini telah banyak membantu perekonomian keluarganya.bahkan hasil yang didapatpun tak kalah dengan pendapatan suaminya yang bekerja  sebagai tukang/buruh  bangunan . Kontribusi Ni Ketut Kamar dari hasil penjualan 4 ekor ternak babinya dalam sebulan mencapai sebesar Rp 400.000 .Apalagi saat ini Ni Ketut Kamar berencana, jika mendapat pinjaman dana dari Dinari, akan dipergunakan untuk membeli tambahan bibit baru lagi serta sisanya untuk membeli pakan .     
Ni Ketut Kamar ingin menjadi wanita yang sukses baik dalam menjalankan usaha maupun dalam menunjang biaya pendidikan anaknya. Untuk itu Ni Ketut Kamar sangat tekun dan tanpa melupakan pekerjaan pokoknya sebagai Ibu rumah tangga ,mengurusi dan merawat ternak –ternak peliharaanya.
texts.en:
The notion that housewifes only works in the kitchen and raisni g children does not apply anymore for village mothers specially in Bali. Many kind of work or business that previously were done by men are now done by women. Like the one done by Ni Ketut Kamar Adiani. To raise pigs is her occupation since the last 2 years, and has help family's economy. Her income is comparable to her husbands income who works as building laborer. Ni Ketut Kamar's contribution from sale of her 4 pigs could reach about Rp 400,000/month (translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp10,000-12,000). Especially now Ni Ketut Kamar plans, that if she could obtain the loan from Dinari, to buy more piglets, and rest to buy feed. Ni Ketut Kamar likes to be a successful person in business, as well as helping in paying her children's education. For that Ni Ketut Kamar is persistent, while not forgetting her main job as a mother, maintaining and nursing her farm animals.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pilets and feed (Anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem R., 53, is rice farmer who lives in Botrumdoul Village in the Pursat province. She has been farming with her husband since 1979. They both work hard everyday with the farm, supporting the family's expenses. She has ten children, seven of whom are married and have left home, living independently. Three are single, and live in the family's home, helping with the farm. As another source of income, Mrs. R. operates a tailoring business that she learned when younger, but now, just sews for family's members. Because she lacks sufficient money to run the business, she would like to request a loan to purchase cloth and make a small shop to provide the tailoring service.

loans.use: Purchase cloth and make a small shop to provide tailoring service

loans.name: Mat

texts.en: Mrs. Mat T. is 56 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City. She makes a living purchasing antique furniture such as tables, chairs, and beds to repair and sell to earn an income. She currently earns $5 a day to support her family. She is a good mother with six children, four of whom are single and two are married. One of her daughters sells sugar cane juice that also contributes to the family's support. Her husband is 57 years old and works with her. Mrs.T. is applying for a loan to enlarge her business and the remainder to buy a motorcycle for the family's transportation needs. (Mrs. T. and her family appear in the picture)

loans.use: To enlarge the business and buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun T., 62, is rice farmer. Her husband sells wood that he cuts in the forest. She has three children, all of whom are married. Mrs.T., an experienced farmer, has been farming since 1979. Together, they support the family's expenses. As there is currently a shortage of labor for farming, Mrs.T. is requesting a loan to purchase an ox to use with her existing ox for farming works.

loans.use: Purchase an ox to use for farming

loans.name: Chhoeum

texts.en:
Chhoeum K. is 32 years old and resides in Phnom Penh City. She is married and now looks after two children. Both of her children are single and are living at home. She is a local merchant who owns and runs a store selling several kinds of fruit and rice also. She has been running her business for over 3 years in the area where her husband is also working. Her husband, Nghet Pisey, age 35, is a staff member of an association.

To expand her business and earn more income, K. needs to ask for a loan to purchase additional rice and fruit for re-sale. She hopes for a loan so she will be able to increase her income to cover her family's expenses and give her family stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice and fruit for re-sale

loans.name: Euloge

texts.fr: Euloge K. s’est marié avec Irène Hodonou. Ils ont quatre enfants, âgés 12, 7, 4, et 3 mois. Ils sont tous scolarisés. Euloge est né le 11 Mars 1965 à Porto Novo, et actuellement il a trois emplois. Il enseigne le physique, il vend les choses informatiques, et il est contractuel. Euloge va utiliser son prêt pour acheter un nouveau photocopieur pour sa deuxième entreprise, une boutique avec tous les trucs informatiques comme les clés, le papier, et les ordinateurs pour réparer. Il a commencé son entreprise en 1998. Il a un autre salarié dans son entreprise. Il lance également un projet de construction avec la terre rouge.
texts.en:
Euloge K. is married to Irène Hodonou. They have four children, aged 3 months, 4, 7, and 12. All the school-aged children are in school. Euloge was born on March 11, 1965 in Porto Novo and currently holds three jobs: he teaches physics, sells computer products, and is a contract employee. Euloge is going to use his loan to buy a new photocopier for his second business, a shop with all sorts of computer products like keys, paper and computers to be repaired. He began his business in 1998 and works with one other employee. He is also starting a construction project on the "terre rouge" (red earth road).

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: S. Cécile s’est mariée avec BONOU Fernand. Ils ont 4 enfants, 27, 23, 21, et 18, tous scolarisés et deux en université actuellement. Elle est née le 22 Novembre 1961. Elle a fini l’école quand elle a 6 ans. Elle vend le même produit depuis 20 ans.  Avec son crédit, elle va acheter de la nourriture – l’huile, le sauce, le cous cous, et le divers. Elle achète ses produits a Dantokpa. Elle s’inquiète de la concurrence parmi les femmes qui exercice le même entreprise qu’elle. Dans le futur, elle veut approvisionner.
texts.en:
Cécile S. is married to Fernand BONOU. They have 4 children, aged 27, 23, 21 and 18. All of the children are in school, two of them are currently at the university. Cécile was born on November 22, 1961, and left school at 6 years old. She has sold the same products for 20 years. With her loan she plans to buy food – oils, sauces, cous cous and various other items. She buys her products in Dantokpa. She is concerned about competition with other women running the same type of businesses. In the future she would like to be a supplier as well.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase foods.

loans.name: Tayessir

texts.en:
Tayessir is a 47-year-old man who lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2002. He makes doors and windows. Tayessir requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase iron for his business. Tayessir has been a micro-credit client for five years now and has always repaid on time.

A loan had helped Tayessir buy a piece of land on which he could build his shop. He is speciA. in his work because he has a good rapport with his clients and has competitive prices. His clients are his neighbors and others. When he first started, he faced some difficulties; he didn’t have enough cash to start his business. If he decided on doing this work, it is because of his experience and his good quality of work. In the future, he plans to buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.use: to purchase iron for his business

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21 year old engaged man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. He has been working as a carpenter for eleven years. Ahmed does bedroom furniture, closets and he also does doors during construction. He has requested a loan of $1000 dollars from A. Majmoua in order to reimburse his debts. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Ahmad is speciA. in his work because of his good behavior with clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to open a shop, so he had to work at home. Ahmad has a good reputation for honesty and hard work. His future plan is to finish building his house in order for him to live with his wife and start a family, but in the long term, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Ahmed needs the loan to reimburse his debts.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. He has been working as a motorcycle repairer for five years. He has requested a loan of $1000 dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase spare parts for motorcycles. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.
Ahmad is speciA. in his work because he is unique in his area. The loan will also help him support his parents.

loans.use: Ahmad needs the loan to purchase spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Kamela

texts.en:
Kamela is a 69 year old widow who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with her four children. She has owned a grocery and candy store for 19 years. She  has requested a loan of  $600 dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. Kamela has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always paid on time.
Kamela’s loans have helped her improve her capital and support her family. She is special in her work because she charges cheap prices to the children in order to attract clients. Her clients are her neighbors. In the future, she plans to purchase merchandise and help her son repair his car.

loans.use: Kamela needs the loan to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.fr: N. Yvonne s’est marié avec ASSIMANOU Charles. Ils ont 4 enfants – 16, 6, 4, et 1, tous scolarisés. Elle est née le 13 juin 1966.  Dame N. a commencé avec les beignets d’ignames frites. Actuellement elle est en vente de vivres – riz, tomates, sardines, mais, boissons, et sucreries. Elle achète ses produits au Marché Dantokpa. Ses revenus aide le foyer, et elle veut continuer avec cette activité pour acheter plus d’approvisionnement.
texts.en:
Yvonne N. is married to Charles Assimanou. They have four children, aged 16, 6, 4, and 1, and all school-aged children are in school. Yvonne was born on June 13, 1966. Mrs. N. began selling "beignets d’ignames" (fried yams) and currently sells other food items – rice, tomatoes, sardines, corn, drinks and sweets. She buys these products at the market in Dantokpa. Her income helps her household and she would like to continue this business by buying more supply.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is an 18-year-old man who lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon. He is a workman and also he owns an entertainment store where he has a baby football table and billiard games. He has requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new billiards and baby football games. This is the first time that Mohammed has requested a loan.

Mohammed decided on opening his entertainment store because being a workman didn’t help him earn enough money. His clients are friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans to improve the store in order to get more return.

loans.use: to purchase baby football tables and  billiard games

loans.name: Tit's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan group that consists of three members. Tit L. is 28 years old and sells fish in the market. She purchases fish from fishermen or wholesalers for re-sale, earning an income of around US$ 5 each day. This is a business she started in 2006. She is the mother of two children, both still small, and her husband is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables in their farm field.

L. is a women who sacrifices and works hard to earn money to sustain her family, especially to allow her two children to go to school. To expand the business, L. has applied for a loan to purchase extra fish for sale. L. is the leader this group. The other group loan members are:

Mrs. Yem Y., 57, a local farmer who grows corn and rice. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds for planting her field.

Mrs. Or A. is 60 years old and makes a living selling vegetables. She needs a loan to pay for vegetables, plowing a field, and vegetable seeds.

They all live in Wata Mem Commune in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To buy seeds to plant another crop

loans.name: Dib

texts.en:
Dib is a 27-year-old man who lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon with his wife and their daughter. He has been working in agriculture since 2001. He plants vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers, white beans, and cabbage. Dib has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars in order to purchase furniture for his house. This is the first time that Dib has requested a loan.

Dib wants to improve his monthly income and has also moved to a new area. His clients are wholesalers. In the future, he plans to create a private project.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house

loans.name: Inés

texts.fr: Y. Inés est une coiffeuse célibataire qui vend également les mèches et les produits cosmétiques. Elle est née le 10 aout 1977. Elle a commencé avec la vente des cartes de recharge et de pagnes et de tissus. Quand elle a reçu son prêt de Kiva en 2005, elle a ajouté les produits cosmétiques. Elle achète ses produits à Tokpa et à Lomé. Actuellement elle est entrain de construire une parcelle à côté d’elle pour avoir une vraie boutique coiffeuse.
texts.en:
Inés Y. is an unmarried hairdresser who also sells hair extensions and cosmetics. She was born on August 10, 1977. She started off with selling mobile phone cards, pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and fabrics. When she received her Kiva loan in 2005, she added cosmetics. She buys her goods in Tokpa and in Lomé. Currently, she is building on a plot of land next-door in order to have a real hair salon.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Cette jeune femme de vingt et un an réside dans le quartier d’agoè, elle fait le commerce d vente de sachets en plastiques dans le marché d’agoè atsanvé et ce depuis 2005, cette dynamique dame n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit pour s’approvisionner avec 65 cartons de sachets en plastiques.
Elle est mariée à monsieur BELEI sédianie qui est officier gendarmerie. Ils ont ensemble 01 enfant, madame veut aider son mari dans les besoins quotidiens du foyer.
texts.en:
Afi D. is 20 years old. She lives in the Agoe region. She has been selling plastic bags at the Agoè Atsanvé market since 2005. This entrepreneurial young woman has so far never requested a loan from WAGES. She is seeking to obtain this first loan in order to be able to purchase 65 boxes of plastic bags. She is married to Mr. Sedanie Belei, who works as a police officer. They have one child together. Afi wants to help her husband taking care of the every day needs of the family.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic bags

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: T. Pierrette s’est marié avec EGBENOU Cosme. Elle est née à 1961. Elle a quatre enfants, 26, 23, 18, et 11. Dame T. n’a pas eu l’opportunité d’une éducation, mais tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Elle cuisine la nourriture comme l’igname frites, les haricots, les ananas, et les bananes frites les soirs pour le diner. Elle achète sa nourriture a Tokpa, et elle vend également le charbon de bois.  A cause de l’économie, elle a vu une diminution dans sa vente, mais elle se débrouille et elle veut aggrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Pierrette T. is married to Cosme Egbenou. She was born in 1961. She has 4 children, aged 26, 23, 18, and 11. Mrs. T. was not able to get an education, but all her children are enrolled in school. She cooks food such as fried yams, beans, pineapple, and fried bananas to sell evenings at dinnertime. She buys her provisions in Tokpa and she also sells charcoal. Because of the economy, she has noticed that she is making fewer sales, but she is managing to get by and she wants to expand her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of food ingredients: coco yams, beans, etc.

loans.name: Adam Kodjo

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a trente neuf (39) ans, il habite le quartier d’Agoè cacavéli, un quartier au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Il est revendeur de volailles et de chèvre à Atakpamé, ce commerce est très florissant surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année, il fait ce commerce depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne au marché local de Notsè. L n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de chez WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit pour pouvoir acheter 20 chèvres et 50 volailles surtout en ce »s périodes de fêtes de fin d’année.
Il est célibataire mais il a un enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
Mr. Adam kodjo A. is 39 years old. He lives in the Agoe neighborhood to the north of the city of Lome, capital of Togo. He resells poultry and goats at Atakpame. This is a very profitable business especially during the season of the celebration of the end of the year. He has been in this business since 2005. He purchases his goods at the local market in Notse. He has never yet obtained a loan from WAGES and is requesting his first one in order to be able to purchase 20 goats and 50 birds. This is especially important for his commerce since right now is the season for celebrating the end of the year. He is single, but has a child that he is taking care of.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase poultry and goats

loans.name: Saidnisso

texts.en:
Saidnisso M. is 38 years old. She lives in Khujand. She is married with 3 children. Mrs. M. is engaged selling hardware and she has a second business outlet selling men's wear.

Now Mrs. M. is applying for a KIVA loan in the amount of 4000 TJS with a term of 2 months to expand her existing business and for hardware (wood, tacks, metalwork units) that she wants to import from China. She thanks KIVA for support and wishes Kiva lenders all the very best for the coming year.

loans.use: to expand her existing businesses

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: A. Léonie est veuve et elle a 3 garçons, 32, 30, and 28. Elle est née le 16 juin 1952. Elle a commencé son activité il y a 8 ans avec la distribution des tissus et des gels. Les crédits de Kiva lui a permis de rester sur place pour vendre la nourriture comme le macaroni, le pate alimentaires et les boissons frais comme les jus du fruits, le bissap, et les sodas Beninois.  Avec ce crédit, elle veut acheter un deuxième congélateur pour ses boissons frais. Depuis qu’elle commence avec Kiva, elle a vu une augmentation de sa vente, et dans le futur elle veut ajouter les boissons comme Coca et Sprite.
texts.en:
Léonie A. is a widow, and she has 3 sons, aged 32, 30, and 28. She was born June 16, 1952. She began her business 8 years ago, selling cloth and gels. A Kiva credit has allowed her to stay in the same place and sell food such as macaroni, other pastas, and cooled drinks such as fruit juice and bissap (hibiscus flower tea). With this loan she wants to buy a second freezer for her cooled drinks. Since she began to work with Kiva, she has seen an increase in her sales, and in future she wants to add other drinks such as Coke and Sprite.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a freezer for her little business

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr: B. Blandine s’est mariée avec DELEKE Coco Germain. Elle est née le 3 février 1963 et elle a cinq enfants, 22, 21, 20, 16, et 3 ans. Elle vend le charbon et le divers comme le lait, le cous cous, les œufs, le savon, et les jars. Sa boutique semble comme un petit supermarché, et Blandine a beaucoup de clients. Elle veut utiliser son crédit pour acheter le charbon. Elle achète son charbon à Dantokpa et elle paie les motos pour le transporter. Elle peut aussi faire les commandes. Elle a vendu ses produits pour 20 ans, et elle veut augmenter son approvisionnement.
texts.en:
Blandine B. is married to Coco Germain Deleke. She was born on February 3, 1963 and she has 5 children, aged 22, 21, 20, 16, and 3 ans. She sells charcoal and various other things such as milk, couscous, eggs, soap and jars. Her store seems like a little supermarket, and Blandine has a lot of customers.

Blandine wants to use this loan to buy charcoal. She buys her charcoal at Dantokpa, and she pays motorcyclists to transport it. She can also take orders. She has been selling her products for 20 years, and she wants to enlarge her stock.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Suhaili

texts.ru: Каноатов Сухайли торгует на рынке около 8 лет.  Старшая  дочь как окончила школу  сразу вышла на рынок, а младшая  вовсе  не получив среднее образование помогала родителям. Перед новым годом  Сухайли планирует получить очередную сумму и  привезти из Москвы, а также из других стран разнообразные конфеты, для подарков. У него большой ассортимент конфет. В его  отсутствии ему помогал его младший брат, но брат со своей семьей уехал на заработки в Россию.  Жена Сухайли взяла бизнес в свои руки. В его отсутствии его жена помогает ему поддерживать  бизнес, когда он присылает товар, она во время получает и поставляет на рынок.
texts.en:
Suhaili Q. has been selling food for about 8 years. His older daughter started helping him immediately after graduating from high school; however, his younger daughter started helping parents before she could graduate from school. Before the New Years day, Suhaili plans to obtain a loan and import from Moscow, and a number of other countries, a large assortment of candy for gifts. While he was on his business trip, his younger brother looked after his business. But recently he and his family moved to Russia for a temporary job. Then, his wife took over. Now, in his absence, his wife helps him maintain his business; when he sends her additional inventory, she arranges the arrival of the shipment and replenishes the inventory.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An increase in working capital

loans.name: Thap's Group

texts.en:
This loan composed of four borrowers. All of borrowers live in Toul Ta Ek Commune in Battambang Province. 

Mrs. Thap Y. is 41 years old. She owns and runs a small workshop in her home in which her employees provide  service, making chairs, tables, and cupboards for sale. She has run the business since 1979 and currently earns a profit of approximately $6 a day. She is married to Ty Lihak, age 63, a construction supervisor who earns about $3 per day. The couple have five children: three are married, one is single, and one daughter also helps in her mother's business. Y. is applying a loan to purchase carpentry materials for her business activities. 

Y. is the leader of three members;
Kruy G., 55, sells used-clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.
Keo K. E. is 51 years old and sells groceries. She needs a loan to purchase groceries for sale. Hach P., 56, makes a living selling Khmer Noodles and roasting bananas. P. requested a loan to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en:
Clifford A. manufactures palm oil at Ntsiman near Elmina and has been doing so since 1998. Clifford has received a senior high school education. He is married and has 7 dependents. His wife is a trader. He is responsible for the payment of his children's school fees and other utility bills. His loan will be used to buy gas oil and petrol to run his palm oil manufacturing machine. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to invest in his children's education.

The picture shows Clifford by the oil making machine

loans.use: To buy gas oil and petrol to run his palm oil manufacturing machine.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia D. is a palm oil producer at Ntsiman near Elmina. Emelia has received her senior high school education.  She is single and has no children. Emelia has been selling palm oil which she produces since 2005. She is responsible for paying rent and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more oil palm fruits to enable her to increase the production of the palm oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further expand the business and increase her income..

loans.use: To buy more oil palm fruits to enable her to increase the production of the palm oil.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur de 44 ans habite le quartier  d’agoè où il détient une boutique du nom de « Ets BITI’S OLUS  dans laquelle il vend des produits des matériaux de construction. Il s’approvisionne dans le grand marché de Lomé. Il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES  et sollicite ce crédit pour répondre à la demande  augmenté avec l’achat de 140 boîtes de peinture, 101 cartons de clou et un carton de serrures.
Il est marié et a 04 enfants, son mari est une revendeuse. Avec le bénéfice tiré de ce commerce, il pourra bien prendre à charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi K. is 44 years old and lives in the Agoe neighborhood. He has a store called "Ets BITI's OLUS" in which he sells building materials. He purchases goods for resale at the market in Lome. He has never previously obtained a loan. He is asking for one now in order to be able to satisfy the increased demand and purchase140 boxes of paint, 101 boxes of nails and 1 box of locks. He is married and has 4 children. His wife is a sales woman. This loan will ensure that he can take care of his family.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris B. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through senior high school. Doris is a palm oil producer at Ntsiman near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2006. Her husband is a teacher. Doris uses her income to pay for the daily housekeeping expenses. Doris will use the loan to purchase more oil palm fruits to enable her to increase the production of the palm oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Doris plans to improve upon the quality of education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more oil palm fruits to enable her to increase the production of  palm oil.

loans.name: Koffi Marius

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur de 39 ans réside dans le quartier d’Agoè cacavéli au nord de la ville de Lomé (Togo). Ce monsieur travaille dur pour satisfaire sa famille, il est chaudronnier à une boutique qu’il a appelé FONDATION MARIUS. il  travaille ce métier depuis 1993. il a déjà obtenu 03 prêt de WAGES qu’il a bien remboursé, il demande ce quatrième prêt pour acheter 200 pièces de cordes, 30 tuyaux et 20 coffrets.
Il  est marié avec une dame qui est revendeuse et ont ensemble 01 enfant.
texts.en:
Koffi Marius A. is 39 years old. He lives in the "Cacavéli" neighborhood of Agoe located to the north of the city of Togo. He works in order to provide for his family. He is a boilermaker and has a store called "Fondation Marius" (Marius Foundation). He has been in this business since 1993. He has already obtained 3 loans previously that he was able to successfully pay back. He is looking to obtain a 4th loan in order to purchase 200 pieces of rope, 30 pieces of pipe and 20 boxes. He is married and has 1 child. His wife is a sales woman.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rope, piping and boxes

loans.name: Hamrojon

texts.en:
K. Hamrojon is a 53-year-old mother whose husband has no fixed income. So, to cover day-to-day necessities, she processes and sells dried apricots with the help of her son. She uses all the money she makes to care for her three children and provide for their education. Hamrojon has 11 years of experience in processing and selling dried apricots. She is very polite and considerate and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today Hamrojon is requesting 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the term of 3 months. She is going to spend the loan to purchase dried apricots with the purpose of processing them in order to increase the range of her goods on sale. Hamrojon and her son express their gratitude to everyone for supporting them and they promise to repay their loan in a timely manner.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina B. sells a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey' which is made out of corn. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country and it is normally eaten with hot sauce and fried fish at Ntsiman near Elmina. She also manufactures palm oil for sale. Sabina has received schooling through junior high. She is married and has 3 children. Sabina has been selling 'Kenkey' and producing oil since 1993. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her purchase of maize, fresh fish and other ingredients which she uses to prepare the Kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to improve upon the quality of education for her children.

Sabina is shown in the picture making the oil

loans.use: To increase her purchase of maize ,fresh fish and other ingredients which she uses to prepare the Kenkey.

loans.name: Mawulé

texts.fr:
Madame A. est âgée de 55 ans et travaille dur pour venir à charge de sa famille, elle  habite le quartier d’agoè kléve au nord de la ville de Lomé(Togo) où elle vend des céréales, haricots et du charbon en détail depuis 1968 dans le quartier  de d’agoè gare, elle s’approvisionne pour son commerce au marché local de Notsè. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit pour s’approvisionner avec 03  sacs de maïs, 10 sacs de d’haricots et 03 sacs de charbons.
Elle est mariée à un militaire qui  est à la retraite, ils ont eu ensemble 08 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Attisove is 55 years old. She works hard to take care of her family. She lives in the Agoe region in the Northern section of the city of Togo. She has been selling grain, beans and charcoal since 1968. She sells her goods not far from the train station in Agoe and purchases them at the neighboring market located in Notse. She has never previously obtained a loan and is requesting this first one in order to be able to purchase 3 bags of corn, 10 bags of beans and 3 bags of charcoal. She is married to a retired army man. Together, they have 8 children.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, beans and charcoal

loans.name: Ergashjon

texts.en:
A hardworking and dedicated businesswoman, Ergashjon S. has operated a business making national-style women's dresses and socks in the central market of Isfara for the past 13 years. Ergashjon is seamstress by profession. Being in this kind of business for along time, she is well known and her dresses are always in good demand at the market. Her husband (who is pictured in the photo) helps her with the business and usually sells dresses at the market, while Ergashjon is always busy fulfilling orders from her customers. Ergashjon has utilized microfinance loans from IMON Interantional to accomplish this development, repaying each with a perfect credit history. Ergashjon’s business is the sole source of income for her family. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) to increase her clothing inventory, allowing her to increase her profits and provide a higher standard of living for her family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
