Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMONl's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabric for sewing national-style dresses

loans.name: Cherifatou

texts.fr: Née le 21 Février 1974 à Cotonou dans le département du littoral au Sud du Bénin,Dame A. Chérifatou est mariée à IDOHOU Obalowou. Elle est mère de d'un enfant. Dame A. procède à la distribution des bijoux et dispose en plus d'une boutique sur le PARC à Sèkandji où elle vent des pièces détachées, Désireuse de renforcer d'avantage son activité, elle démande ce crédit.
texts.en:
Mrs Cherifatou Ajado was born on February 24th, 1974 at Cotonou in the South Coastal area of Benin, and is married to Obalowoa Idohou. She is the mother of one child. Mrs Ajado distributes and sells jewelery and jewelery repair items from a shop in the marketplace ( PARC) in the city of Sekandji. Chérifatou is requesting this loan to strengthen her business in this area.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies of jewelery and jewelery repair items

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia B. is a single parent and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high. Felicia sells fruits at Abreshia near Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Felicia uses her income for paying rent and other utility bills. Felicia will use the loan to increase the variety of fruits to meet the demands of her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Felicia plans to invest in her child's education.

loans.use: To increase the variety of fruits to meet the demands of her costumers.

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Dame A. Colette est née le 16 janvier 1976 à porto novo, elle est veuve et à 02 enfants à sa charge. Elle vend du riz dans un collège privé de la place, parèllèlement à cette activité elle vend de la farine de manioc, le kilo de riz et de l'huile à la maison. Pour couvrir toute sa clientèle et vu  aussi le nombre des élèves qui ne cesse  d'augmenter chaque année et particulièrement cette rentrée, elle a du solliciter ce pret.
texts.en:
Mrs Colette Agbaosi was born on January 16th, 1976 in Porto Novo. She is a widow and supports 2 children. She sells rice on site at a private college. Besides this, she also sells manioc flour, kilos of rice and oil from her house. She is requesting this loan to keep up with her growing clientele and students, whose numbers keep increasing every year, especially this school year.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 sacks of rice, oil and manioc flour for resale

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
Salomat is a devoted mother that struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Ten years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in their land for this business. She is engaged in this business together with her husband. Slowly, the number of cows increased and her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Be an important part of the growth of Salomat’s business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is one of the poorer of the 15 former Soviet Republics, with a GDP per capita of less than $600. The civil war, which took place soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., severely damaged the already-weak economic infrastructure and caused a sharp decline in agricultural production and the manufacturing sector.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  All of these factors have resulted in a severe lack of jobs and have forced hundreds of thousands to leave Tajikistan to find work in other countries, mostly in Russia.  While Tajikistan has experienced some economic growth since the end of the Civil War, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON International's mission is to promote sustainable economic development and improved quality of life in Tajikistan by insuring reliable access to financial services for the economically active members of the population. IMON has eight branch offices throughout Tajikistan and their entrepreneurs work in many parts of the country's economic sector including trade, manufacturing, agriculture, and services. As of October 2008, IMON had 27,802 active clients and a total portfolio of $28,405,549.  Approximately 44% of these clients are women and 65% are from rural areas.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing adult and young cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Cette jeune dame de quarante (40) ans vit dans le quartier d’Agoè Légbassito, un quartier de Lomé. Elle est une revendeuse de boissons locales, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 1985, et ce dans son quartier, ce commerce marche bien pour cette dame  parce qu’elle a beaucoup de clients. Elle a déjà obtenu de chez WAGES un crédit de 150000f qu’elle a remboursé sans difficultés. Elle sollicite un deuxième crédit pour acheter quinze (15) bidons de boissons locales.
Madame H. marie est mariée avec un monsieur  qui est actuellement à la retraite. Elle a trois(03) enfants à charge.
texts.en:
This young woman of 40 lives in the Agoè Légbassito neighbourhood of Lomé. She resells local drinks; she has been doing this in this same neighbourhood since 1985. Business is good because she has a lot of clients. She has previously borrowed from WAGES a loan of 150000f which she repaid without difficulty. She is asking for this second loan in order to buy 15 vats of local drinks. Marie H.'s husband is retired. She is supporting 3 children.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local drinks

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: Née vers 1954 à Ekpè à Sèmè-Podji dans le département de l'ouémé au Sud du Bénin, dame A. Pierrette est marié à FATON Bienvenu,spécialisée dans la préparation d'akassa depuis près de 25 ans , elle a ensuite complété la vente de Maïs.Confronté à une situation financière de plus en plus difficiles,elle sollicite ce crédit pour èxécuter la commande de ses clients et renforcer son activité
texts.en:
Mrs Pierrette A. was born in 1954 in the town of Ekpè à Sèmè-Podji located in the Oueme area in the south of Benin. She is married to Bienvenu Faton who has specialized in the preparation of "akassa" ( a corn flour dough served wrapped in leaves) for nearly 25 years. Pierrette has been selling corn which accompanies the sale of akassa. Confronted with an increasingly difficult financial situation, she is requesting this loan to meet the demands of he clientele and support her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 5 sacks of corn and 1 sack of akassa leaves

loans.name: Ahrullo

texts.en:
Ahrullo B. is 31 years old, married with two children. Ahrullo shoots videotape for wedding parties and other family occasions. He has been in this business for about 15 years now. Ahrullo tries to be creative in his job and, when shooting events and preparing the tape, he works as if making a movie for the  cinema. In the neighborhood, he is known as a very hard-working and diligent operator. He has many clients that makes the business successful and brings a stable income to his large family. 

Today Ahrullo is requesting 300 US Dollars for the term of eight months. He is planning to purchase a computer for his business. This is the first loan for Ahrullo and he would like to assure everyone supporting him that he will repay the loan in time and expresses his gratitude to everyone. 

---
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a computer

loans.name: Sampson

texts.en:
Sampson A. sells terrazzo chips. This is a special type of stone which is cracked into chips; it is a building material used for finishing a wall or floor due to its beauty. Sampson's work site is at Abrobeano near Elmina. Sampson has received senior high school education. He is married and has 5 dependents. His wife is a businesswoman.

Sampson has been selling terrazzo chips since 2003. He is responsible for meeting the family's basic financial needs and also paying the children's school fees. His loan will be used as additional capital to buy more terrazzo for re-sale to meet increasing demand. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to invest in his children's education.

In the picture he is seen sieving the chips.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more terrazzo for re-sale

loans.name: Chinels Euchéria

texts.fr:
Jeune dame de 27 ans, madame E. est très dynamique et vend des friperies.  Elle réside dans le quartier de Djidjolé où elle fait ce commerce depuis 2005, elle s’approvisionne au marché de Hedzranawoè. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de prêt de WAGES et demande ce premier crédit  pour acheter 80 chemise, 20 jupes, 15 pantalons.
Elle est marié à  monsieur ANTHONY anoumou qui est revendeur et ont 03 enfants. Avec les profits de ce commerce elle pense aider son mari à entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. E. is a very energetic young woman of 27 who sells used clothing. She lives in the neighbourhood of Djidjolé where she has been in business since 2005; she buys the clothing from the market of Hedzranawoè. She has never borrowed from WAGES and is asking for this, her first loan, in order to buy 80 shirts, 20 skirts, 15 pairs of pants. She is married to Mr. Anoumou Anthony who is a reseller and with whom she has 3 children. She will help her husband support their family with the profits from the business.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Shukrijon

texts.en:
Shukrijon B., 37, is the loving mother of two children. The elder son is already a student and the younger is going to school. Shukrijon and her husband are dreaming that their children will finish higher education. Shukrijon sells meat products such as sausages, boiled sausage, frankfurters, and dairy products, sugar, macaroni, etc. She has been in this business for a year.

Shukrijon is very polite and a cheerful woman by nature. That is why she has her bulk buyers which allows her to have a stable income for her family. Today she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300, as Shukrijon is planning to purchase more meat products in order to be ready for the festive season. She promises to repay the loan in 8 months. Shukrijon sincerely expresses her gratitude to all her lenders, wishing all of them a Happy New Year! Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength to achieve a better life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of meat products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Annie

texts.fr: D. Clanclounon Annie est veuve avec 3 filles, Chimène, 17, Cynthia, 14, and Mireille, 10, tous scolarisées. Elle est née le mi-aout 1967. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle commence son travail avec les verres à boires. Actuellement, elle vend les tissus de vêtements, les habits d’enfants, et les pagnes. Elle est ambulante, et elle achète ses produits au marché des Libanais. Elle utilise ses revenus pour payer les frais de scolarité. Dans le futur, elle veut ouvrir une boutique pour vendre ses vêtements.
texts.en:
Annie Clanclounon D. is a widow with 3 daughters; Chimene 17, Cynthia 14, and Mireille 10, all attending school. She was born mid August, 1967. Five years ago she started a business selling drinking glasses. Now she is selling clothing fabrics, children's cloths and pagnes (decorative cloth). She sells traveling door to door and she buys her products at the Libanais Market. She uses her profits to pay for her children's schooling. In the future, she wold like to open a shop to sell cloths.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloths for resale

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison T. produces soap and sells it at Abrobeano near Elmina. Harrison has received junior high education. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a businesswoman.

Harrison has been producing soap for sale since 2003. He is responsible for meeting the family's financial needs. His loan will be used as additional capital to buy more raw materials like soda, red oil, and others to enable him to increase production to meet increasing demand. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest back into the business to enable him increase his income.

On the table are some of the soaps he has already made.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more raw materials to produce soap

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Dame A. Akouavi est née vers 1968 à Cotonou, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants tous à sa charge et scolarisés. Elle vend des avocats aux bonnes dames  qui vendent du pain dans les écoles et à quelques voisins qui en expriment le besoin. Pour s'occuper les après midi après avoir livré tout son produit elle a crée un petit commerce de vente de biscuits et de bonbons.Pour répondre au mieux aux demandes de ses clientes et pour agrandir son petit commerce, elle a sollicité ce credit.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouavi A. was born about 1968 in Cotonou. She is a married mother and responsible for 2 school aged children. She supplies avocados to the ladies who sell bread in the schools and to several neighbors who have made requests. To occupy her time in the afternoon, after she has delivered all her products, she has started up a small business selling biscuits and candies. She is requesting this loan to better serve her clients and to increase her small business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 4 baskets of avocados and cartons of biscuits and candies

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received no formal education. Adwoa sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings home for processing and preservation, and then sends to the market for sale at Abrobeano near Elmina, a business she has been in since 1997. Her husband is a fisherman.

Adwoa uses her income to help her husband cover food and utility bills. Adwoa will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwoa plans to save towards further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale

loans.name: Sévérine

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, dame A. Sévérine s'est mariée à monsieur WHENON Abel et mère de un enfant, agé de 6 ans et en classe de CP. Elle vend du riz à la deventure de sa maison et parèllèlement à cette activité elle distribue des savons et fais la collecte des fonds tous les soirs Pour agrandir ses activités ,elle a sollicité un pret auprès de notre institution, ce qui lui a été accordé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Severine A. is 32 year old and is married to Abel Whenon. She is the mother of a 6 year old child who is in the first grade. She sells rice from the front of her house and she also has a business distributing soaps and collecting payment funds every evening. To increase her business, she is requesting a loan from our institition (microfinance), which has been approved.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice, oil, and fabrication of benches and tables

loans.name: N’Mondambe

texts.fr:
Dans la cuisine Togolaise, il y a deux choses qui sont les plus importants : la pate et le fufu.  La pate est préparée avec la farine de maïs, et le fufu est préparé par piler les ignames.  Madame K. est une revendeuse de ces deux produits importants : le maïs et les ignames.  Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour reconstituer son stock avec 7 tubercules d’igname et 6 sacs de maïs pour bien vendre au marché d’Agoè, un quartier au nord de la capitale du Togo.  
Madame K. est âgée de 36 ans et son mari est militaire.  Avec le revenu de ce commerce qu’elle a commence depuis 2004, elle aide son mari de soutenir leurs 5 enfants.
texts.en:
In Togolese cooking, there are two essential dishes: dough and fufu. The dough is made with corn flour and the fufu is prepared by pounding yams. Mrs. K. retails both of these important products: corn and yams. She is requesting this, her first loan, in order to rebuild her stock with 7 yam tubers and 6 bags of corn so that she can resell them in the market of Agoè, a neighbourhood to the North of the Togolese capital. Mrs K. is 36 years old and her husband is in the military. With the revenues from this business, which she has had since 2004, she helps her husband support their 5 children.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and yams

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr: dame H. Céline est née le 13 mars 1965 à sèmè podji, mariée à monsieur HOUSSA Simon, un retraité de l'armée béninoise. Elle est  mére de 04 enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Pour couvrir les dépenses de la famille elle a crée cet commerce de vente de poissons fumés. Les charges de la famille devenant de plus en plus lourdes à cause du niveau d'étude de ses enfants elle a associé à son commerce la vente  de mais et de farine de manioc puis la location de pousse pousse. Etant dans le manque de financement elle a fait reccours à notre institution.
texts.en:
Mr. Celine H. was born the 13th of March, 1965 at Seme Podji and is married to Mr. Simon Houssa who is retired from the Beninese army. She is the mother and responsible for 4 children, all of which attend school. To meet the family expenses she started a business selling smoked fish. As family expenses became heavier due to the children's higher education, she enlarged her business to include the sale of corn and manioc flour and the rental of push carts. Aware that she required additional financing, she has come to our institution (Alidé microfinance bank)

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 cartons of fish, 6 sacks of corn and 10 sacks of manioc flour

loans.name: Aicha

texts.fr:
Madame I. vend de pommade, d’insecticide, et de javel dans son domicile à Agoè, un quartier de la capitale du Togo.  Quelques fois, elle vend ces choses de manière ambulante aussi, afin de mieux servir ses clients.  Elle a commencé ce travail depuis 2002, et elle a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de 100,000 CFA ($200) au près de WAGES.  Elle a bien remboursé, et elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de pommade, 4 cartons d’insecticide, et 6 cartons d’eau de javel.  L’insecticide est un produit très utile contre le paludisme, et le javel est important pour toutes les taches du ménage. 
Madame I. est mariée avec un chauffeur et ils ont 2 personnes à charge.
texts.en:
Mrs. I. sells creams, insecticide, and bleach out of her home in Agoè, a neighbourhood of the capital of Togo. Sometimes, she also sells these items in the streets in order to better serve her clients. She started this work in 2002 and has already taken a loan of 100,000 CFA ($200) with WAGES. She has repaid the loan, and is now asking for a second loan to buy 2 boxes of creams, 4 boxes of insecticide, and 6 boxes of bleach. The insecticide is an import tool against malaria and bleach is used for all sorts of household chores. Mrs. I. is married to a driver and they are responsibe for 2 others.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy creams, insecticide, and bleach

loans.name: Fileratou

texts.fr:
Madame K. est une femme âgée de 49 ans qui achète les pagnes et tissus Bazin au grand marché de Lomé et les revend à Agoè, un quartier au nord de la ville.  Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle aide son mari qui est retraité pour soutenir leur enfant et payer les dépenses du domicile.  
Madame K. a commence ce commerce depuis 2001, et elle a une fois bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES.  Elle a bien remboursé ce premier crédit de 150,000 CFA ($300), donc actuellement elle a augmenté le montant qu’elle sollicite.  Avec ce second crédit, elle peut acheter les pagnes et tissus basin afin de mieux vendre et gagner un profit.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. is a 49 year old woman who buys traditional wrap-arounds and damask cloth in the main market of Lomé and resells them in Agoè, a neighbourhood to the North of the city. With the income she makes, she helps her husband who is retired to support their child and pay the household expenses. Mrs. K. has been in this business since 2001 and she has borrowed once previously from WAGES. She has since repaid her first loan of 150,000 CFA ($300), and therefore she has asked to borrow a larger amount. With this second loan, she will be able to buy wrap-arounds and damask cloth in order to have more sales and make a profit.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy traditional wrap-arounds and damask cloth

loans.name: Marguérite

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans, dame H. Marguérite est maitresse couturière de formation.  Mariée et mère de deux enfants, elle exerce son activité dans une boutique à coté de sa maison. Parallèlement a sa formation elle  vend des boites de conserve et des savons à coté de son atelier. Pour acquerir de nouvelle gammes de  ses produits et quelques fournitures de coutures, elle a fait reccours à notre institution.
texts.en:
Madame Marguérite H. is 36 years old and a trained master seamstress. She is married and the mother of two and works in a shop next to her home. Concurrent to dressmaking, she sells canned food and soap. To acquire a new range of products to sell and some sewing supplies, she has turned to our institution.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of canned food and soaps

loans.name: Minlibé

texts.fr:
Madame K. vend les céréales à Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Elle est née à Niamtougou, une des villes de Togo, et elle a commencé ce commerce à Lomé depuis 1998.  Elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES.  Du mais, haricots, et arachides qu’elle vend sont très important dans la cuisine local, donc elle a beaucoup de clients qu’elle doit servir.   Avec ce premier crédit, elle va reconstituer son stock afin de mieux vendre.  
Madame K. est mariée avec un officier de la police, et ils ont 3 enfants à charge.  Avec le revenu de son entreprise, elle aide son mari avec les dépenses du domicile.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. sells cereals in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She was born in Niamtougou, one of Togo's cities, and opened her business in Lomé in 1998. She has never borrowed from WAGES before. She sells corns, beans, and peanuts which are all very important in local cooking, therefore she has many clients. With this, her first loan, she will rebuild her stock to be in a better position to sell. Mrs. K. is married to a police officer and they care for 3 children. With the income from her business, she helps her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, and peanuts

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr: Née vers 1972 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'ouémé au sud du Bénin,dame AH. Albertine est originaire de le vallée de l'ouémé, mariée et mère de cinq enfants,elle est revendeuse des articles divers qu'elle va s'approvisionner au marché Dantokpa qui est le plus grands marché du bénin,en plus de la vente de ces articles, distribut des tissus en pérode de fête ,Pour faire face à la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, elle démande ce crédit pour faire face à la démande des clients,
texts.en:
Born around 1972 in Adjohoun, Ouémé County, in southern Bénin, Ms. Albertine AH. is originally from the Ouémé Valley. She is married and the mother of five. As a retailer of various goods, she is going to acquire supplies at the Dantokpa marketplace, the largest marketplace in Bénin. In addition to these goods, she distributes fabrics during holiday periods. To address the burgeoning customer demand, she is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy w boxes of milk, 2 boxes of spaghetti, and a box of couscous

loans.name: Echim

texts.en:
Ms. T. is a cook by profession. She lives in the village of Cetireni, along with her husband. Ms. T. worked as a cook in the school in the village, then she worked for nearly 2 years in Moscow. Because of the instability of jobs in Moscow, Ms T. returned to her own country. And because she has a lot of land, 3 hectares, and room for animals, she decided to grow pigs. Last year she sold 4 pigs, but she currently owns 15 pigs, 3 of the biggest pigs and 12 small pigs.

Ms. T. began to grow pigs about a year ago. She has requested a loan worth 10,000 lei, 5000 lei of which will be used to rebuild her pigpen (she wants to increase its size), and 5000 lei to buy feed for pigs, sheep, and cattle.

Pigs are kept till they reach the weight of 100-120 kg, bringing a price of 40 lei / kg. So a mature pig can bring in about 4000 lei. Expenditures for growing pigs and maintaining them are reduced, because she has agricultural land which mainly provides food for the pigs. At the end of the first year of ACTV, calculated, she will collect a cumulative net flow of 11,480 lei, and at the end of the second year's activity, the cumulative net flow will be worth 40,460.

Ms. T.'s business advantages are: a stable demand for pork at the market in Ungheni; reduced maintenance expenses for pigs; business may be released in small proportions (with small investments) and extended as possibilities appear; pigs easily accommodate the different technologies and increased exploitation.

loans.use: expanding her pigpen and buying feed

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.fr: Veuve H. Euphrasie est née le 08 mars 1960 à Dangbo,ayant à sa charge 04 enfants dont l'ainé est apprentit coiffeuse, la cadette aide sa maman à vendre  et les deux autres scolarisés. Elle vend de l'akassa et des poissons frits pour subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille. Actuellement sa fille cadette a laissé les bancs pour se joindre à elle dans la vente de l'akassa et des poissons frits et pour ce fait elle a fait reccours à notre institution.
texts.en:
Euphrasie H., a widow, was born on March 8, 1960 in Dangbo and has in her care four children. The eldest is an apprentice hairdresser, the youngest helps her mother in sales, and the other two are in school. Ms. H. sells "akassa" (a thick cornmeal porridge) and fried fish to provide for her small family. These days, her youngest daughter is out of school in order to join her mother in selling akassa and fried fish. This is why Ms.H. has turned to our institution.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy four sacks of corn and to build a small stall

loans.name: Adjoui

texts.fr:
Madame K. est une jeune coiffeuse avec un salon de beauté qui s’appelle « Blessing. »  Elle a commencé ce travail depuis 2007, et elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des tissages et mèches afin de mieux servir ses clients.  À Lomé, ces produits sont essentiels pour la mode des femmes.
Madame K. a 23 ans et elle est née à Lomé, la capitale de Togo.  Elle est mariée avec un huissier de justice et ils ont un enfant.
texts.en:
Ms. K. is a young hairdresser with a beauty salon called "Blessing". She started this work in 2007 and is requesting this initial loan to buy weaves and hair extensions to serve her customers better. In Lomé, these goods are essential in women's fashions. Ms. K. is 23 years old, was born in Lomé, the capital of Togo, and is married to a court bailiff. They have one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy weaves and hair extensions

loans.name: Komlan Gaston

texts.fr:
Monsieur N. est un homme âgé de 29 ans qui a pour l’activité l’exploitation d’un débit de boissons dans son domicile.  Il a commencé ce commerce depuis 2003 mais il n’a jamais bénéficié d’un prêt au près de WAGES.  Avec ce premier crédit il va reconstituer son stock de boissons.
Monsieur N. est né à Keve, une ville située 50 km de Lomé, la capitale de Togo.  Actuellement il habite à Lomé avec sa femme qui est couturière et ses 2 enfants.  Avec le revenu de son entreprise il peut soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. N. is a 29-year-old man who has a bar providing beverages out of his home. He began this business in 2004 but has never been the recipient of a WAGES loan. With this initial loan, he is going to replenish his stock of beverages. Mr. N. was born in Keve, a city located 50 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Currently, he lives in Lomé with his wife, a dressmaker, and their two children. With the income from his enterprise, he can support his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beverages for his bar

loans.name: Elom

texts.fr: Elom A.est un jeune home de 29 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il habite à Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de la capitale togolaise, Lomé. Il fait la pépinière des palmiers, une activité qui est très florissante, étant donné que la population vit en majorité de l’agriculture et sollicite ses jeunes plants. Il espère avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, accroître la taille de son activité afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. est un jeune home de 29 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il habite à Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de la capitale togolaise, Lomé. Il fait la pépinière des palmiers, une activité qui est très florissante, étant donné que la population vit en majorité de l’agriculture et sollicite ses jeunes plants. Il espère avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, accroître la taille de son activité afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Elom A.is a young man, age 29, married and the father of two. He lives in Lavie, a village located about 135 km from the Togolese capital, Lomé. He runs a palm tree nursery, a booming business given that most people make a living from agriculture and seek young plants. He hopes to use this second FECECAV loan to expand his business in order to meet the needs of his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy watering cans and to employ tenant farmers

loans.name: Amavi Kafui

texts.fr:
Née à Kouma Adame, une des villes de Togo, Madame A. est une revendeuse de charbon à son domicile à Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Elle a commencé ce travail depuis dix ans, donc elle est bien expérimentée, mais elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES.  Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permit d’acheter du charbon afin de reconstituer son stock.
Madame A. est une femme âgée de 54 ans.  Elle est marie avec un Ingénieur de Jeunesse et Sports et ils ont 2 enfants qu’ils soutiennent.
texts.en:
Born in Kouma Adame, a city in Togo, Ms. A. is a retailer of charcoal out of her home in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She started this work 10 years ago, so she has a lot of experience, though she has never been a recipient of a WAGES loan. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy charcoal to replenish her stock. Ms. A. is a 54-year-old woman married to a youth & sports engineer. They have two children to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Ablair Ayolao

texts.fr:
Née à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, Madame V. est une femme de 45 ans qui fabrique les vêtements qui sont prêt a porter.  Elle achète des tissues et pagnes et les utilise pour fabriquer les robes et habits pour les femmes.  Elle a ouvert sa boutique depuis 2007, et elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter les matériaux pour fabriquer les vetements afin de mieux servir ses clients.
Madame V. est marie avec un douanier et ils ont 2 enfants à charge.
texts.en:
Born in Lomé, the capital of Togo, Ms. V. is a 45-year-old woman who makes ready-to-wear clothing. She buys fabrics and 'pagnes' (colorful West African cloth) and uses them to make dresses and outfits for women. She opened her shop in 2007 and is requesting this initial loan to buy supplies to make clothing in order to serve her customers better. Ms. V. is married to a customs agent, and they have two children to look after.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and 'pagnes'

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn, beans, and peanuts for retail sale

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Née à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, Madame S. est une femme de 38 ans qui a pour l’activité la vente des produits génériques.  Depuis 2004 elle a exercé ce commerce dans le marché de Lomé, et elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de WAGES.  Actuellement, ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre de reconstituer son stock avec les produits génériques afin de mieux vendre et servir ses clients.  
Madame S. est mariée avec un électricien et ils n’ont pas d’enfant.
texts.en:
Born in Lomé, the capital of Togo, Ms. S. is a 38-year-old woman whose work involves the sale of generic pharmaceutical products. Since 2004, she has been in this business at the Lomé marketplace, and she has never been a recipient of a WAGES loan. The current initial loan she is requesting is going to enable her to replenish her stock with generic pharmaceuticals, so that she may do well in her sales and serve her customers. Ms. S. is married to an electrician, and they have no children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Kafui T. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de fruits et légumes à Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de la capitale togolaise. Son activité consiste à acheter ses marchandises auprès des cultivateurs et de les revendre sur le marché. Kafui espère avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son activité. Cette chance lui permettra de gagner plus et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kafui T. is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four. She is a retailer of fruit and vegetables in Lavie, a village located about 135 km from the Togolese capital. Her work consists in buying merchandise from growers and reselling it in the marketplace. Kafui hopes to use this loan to expand her business. This chance will enable her to earn more and to do better in providing for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit for retail sale

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es:
En la zona Villa Adela de a ciudad de  El Alto, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “El Paraíso”. Ellas están muy contentas de pertenecer a la familia de Pro-Mujer porque además de los préstamos   reciben capacitaciones para mejorar sus negocios.
Casi todas casadas y con numerosos hijos, no cuentan con la ayuda de sus parejas por distintos motivos, teniendo que ser responsables de sus familias.
Las actividades que realiza la asociación “El paraíso” son de todo tipo alguna de ellas tiene un pequeña tienda de abarrotes, otra actividad es la elaboración de Api (mazamorra de maíz) con pasteles, también se dedican a la venta de cosméticos y otros. La mayoría de ellas tiene un puesto fijo en distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto. Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para ampliar sus negocios y de esta manera generar mayores ganancias, que les permita cumplir con sus cuotas de crédito y obtener ingresos diarios para sus hogares.
texts.en:
The "El Paraíso" association is located in the city of El Alto, in the Villa Adela zone. The members are happy to belong to the Pro-Mujer family because apart from loans they also receive trainings in order to improve their businesses. The majority of the members are married with children; they don't rely on their husbands for varying reasons, and have taken on the mantle of providing for their families. There are various types of business within the "El Paraíso" association - some members have small grocery stores, others make Api (a sweet corn beverage) with pastries, and others sell cosmetics. The majority have a fixed location in various markets in the city of El Alto. They require major capital to expand their business and earn greater profits in order to make loan payments and generate daily income for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to expand businesses

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla T. détient depuis 5 ans un bar à Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Âgé de 45 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Komla souhaite avec ce crédit aménager le cadre de son bar et aussi approvisionner son magasin de différentes boissons afin de répondre aux goûts de la clientèle. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus de fonds pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
For the last five years, Komla T. has been holding a bar in Lavie, a village located 135 km from Lomé, Togo's capital. He is 45 years old, married and the father of two children. With this loan , Komla wishes to improve his bar's surroundings and also to stock his store up with different beverages in order to respond to his customers' tastes. This will allow him to earn more income to provide for his family's needs.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve his bar and stock up his store.

loans.name: Maliyama

texts.en:
Maliyama S. manufactures palm kernel oil for sale. This type of oil is used for a variety of things, including the making of soap, at Abura. Maliyama has received no formal education. She is married and has 5 dependents; her husband is a farmer.

Maliyama has been manufacturing palm kernel oil for sale since 2000. She assists her husband in the paying of utility bills and the children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to enable her buy more palm fruits for the production of the palm kernel oil on a larger scale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits for the production of the palm oil on a larger scale

loans.name: Sena-Kossi

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur âgé de soixante ans vit dans le quartier d’adidogomé, il est un exploitant de moulin à maïs, avec la farine de maïs obtenu, les togolais préparent de la pâte qui est une nourriture très appréciée dans ce pays , ce monsieur travaille durement pour pouvoir  soutenir sa famille, il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et demande son premier crédit pour pouvoir acheter du matériel électrique, l’entretien et les frais d’installation d’électricité pour son moulin.
Il est marié et sa femme est une revendeuse, ils ont ensemble sept (07) enfants qu’ils doivent entretenir.
texts.en:
This gentleman is sixty years old and lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé, he is the operator of a corn mill. With the corn flour, the Togolese prepare a corn mush that is a highly appreciated food in this country. This gentleman works hard to provide for his family, he has never received a loan from WAGES and is asking for his first loan to buy electrical equipment, to pay for the electric wiring of his mill, and for maintenance . He is married and his wife is a reseller, together they have seven (07) children to provide for.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Electric wiring of the mill

loans.name: Pajchani Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Pajchani” forma parte de la familia de  Pro-Mujer hace ya varios años, esta  se encuentra en la zona de Villa Tejada, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con 14 socias que  han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar y también universitaria, de los cuales muchos tuvieron que abandonar los estudios por falta de recursos económicos. Ahora el objetivo es, trabajar más para generar ingresos que les permita solventar los estudios académicos de sus hijos de esta forma asegurar su futuro.
 Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de fólderes de plástico, otras tienen tiendas de barrio, pero la actividad principal es la costura y confección de ropa, elaboran polleras (vestimenta típica de algunas regiones), centros de pollera, chamarras, mantas y otros, terminados los trabajos los comercializan en distintos puestos de la ciudad.
La asociación Pajchani” afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de materia prima para aumentar su producción,  así obtendrían  mayores clientes y por consiguiente mayores ganancias con el unico objetivo de mejorar la situación económica de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The “Pajchani” Association has been a part of the Pro Mujer Bolivia family for several years. The group is based in the Villa Tejada neighborhood of the city of El Alto and currently has 14 members. They have proven to be an organized group in terms of their loan repayments and internal activities. The majority of the group's members are married with school-aged children. Many have older children who have had to abandon their studies due to lack of economic resources. The group's current objective is to work more in order to generate enough income to pay for their children's education, thereby assuring them a better future.

Within the Association there are different businesses, including the sale of plastic folders and neighborhood shops. But, the main activity of the group is sewing and tailoring. They make “polleras” (traditional pleated skirts), jackets, ponchos, and other items which they sell in stands around the city.

The “Pajchani” Association will use this loan to buy the raw materials necessary to increase production. They will then be able to attract more customers and achieve greater earnings, helping them meet their ultimate objective of improving their economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu S. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through primary level. Salamatu sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Praso market near Abura, as she has done since 2006. Her husband is a teacher.

Salamatu uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the financial needs of the family. Salamatu will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Salamatu plans to invest in a building project she is embarking on with her husband for their family.

loans.use: to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale

loans.name: Rut

texts.fr:
Madame A. a vingt neuf (29) d’âge et réside dans le quartier d’adidogomé dans la ville de lomé, elle est très dynamique dans son activité qui n’est autre que le commerce de produits d’alimentation général. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES, la demande ayant augmentée elle sollicite son premier crédit pour répondre convenablement à la demande augmentée par l’achat de bidons d’huile, de sacs de riz, de cartons de savons et de cartons de sucre
Elle est mariée et son mari est un agent commercial. Ils ont  trois (03)  enfants et elle compte avec les profits tirés de ce commerce aidé son mari dans les dépenses du foyer.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. is 29 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in the town of Lomé. She is very dynamic in her business which is the sale of groceries. She has never received a loan from WAGES, but with the demand getting higher, she is requesting her first loan to properly meet the increasing demand by purchasing oil drums, bags of rice, boxes of soaps, and boxes of sugar. She is married and her husband is a sales representative. They have three children, and with the benefit from her business she hopes to help her husband with the family's expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for store

loans.name: Issah

texts.en: Issah S. operates a corn mill at Asem near Abura. Issah has received tertiary level education.  He is married and has 2 children. His wife is a businesswoman. Issah has been operating this corn mill since 2002. He is responsible for paying his children's school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. His loan will be used to buy another milling machine since the one he is using is giving him problems and making his work very slow. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest back into the business to increase his capital base to enable him buy spare parts for the milling machine.

loans.use: to buy another milling machine

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr: Dovi D. est un tient depuis 6 ans, à Lavie, un village à environ 135 kilomètres de la capitale togolaise, un restaurant de fufu, un plat qui tant apprécié par la population locale. Agée de 43 ans, Dovi est veuve et mère de 6 enfants. Cette activité étant sa principale source de revenus, elle souhaite avec ce deuxième crédit accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant des ignames et de la viande pour l’exécution de son activité. Cette opportunité lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dovi D. has been holding a fufu restaurant for 6 years, in Lavie, a village about 135 km form the Togolese capital. Fufu [yam based dough eaten with meat sauce] is a dish well appreciated by the local population. Dovi is a 43 year old widow, mother of six children. This activity is her principal source of income, and with this second loan she wishes to increase the size of her business by purchasing yams, and meat to carry out her activity. This opportunity will allow her to earn more money to provide for her children' s needs.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yams and meat to carry out her business

loans.name: Tchamélé

texts.fr:
Cette  dame de  trente huit ans vit dans le quartier d’adidogomé à Lomé la capitale du Togo, elle est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle exerce ce son commerce depuis 2004 et elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit  pour augmenter son stock de produits d’alimentation générale.
Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est un chef coutumier et ils ont ensemble  un enfant à charge .
texts.en:
Tchamélé E. is a 38-year-old woman living in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She sells groceries and has been running her business since 2004. This is her first loan request with WAGES, which she would like to use to increase her supply of general food products. She is married to a village chief and they have one child in their care.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general food products

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia S. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen. She brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale. She also owns a grocery store which she relies on when the fishing season is over at Asem near Abura. Sophia has received vocational education which is equivalent to senior high. She is a single parent and has 1 child.

Sophia has been selling fish since 2005. She is responsible for paying the daily expenses of the family, including utility bills. Her loan will be used as additional capital to buy more cartons of fish for re-sale and also increase the stock of groceries for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further expand her business to improve her income.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more cartons of fish for re-sale

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
El tejido Y bordado, a mano de chompas, para adultos y niños, es una de las actividades mas comunes dentro la asociación “Gaviotas” que trabaja en el centro focal  de Villa Tejada. Además  de esta actividad algunas también se dedican al bordado de manteles y tejido en macramé, Todas casadas han encontrado en Pro-Mujer la oportunidad de crear pequeños negocios, que les permite obtener ganancias suficientes para el sustento diario de sus familias. 
La asociación Gaviotas desea ampliar sus ventas con el fin de obtener mayores ganancias, para esto precisa mayor capital para la compra de prima.
texts.en:
Weaving and hand embroidery of sweaters for adults and children is one of the most common activities within the "Gaviotas" (Seagulls) association, which works in the center of Villa Tejada. In addition to this activity, some people also embroider tablecloths and sew macrame. All of the married women have found in Pro-Mujer the opportunity to create small businesses that allow them to earn sufficient income to support their families. The Gaviotas association wants to increase their sales to achieve greater profits, so it needs more capital to buy quality materials.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: More capital is needed to buy high quality materials.

loans.name: 6 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Seis de marzo” pertenece a la familia de  pro-mujer hace más de un año. Cada catorce días se reúnen en el centro focal Panamericana, de la ciudad de El Alto a la fecha el grupo  cuenta con quince miembros y que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, estos ayudan a sus padres en sus negocios ya que las ganancias solo cubren necesidades básicas y no les alcanza para contratar ayudantes. Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de comida, la venta  de ropa, venta de artículos para vehículos, pero la actividad principal es la venta de papa y verduras la comercializan en el mercado de la Ceja (zona central de la ciudad de el Alto) y en otras ferias de la ciudad. La asociación Seis de marzo necesita de  capital  para comprar productos en mayor cantidad, con la seguridad de ampliar sus ganancias para obtener estabilidad económica en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The "March 6th" association has belonged to the Pro-Mujer family for more than year. Every two weeks they meet in the Panamericana neighborhood in the city of El Alto.

The group currently has 15 members and they have proven to be an organized group in terms of their loan payments. The majority of the group members are married with children. The children help their parents with their businesses since the earnings only cover their basic necessities and do not provide enough to hire assistants.

The association includes different businesses such as food sales, clothing sales, and auto parts sales, but the primary business is the sale of vegetables and potatoes, which are sold in the Ceja market (located in the central zone in El Alto) and in other markets around the city. The March 6th association needs capital to buy larger quantities of products to increase their earnings and ensure that their households are economically stable.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase larger quanitities of products.

loans.name: Sawudatu

texts.en:
Sawudatu M. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Sawudatu operates a local restaurant which is popularly known as Chop Bar Hear, where variety of local dishes like fufu, which is made out of cassava and plantain pounded together, and others. Her chop bar is located at Addisadel near Siwdo, where she has worked since 1999. 

Her husband is a watch repairer. Sawudatu uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the financial needs of the family. Sawudatu will use the loan to purchase three bags of maize, five bags of cassava dough and other ingredients for the preparation of the food she serves at her restaurant. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sawudatu plans to invest in a building project she is embarking on with her husband for the family.

loans.use: To purchase three bags of maize, five bags of cassava dough and other ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Starting a small clothing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Start selling clothing in her community.

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo L. est âgée de 47 ans, marié et père de 7 enfants. Il réside à Lavie, un village à environ 135 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Cultivateur de profession, il espère par ce crédit accroître la surface cultivable en utilisant les métayers et aussi acheter de l’engrais pour enrichir le sol. Cette opportunité lui permettra d’accroître son rendement ce qui aura pour conséquences une augmentation des recettes et par conséquent une amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Kodzo L. is 47 years old, married and the father of 7 children. He lives in Lavie, a village about 135 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. A farmer by profession, he hopes this loan will help him increase his farm land by using sharecroppers and also buy fertilizer to enrich the soil. This opportunity will allow him to increase his yield, and consequently his revenue, which will improve conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for farming help and fertilizer

loans.name: Eugen

texts.en:
Eugen R. has been dealing with the provision of trucking services in construction for 7 years. He has a ZIL truck 4502, that does transporting of various building materials throughout the Republic of Moldova. The customer has other activities: R. Dina deals with the marketing of food products in shops in Criuleni City.

The loan is required to purchase winter tires. This business was initiated in 2001. In the past, Mr. R. has received three loans from Microinvest. Nine years of customer activity have proven that this business is profitable. The customer receives orders by phone. There are competitors in the market, but Mr. R.'s customers have been with him for many years. The monthly net income for this business is about 7000-8000 lei. Profit is directed towards expanding the business. Mr. R. wants to build a terrace onto the existing store, make repairs to his truck, etc.

loans.use: road transport of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bags of corn, beans and groundnuts for selling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase ingredients to produce empanadas; also to buy raw milk to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To provide a wider variety of products.

loans.name: La Purisima Group

texts.es:
Los miembros del g/s LA PURISIMA viven en el reparto camilo ortega de la ciudad de Nindiri a unas 5 cuadras de la sucursal de adim.  Son personas  bien expresivas y de trato muy amable.
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado mantener su negocio, manifiestan que con la ayuda de adim han mejorado las condiciones de su vivienda, negocio y de su familia, en la actualidad están en su octavo ciclo.
 Doña Mariza es la coordinadora del g/s,  comenzó su negocio con venta de golosinas y helados, en la actualidad tiene una mini pulpería que con ayuda de su esposo ha sacado adelante  compro una mantenedora para la ofertar gaseosa, hielo y helados  Este g/s ha participado en los talleres que desarrollo empresarial ha impartido,  el éxito de este g/s es la comunicación y solidaridad que ellas mantienen.
Dicen estar agradecida por que adim además de crédito las ha capacitado, lo que han aprovechado para el manejo exitoso de sus negocios
texts.en:
The members of g/s La Purisima association live in the Camilo Ortega village in the city of Nindiri, about five blocks from the Adim office. They are very expressive and very friendly people. With a lot of effort and dedication, they have managed to maintain their businesses and with the help of Adim they have improved their housing, businesses, and their families. Currently, they are on their eighth cycle.

Doña Mariza, the coordinator of the g/s, started her business by selling sweets and ice cream. Now, she has a small store. With the help of her husband, she has bought a cooler for sodas, ice, and ice cream.

This g/s has participated in business development workshops and its success is due to the communication and solidarity that they maintain. They are grateful because, in addition to a loan, Adim has given them skills, which they have used to successfully manage their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To provide a wider variety of products.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Señor de Huanca Village Bank. She is 40 years old and lives with her partner and their child. Carmen buys grains in Ayacucho’s Nery Market, then sells them in the city of Pisco, which is about seven hours from Ayacucho. Carmen works alone and rents trucks or trailers to transport her merchandise. She has had her business for the past fifteen years. 

Carmen is requesting a loan of 3,000 soles to buy more grains to bring to Pisco. Her goal for the future is to build her own home on a plot of land she owns.

loans.use: Buy grains to sell in Pisco

loans.name: Hilda Clenencia

texts.en:
Hilda Clenencia is a member of the Señor de Huanca Village Bank. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband and their two children, who are 15 and 12 years old. Hilda owns a dry goods store in Ayacucho and also delivers gas canisters (used for cooking) to local homes. She has been selling dry goods for more than 20 years, and just started distributing gas four years ago. She buys the canisters in from the factory in Lima, and sells each one for 32 or 33 soles, on which she earns three soles (US$1) in profits.

Hilda is requesting a loan of 2400 soles to buy more canisters of gas in Lima. Her goal for the future is for her two children to graduate from college with professional degrees.

loans.use: To buy canisters of gas

loans.name: Las Amistosas Group

texts.es:
El  g/s LAS AMISTOSAS se formo en el  barrio buena vista  una zona rural del municipio  de Masaya, por ser de escasos recursos económicos  no asistieron al colegio ya que desde temprana edad comenzaron a generar ingresos para su familia.
Doña Blanca comenzó vendiendo ropa usada por unidad, en todo el barrio con los créditos de adim ella en la actualidad compra por pacas lo que le genera mayores ganancias, las cuales las administra de una manera muy eficiente.
Este g/s esta en tercer ciclo y su crédito lo van a invertir en la compra de productos para aumentar sus inventarios
Doña Zoila vive con su mama la que le ayuda con la crianza de sus hijos mientras ella oferta los productos de ropa usada,  ya que es madre soltera, para el futuro quiere ampliar su casa de habitación para darles mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
Doña Guillermina tiene un comedor en su casa ella les prepara la comida diaria a los trabajadores del centro de salud y del ministerio de educación tiene clientela fija lo que le permite obtener ingresos permanentes. Ella quiere que en un futuro ADIM le de financiamiento para tener un local más grande.
texts.en:
The g/s LAS AMISTOSAS was formed in Buena Vista village, a rural area in the municiplaity of Masaya. Due to scarce economic resources, they did not attend school. At an early age, they began to earn income for their families.

Doña Blanca began selling secondhand clothing around the neighborhood. With the loans from ADIM, she now buys packs of clothing, which earn her more income and which she manages very efficiently.

This g/s is in its third cycle, and they are going to use their loan to purchase products that will increase their inventory. Doña Zoila lives with her mother who helps her care for her children while she sells secondhand clothing. Since she is a single mother, she wants to expand her house in the future and give her children a more comfortable home.

Doña Guillermina has a dining room in her home where she prepares daily meals for workers from the health center and ministry of education. She has a set clientele who provide her with permanent income. In the future, she wants ADIM to give her financing for a larger location.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to increase their inventory.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is a 30-year-old married woman with four kids; fortunately, the Government compulsory free education policy has helped her to send all her kids to school and they are in the primary level. She dropped out of school for lack of financial support. She decided to learn a trade to earn a living. She has now erected a stand in the marketplace of New Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi, where she has been selling bathroom slippers over the last six years. Even though the slippers are meant for bathing, others also use them for different purposes, such as for traveling, while others wear them for their errands. She said customers preferred the slippers because they are affordable. She has insufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress.

She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and large quantity of assorted slippers to upgrade her inventory. She will also use part to support her kids in school for their future career. She said she is going through challenges because she could not go to school but wants to see her kids fulfilling their dreams by helping through the proceeds from the loan. She said she would be grateful for that assistance. Akua belongs to the community group called ‘Obatanpa’, meaning Good Mother Trust group. The group members guarantee a loan through repayment pledges and support one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days, and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supply of bathroom slippers.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella O. is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children. Currently she has all her kids in school. Stella is an entrepreneur, and with lots of hard work she manages various businesses such as baking, selling costume jewelry, and selling ladies' slippers for the past 8, 2 and 6 years respectively. She sells in the community market of New Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi where she lives with her household.

Stella enjoys selling and it is through this that she obtains her source of livelihood. She is requesting this loan to purchase more baking materials such as flour, margarine, sugar, etc., slippers and jewelry to bolster her stock. Stella believes that she can make lots of proceeds from the businesses especially this Christmas season where lots of her customers buy in bulk, and it is her desire to save more to give her kids a better future through quality education.

Stella belongs to the community group called Philippians Trust Group. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, baking flour, etc.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is a member of the Bienestar (“Well-being”) Village Bank. She is 48 years old and married with three children.

Emerenciana owns two cars and a truck. She rents the two cars to drivers to use for inter-provincial passenger transport, and pays each driver 30 soles per trip (drivers typically make two trips per day). Her husband works for a local gas company, driving his truck to Lima and back to transport workers, equipment and machinery. He earns a fixed salary. Emerenciana and her husband have been working in transportation for ten years now.

Emerenciana is requesting a loan of 3600 soles to pay for replacement parts and new tires for her cars. Her goal for the future is to buy more cars and start her own transport company.

loans.use: Buy replacement parts and tires for cars

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret M. is 28 years old and married. She is the mother of three children; the two older ones are in school and the youngest is still breastfeeding. She lives in the village of Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi. The area is Ghana's source of minerals such as gold.

Margaret sells doughnuts and fried yams in her village. She fries doughnuts in the morning and yams in the afternoon, selling the fried yams with fish and pepper. Margaret's good taste in food has attracted lots of customers, who buy her food in the afternoon.

Margaret treks to farming communities to buy her stock of yams directly from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell the produce at higher prices. She plans to use this loan to buy yams, flour, sugar, and margarine in bulk so she can continue to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to save enough of her income to afford a good education for her children.

Margaret is a member of the community group Obatanpa Trust Group ("Obatanpa" means "good mother"). In this group, members support one another and guarantee each other's loans. She does not sell on group meeting days, so her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and margarine for her food business

loans.name: Dina Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Bienestar (“Well-being”) Village Bank. She is 39 years old and married with two sons. She sells clothing, Avon cosmetics, and perfume. She and her husband also own a car that they use as a taxi in the city of Ayacucho. She started selling Avon products three years ago, and began selling clothing just recently.

Mercedes is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy women’s clothing for the Christmas season. Her goal for the future is to buy a bus to use for inter-provincial passenger transport.

loans.use: Buy women's clothing for the Christmas season

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia A. is a petty trader who trades in yams in the community market of Obuasi in Ghana. She is 40 years and married with four kids, all of whom are in school.

Sophia treks to Techieman, a farming community, to buy from the farmers and retail to her customers. She wants to use this loan to buy more supplies of yams to serve her customers. She dreams of expanding her business to include additional foods, such as plantain and cassava, to meet the needs of her customers and make increased income. She said with the loan, she can make enough profit to stock her inventory when there are price hikes. She also wants to save part to keep her kids in school.

Sophia is a member of the community group Obatanpa Trust Group ("Obatanpa" means "good mother"). In this group, members support one another and guarantee each other's loans. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bulk tubers of yam from local farming communities

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Bienestar (“Well-being”) Village Bank. She is 50 years old and married. She has six children and a number of grandchildren. Maura sells dry goods like rice, sugar, and flour from a stand in a local market. She has had her stand for the past three years.

Maura is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy more rice. Depending on the variety of rice, a sack costs between 112 and 143 soles, so she would be able to buy between seven and nine sacks of rice with her loan. She also sells soaps, cookies, and a variety of other items, so she may buy five or six sacks of rice along with other miscellaneous items.

Maura’s goal for the future is to continue working and improve her business.

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin B. is fifty years old. Benjamin is a father of four children who are currently in the basic school. He lives in a rented apartment with his family in a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana called Obuasi. Benjamin loves trading a lot, the business through which he supports his family with income. He sells food items such as maize, rice, yam, etc in the market square in his community. He says that he also distributes to some food vendors and restaurant operators. He has been in business for six years. Benjamin says he buys his stocks from the farmers in his community and those in nearby towns. He wants a loan to buy the stocks in bulk so that he can distribute to more customers. Benjamin is a member of a group called Philippians in his community. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to be able to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of maize, yam and rice.

loans.name: El Manzano Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario EL MANZANO  viven en el Km. 21 carretera Masaya Managua,  sus negocios están ubicados en su casa de habitación y de ahí parten a vender de manera ambulantes en los mercados de Managua y Masaya 
Son de procedencia humilde, sus casa son modestas y bien ordenadas, son vecinos y por tal motivo se unieron para formar un grupo y ser sujetos de créditos , los productos los compran por mayor en el mercado oriental, Doña Lilliam  inició su negocio de venta de ropa con la ayuda de su hermana mayor la que la llevaba desde pequeña a los mercados cuando contrajo nupcias su esposo le ayudo con un capital menor para iniciar su negocio, en la actualidad con la ayuda de adim ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo,
 Junto con el crédito ADIM al g/s lo han capacitados  lo que les ha servido para superar sus temores e inseguridades y a sentirse capaz de enfrentar la vida. 
Todo el g/s  en un futuro cuenta con ampliar su  negocio Para alcanzar su sueño se propone continuar cumpliendo con sus cuotas y tratar de ahorrar  de sus ganancias para ir mejorando su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the El Manzano lending group live off of km. 21 of the Masaya-Managua auto route. They are neighbors who have united to form a group eligible for credit. They are of humble origins but while their homes may be modest, they are clean and well kept. Their businesses are based in their homes, where they make everything they sell as vendors at the markets of Managua and Masaya. Thanks to the loans they have received from ADIM, El Manzano's members have been able to overcome their feelings of insecurity and financial uncertainty and finally feel able to take control of their lives. Doña Lilliam, for example, has been working in the markets since she was a child, selling clothes with her older sister. When Lilliam married, her husband gave her a little money so that she could start her own clothing business, but it is only currently, with the help of ADIM, that she truly has access to working capital. With these loans, each member of the group hopes to see their business grow. Additionally, they would like to invest in improving their houses, but this is a long term goal. In order to achieve their dreams, they will continue to make punctual payments on their loans and save what they can from their incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital, business expansion

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is 35 years old. She is married with five kids and lives with her family in New Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Esi sells eggs in her neighborhood. She balances her stock of eggs on her head and moves around to sell. She says the price of eggs has almost doubled over the last few months--an increase in bird attacks in some of the poultry farms where she gets her daily supply have forced her to travel very far at additional cost to purchase eggs. With the loan, she wants to buy more crates of eggs to avoid the constant price hikes. She hopes to save more income to support her kids in school.

Esi is a member of the Kingdom Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to obtain loans and support one another in repaying the loans. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs

loans.name: Marianela

texts.en:
Marianela is a member of the Bienestar (“Wellbeing”) Village Bank. She is 30 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their son. Marianela and her husband sell foodstuffs like rice, sugar, and oil. They buy the items in the Santa Rosa Market in the city of Ayacucho and bring them to the Ayacuchan jungle in her sister’s truck, where Marianela sells them wholesale to distributors. She has been in this business for three years now.

Marianela is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to buy more rice, sugar, and oil in bulk. Her goal for the future is to build a home of her own, using her FINCA savings. (She currently lives with her in-laws.)

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and oil in bulk for re-sale to distributors

loans.name: Irma Aurora

texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Bienestar (“Wellbeing”) Village Bank. She is a 42-year-old single mother and has two children, both boys, who are 10 and 6 years old. Irma sells prepared meals in the market. She sells chicken soup, fixed-menu lunches and side orders, and works from 3am to 2pm. She has had this business for about three years now.

Irma is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy rice, pasta, and oil in bulk. Her goal for the future is to build a home on a plot of land she owns in a town outside of Ayacucho; she currently lives in a makeshift shack on her land.

loans.use: Buy bulk rice, pasta, and oil

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi M. is 47 years old. He is married with five children. Currently all the kids are in school. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted varieties of cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits etc. in the local market. He wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted spices, and washing soaps and powders, etc. to expand his business.

Kofi M. hopes to make a good income from the expanded business to enable him to provide the children with quality education. He belongs to the community group called ‘Obatanpa Trust Group’. This means 'Good Mother'. The group members guarantee a loan through their repayment pledge and assist one another to repay the loan. Kofi said he would be grateful for your support to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis tiene    27 años, vive en pareja con  Luján que tiene 25 años. Conviven juntos hace 5 años y no tienen hijos aún. Ya poseen casa propia que han logrado adquirir con esfuerzo y dedicación.
Derlis posee un negocio de venta de calzados en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Itá. El negocio funciona hace 8 años. Su compañera es docente y ejerce en dos escuelas, una privada y otra pública.
Derlis desde muy joven se dedicó al comercio, anteriormente realizaba sus ventas en forma ambulante, luego gracias a su esfuerzo logró comprar un pequeño puesto en el mercado municipal y fue surtiéndolo de a poco.
Actualmente el negocio de Derlis está muy bien surtido con calzados de todo tipo como ser: zapatos de vestir para damas y caballeros, calzados deportivos y zapatillas.

Sus ventas han ido aumentando considerablemente con el transcurrir de los años y ha formado una muy buena clientela en todo este tiempo.
No se queja de su suerte y afirma que el negocio le rinde muy buenas ganancias. Con el apoyo incondicional de su compañera ha logrado salir adelante.
En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías debido a que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y desea adquirir mayor variedad de calzados para damas y caballeros así como también calzados deportivos y zapatillas.
texts.en:
Derlis is 27 years old and lives with his couple Lujan who is 25 years old. They live together for 5 years now and have no kids yet. They have their own house which was acquired with effort and hard work. Derlis works selling shoes at the municipal market in the city of Ita for the past 8 years. His couple is a teacher and she works in two schools, one private and one public school. Derlis started working on sales very young, he used to sell things on the street, later with his hard work, he was able to buy a spot in the municipal market and kept on supplying it. Currently his business has very good inventory with dress shoes for ladies and gentlemen, sport shoes, and sandals. His sales have increased with time as well as his clients during all these years. He can't complain on his good luck and the business is profitable. And with his couple's support he has been able to succeed. Right now he needs a loan to buy more merchandise because of the year end holidays and to diversify his stock of ladies and gentleman's shoes, as well as sport shoes and sandals.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ladies and gentleman's shoes, sport shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis A. is 29 years old, married, with four children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. She deems this a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She also wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her inventory.

Mavis hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children's education. Mavis belongs to the community group called Ephesians Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral for the loan and support one another to repay the loan. Mavis does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina M. started selling fish twenty-six years ago in new Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi where she lives. Georgina prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She is now 44 years old and married with two children, who are currently in school.

Georgina wants to use the loan to buy more assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her children's education and her business's growth. She belongs to the community group called Ephesians Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish for re-sale
